ZjeOGGBEy-eD56bITFM43A.text: Fat Heads beer is awesome. I had the wings which as always were great ... but the mushrooms were incredible.

cSNo00hTG2nec5O07uZ0ew.text: I've loved Fat Heads for a long time. So long in fact that my name is forever engraved on one of the signs in the bar (a dual effort with the BF in drinking far too many delicious brews). This is finally the declaration of my affection.   When people ask me where they 'must go' in Pittsburgh, Fat Heads is always in my top 2. It is hands down the definition of Pittsburgh food, next to the other in my top 2, oh-glorious-one Primanti's. Portions are HUGE, and I've never had anything I did not like. Go with a Headwich, wings, or a salad. And start with a soft pretzel. The house-made honey mustard that comes for dipping is what dreams are made of.   They also brew their own beer, and have been doing quite successfully at national competitions. The HeadHunter IPA has won a ton of awards. They're super cool about giving you a couple samples to see what you like - so don't be intimidated and do something stupid like order a Miller Light, or I am totally going to shoot you the stinky eye from down the bar. They also carry Arsenal Ciders now, and more than 40 other great craft draft selections on a rotating basis.   I can honestly say when I left Pittsburgh for a couple years (sinner, I know), the first place I hit when I came back was always Fat Heads. And it always will be.

2zbdsfOXg-d3mxXYdYe4kg.text: Really enjoyed this place. Great environment. We had fried pierogis, the Big Dipper and the tuna sandwich. Very good, quick food.

CiXCWFDNRxrZgP5zuFzowg.text: The "headwiches" are awesome - huge, tasty sandwiches. The homemade chips they serve with them are excellent as well. Very much a bar atmosphere but incredible food. They also have takeout if you call ahead. Parking can be tough, especially on a weekend night. This is my favorite place in Pittsburgh to grab a sandwich. If you're looking for an appetizer, the loaded fries (complete with a fried egg on top) will serve a table of four.

71-TABrk6v46KmmOJT08TA.text: Fat Heads could be called go big or go home.  Portions are amazing.  I live the grilled wings are great beer selection.  Bloody Marys are spectacular.   Big ass sandwiches.  Yum. So sit back relax and enjoy the ride you can have it all at Fat Heads.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outdoor dining

TMeXcpYG-vhSKBOAMUzFFQ.text: Really enjoy this place. You get a lot of food for the money, and they have a ton of beers to choose from. If you haven't had them before, the smoked wings are awesome, they are priced decently and they are a whole wing.

c2TmR5ypoP8iq4SDb6eqrg.text: Amazing sandwich and great beer!  Had the "chicken little" sandwich at the suggestion of our server and loved every bite!  Quite possibly the best sandwich I've ever had.  Will definitely return on a trip to Pittsburgh soon.  Referred to the restaurant by several people in the Pittsburgh area during a business trip.  They didn't steer me wrong!

1EqVPQhXz0Mj_DkWD8L-Pw.text: Huge meals. Great beer. Would love to swing by again the next time I'm in The Burg.

hoZ0ENC8zBnyCW8W7c1OMw.text: I have been here a couple of times and honestly I was never really impressed by this establishment despite the huge selection of beers, burgers and sandwiches. Certainly the burgers are a must-order here but they are so huge and heavy that I feel quiet uncomfortable for almost a day after eating them.  A lot of greasy food but I guess you should expect that when you come to Fat Heads.  It is definitely I nice spot though to get a beer (one of the many they have) and watch a sport's game, with good service!

IhhX1xYRa4f6sgldsESoKw.text: Best food on the S. Side of Pittsburgh. Great beers, monstrous sandwiches, great wings. All time favorite. Word of warning however,  due to popularity,  be prepared to wait an hour for a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. As seen from a table looking towards bar.

RqKggt4MZYDYfGj7cfkdaQ.text: Came here on Saturday night just after 9pm and it was packed! We (4 of us) had to put our names down and wait for a table so we waited at the bar. Even though it was packed, service at the bar was quick and friendly (say hi to Apple!). 35-40mins later we finally got our table. We ordered the Mo Betta Beef Headwhich (O-M-G so tasty! so full meat! nom nom nom), 20 garlic parm wings (very parm-y, large wings - so if you're eating these as an app for 1, get the smallest amount), perogies (they were good but I like pan-fried better....these tasted like phyllo wrappings), and hot peppers (also very good! and very spicy). We shared everything so we can get a taste of different things on their menu. Table service was fast & efficient. No problems at all at this place. I'd def come back here for the Mo Betta Beef again!  Then if you have some room left in you; you can go upstairs to their "beer store" which consists of many types of beers that you can mix & match. If you get a 6-pack, you get $12 off the total price. Plus if you ate at the restaurant I think you get another 5-10% off. Seriously.  (I love America!)

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-U5yKVzlCO5aSF-MB9kcCw.text: What can I say.. Food was good, staff was good, decor was good all was great! I must say though that the floor is slippery.. . sounds weird but True. Is it worth waiting forever NO!... Go on off peak times for a better experience. Both parking and eating.

gTz-YBuXbBHbazIemdh8iA.text: By far the best place on Carson St.  The staff is friendly and cool.  Beer selection is great.  They have their own beer which is pretty darn good as well as craft beer from around the country.    The tuna taco is amazing.  Best I've ever had.   This is the spot in this neighborhood.

Lwzrmbd6r0My2HWeyFM_Eg.text: If you want to go on a eating binge the. This is the best place. Try mo betta chedda.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9J4eLAsPi4GoNEKuPqxcAA.text: Who doesn't love fat heads? I always start off with the bumble berry beer! My all time fav! I then stare at the mile long list of "headwich" options before I finally decide on one, the portabella is probably my favorite! Great place to go with friends or family. Expect a wait during lunch or dinner times.

TNG2usFaqCdbR64UrP8M4Q.text: lived in Pittsburgh for years and it's consistently my favorite place to go and to take people when they visit... they got a new menu recently which I was upset to see them lose the veggie burgers and the taco salad, but still so many amazing options. Loved the idea of habanero infused pickles and they were good, but $5 for a side order of them was kinda silly. Beers (Bumbleberry) hitting the spot as always. *Pittsburgh Classic*

9MRcSFeES8FMab63q8tT0Q.text: Holy humungous salad.  Holy humungous sandwiches.  I ate salad until I was full then took it home and ate it for the next day at lunch and STILL had a ton left over.  The steak salad is covered in cheese smothered steak, with secret layers of fries and peppers and mushrooms and cucumbers...it was like I was digging for buried treasure.  Another plate may have been in order, but I didn't ask.  Needless to say, it was VERY good.    This wasn't the first time I had been here so...  Other memorable food items: the fried mushrooms are a huge huge pile of fried goodness.  The wings are good - not the best ever (but I am a bit picky) - but I'd put them top 25% of my favorite wings.  The only strange thing I remember is that the nachos are prepared with their homemade potato chips, NOT tortilla chips.  Maybe you're into that, but I was disappointed and sad.    The chicken parmesan soup is really good, as is the french onion.  Their burgers are juicy and wonderful. My husband always gets some crazy sandwich with egg, and while I tend to like my eggs for breakfast, he always seems to enjoy them.  I'm not looking at a menu now, but I recall something along the lines of something called Southside Slopes that my husband really really loved.    All in all, if you like sandwiches of every kind and want to try more, Fat Head's is your bar.

ISfruz30jsnfynpE4e5Z-A.text: A wide selection of beers on tap, about half of them are their own. Really good sandwiches, interesting and creative combinations. On Wednesday and Thursday, their Fatwiches, which comprise about half of their sandwiches, are half-price after 10, but the kitchen closes between 11 and 12. Ding confine yourself to the Fatwiches, they have other excellent sandwiches, but try some of them, they're pretty fun.

XIwXM4Hn_1MZgRV0hWduAw.text: Great fun place. The portions are huge. So big their sandwiches are called headwiches because they're larger than your head. Pulled pork is very good as well as the burgers.   Also a great place for craft beer lovers. They have a wide selection as well as their own brews. The bumbleberry is so good. Even comes with blueberries in the glass.   The wait can get pretty long though. Try to go at an off time if you mind a long wait.

EHNKcpxtI-iQvybwwxcBzQ.text: A little pricey.  The chicken sandwich was good but could have used more ingredients like the chicken and cole slaw.  It was too much bun for the ingredients

by7imKQ-pGBSldrMWar5rw.text: One of the best beer selections, and one of the best burgers I've had. Go with the Renee burger. Tons of mushrooms and cheez whiz!

W-pClw02N0cb3-oQP3HSsQ.text: OH MAN.  Forgot how good this place is and how awesome their Head Hunter IPA is.  Came here after long day of doozies and was expecting to have to wait forever.  Was so wrong, it was so quick and fun waiting for our table.  Despite the crowd at the bar we got our head hunters very quickly.  We decided on the bacon cheese fries and a headwich.  Splitting the Headwich was definitely the way to go, we got the Beer Camp Part Deux which was sauerkraut, keilbasa, cheese and peorogies piled onto a roll the size of my head.  We knew what were getting into though with the headwich and it was awesome.  The mountain of bacon cheese fries that came out though was a little bit intimidating.  At at first with cold cheese sauce on it which was a bust, but when they brought it back the bacon was sizzling and the cheese sauce was steamy.  Luckily we had some help of friends who stopped in, but still barely made a dent.  Good times, easy,  consistent, nice service.

kzhHBANkO_r7oaj1-x4AbA.text: Fatheads is a great back on the Pittsburgh South Side.  The beer selection is amazing, and the sandwiches are huge!!    This is a must see when in town!

ydv4nxII-LCa8dLttL_Xqw.text: Fat Heads is awesome - huge portions of tasty food at very reasonable prices.  I went here for lunch and just had water to drink, but their beer menu looked very extensive and seemed to include quite a few different things.  I had the chicken spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer and the beauty and the beasty HEADWICH.  Yep, they're called headwiches, probably because they're as big as your head.  Anyway, everything was delicious, and the beasty sauce on the sandwich was spicier than I expected, which was a pleasant surprise.  The sandwich came with their chips, which you can tell are homemade.  I thought the chips needed some salt, but once I added a bit they became fantastic.  Highly recommended - I'll be coming back here next time I'm in Pittsburgh!

wdjDina64JCdHgg_0Xg8Hw.text: Fat Heads is not a place to go if you're on a diet but man is it good.  They also have a bottle shop upstairs.  I always go for a headwich and have had several. My favorite is the cool colossal and the artery clogger.  Can't substitute their chips for anytthing else but outside of that I have no complaints.    Expect long lines on weekends.  Well worth the wait.  Excellent beer selction.

FNtGdSit4zES6VxSNgkyFQ.text: The portions are huge (including the salads), and the service is good.  The atmosphere is always lively, but they have an outdoor area for a quiet lunch or quiet early dinner.  Just make sure that you are hungry when you go, because you will definitely be full when you leave.

h-zOz_6deOmk03wVhJUvag.text: A Pittsburgh favourite and mine as well!  Fat Heads has one of the best selections of beer on tap and their food never ceases to amaze me.  I've come here over a dozen times and always order a different sandwich and always love it.  Also great for sporting events (as are most places in Pittsburgh) but Fat Heads tends to get a bit crowded with a long wait.  Their beer prices can be a bit pricey for Pittsburgh as well.  Of course their wings are up to Pittsburgh standards and would recommend trying their plethora of flavours.  The Southside Slope Headwich is a must try, however be warned you may need some help finishing this massive sandwich that could feed a family.  My personal favourite is the Beefed Up sandwich.  The combination of the banana peppers and the swiss cheese are a pleasant mix.

OatBliI-yoHKWp0gtdAxeA.text: Fat Heads was worth the hour long wait on a Saturday night because the beer selection was excellent, and the food was great, too.  Definitely worth coming back to.

rpgwyUqGdFsFvzPrDCOuDw.text: This is one of few places I refuse to go. I've been there twice and both times, the food has been so bad that I've sent it back. (Which I never do!)  They offer pretty standard bar fare. The first time, I got this chicken/spinach/artichoke dip, and the second time I got pepperoni rolls. They were both just inedible messes. Maybe I should give the wings or an entree a go, but I just don't feel like taking my chances anymore on Fat Head's.

zEs-suiOrvQy8fMKu7Yhrg.text: A wall full of taps with enough beers to keep you interested for months at a time. A bottle shop upstairs that all of the good stuff. A menu with the full gamut of Pittsburgh food. Sport on the TV.  Yeah, it's good. What's that, four different varieties of "buffalo chicken" sandwiches? Gigantic deli meat sandwiches with all manners of pork products and names like the "artery clogger"? Humorous in-jokes throughout the menu? Chips? Fries? Only thirteen different kinds of wings? GOSH!  Really, it very well could be worthy of five stars if it weren't for the persistent firesh**s that come with the territory. Oh well, it's still worth it in the end.

RpwHEwey12F8WFkRoxX7DQ.text: Excellent Food!!! Great Beer Selection!!! I think that this is a must go Pittsburgh restaaurant. It has a relaxed bar atmosphere and friendly service.

2Glog__be4clvuE-365JNw.text: Great beer selection.  Food was worth the hour wait.  The chicken little was not so little.  If I was not traveling this could easily been 2 meals.

3Gu2KAH5Am5XOa6bHTDy_g.text: my favorite place for good food and great beer!!!!

EcYYZXLwdgY_kYmEHmYSQw.text: Umm absolutely awesome. Food is awesome, love the house brewed beer. Not a wonder why it is a nationally recognized place. Owns up to it. This place is the pittsburgh persona spot on.

6Nxot0C83b7O8qBRswQ_nA.text: Great food, wide selection of beers ( even a tasty berry flavored one for a non-beer drinker like me!!!) Our server was friendly and accommodating, but very busy... So relax and enjoy the company your with and possiabily make new friends while you wait...  :)

gIMK2G38EzubSFMAkdKs6w.text: I had the Mighty Fine Bovine, really tasty.  Great beer selections (if you expect Budweiser stay home).  very diverse food and beer choices!

5JYuQ9oiUvWOgWcykyIDcQ.text: WooHoo. There's no place like home. I got the South Side slopes. It was really good. The service was nice. Waitress was kind enough to break our checks down for us (because clearly we would not be eating together unless we were working/forced to). Nice outdoor patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. SouthSide Slopes 3
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. SouthSide Slopes 2
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. SouthSide Slopes 1

r-oSoYMPqkZBLVLu3Dg9Rw.text: I thoroughly enjoyed this place. I loved the Peach beer drink thingy, I don't remember what it's called but it was damn good! My bf got the killer wings, and to him they tasted like regular buffalo wings... the heat wasn't all it was cracked up to be. I ordered the veggie sub, which was good. I just didn't like french fries on my sub, it was more mind over matter. It made me feel like a fat heffer. My sub needed some better seasoning - add Goya seasoning por favor! I did like my pierogies, which I've ordered from here before. My bf got the cheese steak and on a scale of :( 1-10 =) he gave it an 8. My friend has always gotten the Aloha Chicken and she's never ordered anything else.   It's a good place if you're about to get your period, or if you're just in the mood to gain 10lbs in one sitting. The beer was really good too!

9LM4h_pVR6dopKfxzq_-nA.text: Hands down the best sandwich in Pittsburgh is the South Side Slopes Headwich. Yum! Fun atmosphere too.

nhn6NLs6mFJd8HG8P3wGZQ.text: I would first like to say, this place did not match the "hip/grunge" neighborhood that it is a part of, it is far more commercial in style and design.   NOW, that being said, if you like good food, a nice inviting place, and beer, GO HERE! I had the Renee's burger.  It one of a few burgers that are named after the owner's daughters.  It was quite good.  The meat is LOVELY, well seasoned, you could tell. I had the Framboise beer.  Its a favorite of mine, and often hard to fine on-tap.  Its a French raspberry beer.  If you aren't a regular beer drinker, its a great one to try.

ED6VSjRdEUgl8PSyZnnsxQ.text: A family visit to Fatheads Saloon...  We arrived and were greeted and seated promptly, and our waitress was prompt to greet us and get our drinks to the table. While the restaurant atmosphere is kid friendly, there is no kids menu. My kids are old enough to share and enjoy something off the kids menu, but for kids under 5 this may be an issue. Our service was great, our poor waitress had to check back with us at least 3 times before we were ready to order because there are so many choices it's really difficult to decide.  What we ate:  Order of fries: there was a good mix of crunchy, perfectly done and a little soggy for every fry preference, and the basket has tons of fries.  Order of chicken tenders: we ordered these for the kids to share. They were fine, nothing to write home about but glad they had them for the kiddos.  Plain cheeseburger: one of my kids is super picky, so a plain burger was all he wanted. The party was super thick and it looked like it would be an amazing base for one of their fancy burgers from the menu back page.  Bay of Pigs: hubby says it was yummy, with a touch of spicy. There was pulled pork, ham and pickles it was stacked high and he really enjoyed it.  Bovine Devine: I honestly don't even really know what was stacked on this huge sandwich, but it was delicious. I could've used a smidge more sauce, but it was delicious nonetheless.  Chips come with the sandwiches and they are homemade yumminess.  We also enjoyed 2 glasses each of beer, Headhunter for hubby and Bumbleberry for me. We both thought the drinks were delicious, and loved that we were able to grab a cold 4 pack for the road.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bovine Devine
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bay of Pigs

cgIgcX8Ru_R3OXbRNICZTg.text: We are from out of town, first experience with a restaurant in PA. The service was ok, the fish and chips was not good. We ordered the fried pickles which were pretty stand up. The only bad thing I have to say about this establishment was my fiance slipped and fell on her hip because fry's were on the floor. I was livid. Then a server came up to her and said " I can't walk in heels when I'm drunk either "   FIRST OFFFF, she was not drunk she had two ciders with her meal. I will not be back to this establishment. I'm Irish, I love potatoes, but these fry's were not worth falling for.

7lUoPlK8xJUsI8NulQpPGg.text: Great hot food! Good service! Great beer selection! Good environment. Long wait on the weekends.

mmxuZqBt1vjxJMEzJBGzCQ.text: I have been to fat heads a number of times and was never impressed with the food until today. I had the chicken dance sandwich which has a good spice to it and homemade pickles, it was delicious! The waitress was very attentive as well. I found a go to menu item today that I have been wanting more of all day!

58_5HRiFITND05_xvJotlA.text: Fat Heads is a must try if you're visiting the Pittsburgh area! Service was fast and friendly and you can't go wrong with the food selection - started with some pierogies and finished off with these beastly sandwiches (seriously, one is called "the beauty and the beasty")... the portion sizes are insane. The tap selection is not too bad either... would definitely recommend if you're looking for some good eats in the Pittsburgh, PA area!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Beauty and the Beasty and the Pulled Pork Chilli burger from Fat Heads in Pittsburgh, PA!

zqmCXjE4oIkVQBxS_UrohA.text: Great sandwiches with piergoies and French fries are not frozen but hand cut. So amazing. They have a great selection of food. The service is decent but it can get very busy though.

OntgbWbAhnNRb_diqUHJwQ.text: So disappointed in the French dip...fatty dry..no flavor.our server was great ( on a positive note) this is the 2nd time that I've had. A bad experience..I won't go back

Q6edOT3uV0MaUCg55YH7cA.text: Always a go to when we go to the 'Burgh. Fried mushrooms are amazing and I've never had a bad sandwich there. I love the Kelsey Burger. Had the wings last night with Smoky BBQ and they were delicious. Have to get a spicier choice next time though. Beer selection - even beyond FatHead selections - is filled with quantity and quality. Great place to eat.

CvIl7erCCjtAZLWrFbTXbg.text: I have been here a couple times and when I first walk in I always think the interaction with the host is strange.  We walked in for lunch and said table for two and the host looked at us strangely and asked what can I do for you? I wanted to say my taxes....   Anyway after we got seated the service was really good with our waitress Jen.  She brought our food quickly and checked on us frequently.    My favorite beer is the bumble berry especially with the fresh blueberries.  I also like the fall beers they currently have on tap.     The sandwiches are huge and there's two of you you can probably share.   I had the Ruben and the corn beef was delicious.

UlcA3IGB3DPBmeKmVlGigg.text: This was my first experience st Fatheads, and we definitely enjoyed it! The dining room area is small, so I certainly see how the wait time can increase to over an hour. We arrived right around 11 when they opened, and were seated immediately.  Our waitress was helpful and friendly. They have a  mix of their own brews as well as a variety of guest taps. I had the bumble berry (blueberry and honey) and I really enjoyed it!   For lunch, I ordered the divine swine, which was a pulled pork sandwich which came with bacon on it, and a side of chips. The portions were HUGE. The sandwich was a bit saucy for me, but they chips seemed freshly cooked, and were pretty good!  At this location, you can take growlers or cans to go, which you can order from your server, or purchase from the gift shop upstairs. If you bring your receipt with a meal purchase, you can save 10% off apparel. Unfortunately, the variety of cans  to go was quite limited when we visited.  Parking can be tricky as this is downtown. We parked on the street, not knowing that there was a paid parking lot directly across the street. I would recommend using that!

qI5_NOhts3Nlg9iBEv5aMw.text: Quality of food product is fine. Taste is not to our liking on either sandwich. I ordered the Wanzco Chicken sandwich and my husband ordered the Divine Swine sandwich. The pulled pork did not work well with bacon. The sandwich combos seem like they were created on dares.  We got a house salad that was very nice. We also ordered the garlic fries which were limp and flavorless of garlic!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wanzco chicken sandwich
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House salad
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlic fries

ExzFgAvxssNBsKCqRk85hg.text: For me (and I think I'm in the minority here), Fat Heads is a mixed bag.  They have a great beer selection and so many tasty beers that warrant a five star review.   On the other hand, the food is just mediocre and I feel like the service is really slow and the wait is so long, which combined warrants a three-star review.  So, I'm going with a four-star review here, but I'm not overly confident in my rating for once.   They are known for their wings and headwiches.   I've sampled quite a few of the appetizers and they are all good bar food but nothing to write home about.   For good beer and a Pittsburgh experience, I recommend using the no wait app and swinging by but if you are looking for out of this world food, I wouldn't brave the line.

n0NtixhgjQpSOdjUNUDpug.text: Was on a girls trip this weekend and stopped in for lunch. The reviews online left us hopefully for a fantastic experience. We were seated and ordered our drinks. Our waitress Ally delivered most of them...but also delivered a full glass of water onto my lap. Everything on the table got soaked, including my phone (it's fine). While I understand that mistakes happen I was a tad disappointed with the fact that not one member of management came over to see if we were ok or if we needed anything. It was -15 degrees on Saturday and my pants were completed soaked...I felt like I peed my pants. There was no compensation for the incredible inconvenience. Everyone enjoyed their food. Had a beer flight that was tasty. Ally however was MIA most of the time. I'm not sure if she was scared of us or what. I would go back...but would avoid Ally.

PJXPOx4Y8QVECgNqnp3kyw.text: I've been coming here for years and it is hands down my favorite restaurant. The food and service are always exemplary. They definitely have the friendliest staff of any restaurant I've ever been to. As an added bonus, if you're a beer drinker, you have an AMAZING selection on tap to choose from.

_JZnFa9hSOxeBLmB8a0gpg.text: Went for their anniversary brunch today with 8 people and again everything was fantastic!  Foot was great, service was great, and of course the beer and drinks were sensational!!! Best place to go in the south side!

_6SYVQ6PiqPSAjLmDvEYrQ.text: Disappointed this trip.  Significant remodel currently in progress.  No beers on tap, 5 types of bottled beer available.  South side slopes sandwich was still awesome though!  Hopefully next time I'm in the area this remodel will be complete and this place will be better than ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rDHPrkXt61nQQvMy3dzk4g.text: There's a reason why there's always a wait for this joint. Even though I came here on a Tuesday evening, still had to wait a good 15 minutes before my group was seated. The service was quick though so no complaint there.  As for food, I ordered the house burger with bacon and sriracha thousand-island sauce. It came with a mountain-size side of crispy fries. The burger itself was beautifully large as well. I was only able to finish half of my burger and took the other half for lunch the next day. The burger was cooked to my liking and the sauce added a slight kick. I wish they gave me more sauce though, but the burger was moist enough that it wasn't a problem.   Overall, I love Fat Heads! The portion size is HUGE so definitely worth the price. The burgers are top notch and the service quick. I highly recommend this place!

s7qU2sfphJn-PVqcBmhvug.text: This place is amazing. Everyone knows Primanti's but this is the place to go.  We came here after a long weekend of running around Pitt and had a great lunch. It did take a while to get a table but it was well worth the wait.    We got a few sandwiches. The south side slopes was amazing. Everything was huge and delicious. I would not recommend eating here everyday but tasty.

dH6OctP4s5HtI3Rxka9c1Q.text: Pretty average place. I personally wasn't a fan, but it's not super veg-friendly--so that could explain it. My veggie patty was pure mush and the cauliflower wings are basically just raw cauli dipped in buffalo sauce. Not my thing, but the regular burgers looked really good. Waitstaff is super friendly, always.

TnaDCh_Uz6xs9jYvkIo1QQ.text: Huge menu, tons of craft beers to choose from. Fatheads sandwiches are pretty good for the most part but the biggest takeaway from this review needs to be the SMOKED WINGS.. get them. I get extra medium but obviously whatever your preference is. I have also had the hipster cheesesteak here which is hot sausage and steak and it was very good. Great spot for pierogi also if you have an out of towner!

miLArpuwVoBvv6AZ4JR9oQ.text: The food is great (and portions are enormous).  House made chips / "nachos" (in quotes because they are made with potato chips) are very good also.  Generally friendly waitstaff as well, and very reasonably priced.  I ended up splitting a pierogi burger for an entree, and it was more than enough food.   They have a long list of house made beers as well as those brought in from outside.  Many of the house beers are priced at around $6 per, which is more expensive than other Southside purveyors, but in also of a higher standard (house made pils vs. miller light?  I know which I'd prefer at a few dollars premium).  tl;dr: Go.  And you'll probably want to go again.

z_J0SYTwBGJpkf48ObcrBg.text: Food: 5/5  Great sandwiches, fries and chips. Obviously, excellent beer selection as well.  Atmosphere: 3/5  Nothing too special. Can get loud and bathrooms could be updated.  Service: 5/5  No complaints at all.   Cost: 4/5  Huge portions. Well worth the price.

jvY5CBnUERN35675YYxmrQ.text: I came here with friends between lunch and dinner, which was probably not the smartest idea. We ended up ordering an appetizer to share as well as drinks. Next time, I look forward to trying a headwich (sandwich), although I will have to be really hungry because they are enormous!  The atmosphere is fun, and it wasn't filled to the brim with college students, as least when we were here. There seemed to be a variety of people, even some families, which I thought was nice. We came at 3pm on a Saturday, and we maybe waited 5 minutes.  We were seated in a big booth, and I was immediately overwhelmed by the sheer size and length of the menu. Everything looked amazing! We had the spinach dip, and it was delicious. I had the bone dry Arsenal cider, which is my absolute favorite cider (I buy it by the growler at Arsenal), and then switched to the Arsenal sour cherry, which you can't find in restaurants and bars as easily as the more common bone dry and Fighting Elleck. Love the sour cherry! It's very sour on the first drink, and then smooths out from there. The alcohol content is pretty high for a cider, so be forewarned!  I can't wait to come back for a headwich and more cider. Great selection of beers on tap as well.

qxspzXJXQQeoFN1DpHvFTw.text: Fun!   Good service, fun atmosphere. A lot of craft beers on tap. Would definitely visit again.

Mo5bU_2omlbLaWgrqFx1aQ.text: If you are a rookie, it may take a while to read thru the menu.  So many interesting options.  Have been to FATheads a few times recently and have had friendly service and some interesting Headwiches.  On our most recent visit, someone in the group ordered a salad. Man was it huge!  They took most of it home.    We started with some spicy wings. Wings were good with just some nice spicy heat.  Then on to the challenge of eating a Headwich that come with some tasty homemade chips (just add a little salt).  The Long LIve The King was so tasty with the stuffed banana pepper, very good sausage, mozzarella cheese , grilled tomato, onion, garlic mayo and anchovy.  Hard to describe but delicious.  Some very interesting flavors that combined well.  Did not meet the challenge.  Had to take some home for a nice treat the next day!  Great beer selection, too.

8nQhH_kkOWuBsJoAKot-4w.text: Food was really good, with big portions. However service was really slow. The waitress was not attentive. I did not recurve a single drink refill.

x_IEtJFqaf6LiRRHe_MJsg.text: We ordered our food online for a pick-up. Our order was correct and ready when they told us and it was on the 4th of July and they were very, very busy. Nice job ! I had the Fiery Voodoo Killer burger, pulled pork on top of a very large burger with jalapenos, swiss cheese. roasted red peppers and killer ranch sauce. One of the best "take out" burgers I've ever had in my 60 years of eating. The others in my group had a Wanzco chicken sandwich, a Bay of Pigs pulled pork, ham and swiss sandwich and a Pittsburgh Salad. The sandwiches were finished, but the salad was so large it could not be finished comfortably. All others in the group said really great food and we should order there again. We are all ready for a food coma nap.

8k9CclZ6ab4Yght2zZTpdg.text: This is the place to be in the Southside if you want sandwiches bigger than your head and a diverse list of beers on tap; avoid the weekends though, week nights are much more sane, especially for late night grubbin'.

0vSdykao5uh3KBYheXnydg.text: Really really poor service. I asked to try a sample of beer. She brought me a full one. I was like wow this is a sample (genuinely surprised) and she was like you said you wanted it. She took it away and literally slammed my sample down on the table. Left empty containers on the table consistently. No good on service. Food was okay.

JInWaDhJfm6WV9-Kd5IQYw.text: Go...to...Fat Heads! A couple weeks ago buddy and I drove from Philly to Pittsburgh to catch a Pirates/Cubs game. We thought we'd bar hop our way through the afternoon, but our first stop was Fat Heads and we never left. The beer, cider, food, and local liquors are great - try the Might Fine Bovine. But the bartenders are something else. Kristi, Sam, and Apple (possibly Jay) are funny, personable, and knowledgeable, and most importantly, they tolerated us Philly folk. I promised to write a glowing Yelp review...and they earned it. Cheers!

fvB8uUKpJH-ChqUFzFHBEg.text: This place is packed on the weekends. However, getting to sit at the bar and enjoy a bumble berry beer during our 45 minute wait was well worth the trip. The beer was so good that I had almost forgotten that we were waiting to eat! The beer soaked blueberries at the end of drinking a bumble berry beer made for a great sweet finish! Must I mention that the wings and loaded chips are well out of this world. Perfect beer food I felt! Come hungry and leave stuffed.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bumble berry beer!
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

J-XECwwyie7l1tUmiUVoUw.text: Stopped in twice over 2 days this past week. Had a burger that was ok, but the other sandwiches were pretty good. You've got to try the smoked wings! They were great and come in a variety of flavors. Mozzarella sticks were solid as we're the pickle chips.

lOl6RmHc0Vmm9Gdg9Ir6qw.text: My all time favorite bar for food! There are 3million sandwich choices and all homemade sauces etc. Beer selection is huge and so are the sandwiches!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4MgafEAx4ib40KUZ3orYAQ.text: The sandwiches are pretty good but the chips taste horrible. I always sub out fries instead. I enjoy the creativity with the sandwiches, I just hate how fatty they can be

Hcz1ddOJTMQg6VrjcrMAjg.text: Outside of the really long wait, it was all good.  Service was pretty quick and the food was good.  For the prices, I do not think you could get much better. The burger as a whole was as expected (a friend from there recommended it). The fries were good but not hot, maybe the only knock on the food that I have.  Overall, could probaly find a better spot around Pittsburgh but I am 100% positive there could have been worse choices.

MEtX5s65grjAdUzV01L_nQ.text: This place is dope! The beer selection is amazing the people were friendly as heck and man, it's just a nice spot!! From Chicago w/Love!!

H6bVYJfocP60KqqMrDipAA.text: Awesome selection of beers and very friendly staff. The restaurant is a very good size and the rest rooms were very clean on our visit. If you are not sure of what a beer that you are interested in tastes like, all you have to do is ask for a nice size sample!

cX0p2oLob9s7lilKQHUSDw.text: The food was well prepared, and our table was split 50/50- half thought the food was average, the other half was impressed. Prices were reasonable. The beer selection is a selling point.   We had a wait that wasn't quite as long as expected. While waiting, we went to the bar to get drinks. The bartender I interacted with was unpleasant. I ordered a beer that was on their wall (one of the Fat Head beers) and the bartender informed me that they didn't have it and seemed annoyed. I then asked if they had a beer like the one I had chosen and he said "No." then carded me. After digging out my ID (I'm 25, so no issue there), I asked if there was a stout on tap. He then flung a paper menu, different from their wall menu to me, and immediately turned around and walked away. In every other bar I've been to, bartenders, no matter how busy, have made at minimum a small effort to help customers select a drink they would like...or at least not flung a menu at me. To top matters off, there were 3 beers on the menu that contained exactly what the original beer I ordered had as main flavors.   He was very unpleasant, and in a city with so many bars and restaurants, I'll be choosing to spend my time/money elsewhere in the future, even though the rest of the restaurant experience was tolerable.

nUeC6JTCyiuop8H21D8mbA.text: While all of the sandwiches here are quite fun in that they offer a large variety of different choices in combination with a large amount of food, I actually haven't found any of them all that tasty.  The problem is that there are just too many toppings on each sandwich and some of them really aren't needed.  The wings are probably the best thing that I've had here so far.

Gxtrz34Hn7DC5Pj9jEGuVA.text: Good beer, below average bar food and a fun atmosphere, Fat Heads is the place that we find ourselves when we're not sure where else to go. They have a beer to suit every taste and some unique cider options, which you don't find as frequently. The service is decent-- I've never had a particularly great or particularly horrific experience at the bar or at a table. The food is extremely salty and heavy on the cheap carbohydrates (bread, chips, etc.), but is good if you are just looking for some bar food. I like the pierogies. The women's restroom needs a renovation and some repairs, but the rest of the restaurant, including the patio, are well kept and clean. As other reviewers have mentioned, it gets crowded, so I prefer to keep Fat Heads in the rotation as a casual beer spot and am prepared that I may not be able to find a seat.

lvgCBxZ705v0GuYFLpJzGg.text: A group of us met here after work for a get-together and we had a great time.  There are lots of unusual beers on tap at reasonable prices.  The appetizers were also cheap...I highly recommend the hand-cut potato chips.  We had great service and did not feel rushed at all.

hOgdnUUPL6tJpgIZekRNRg.text: This place is somewhat legendary with the college crowd and it was recommended to us by a friend who is not a college student.  The place really packs them in and is loud.  Lots of beers on tap and a large, varied menu chock full of your standard bar fare and then some.  Their "headwiches" are apparently what they are known for and just reading the ingredients, you feel the arteries clogging.  This is not the place to go for "healthy" options.  It is, however, the place for yummy appetizers (loved their wings and the spinich/artichoke dip) and really satisfying sandwiches, served with their homemade chips.  Definitely a place to stop and grab a bite if you're in the Southside area.

stB059hpkx194rXO7pC1uw.text: Great burgers and beers, excellent selection for both, only drawback is the horrible taxi situation on east carson.  Loved both the spicy bbq sauce and the habanero sauces, fries are best with a side of cheese sauce !!!

DHUAQ4pzH9KKzGZDm1jZLg.text: While traveling to Pittsburgh for work, some coworkers and I decided to explore the local flavor of the town.  Being the types who enjoy good beer and food, we were fortunate enough to come across a bar that has both.  And my oh my is that some good beer.  Excellent beer list to choose from.  Being from the Midwest I of course got myself some Yuengling as you just can't find that delicious brew in The Windy City.  They have 42 beers on tap so by no means don't just stop at Yuengling just because I was craving it so bad!  Their food portions are ginormous!  Order a burger and you'll get one as big as a fat head!  My buddy ordered an appetizer of mushrooms and he tasted them for days!  My other buddy ordered a salad that would probably count as a week's worth of food.  All their plates are in giant portions and filled well above the rim.  Great place to stop by, whether just visiting or local.

573rH3YXw4cPhMwwHTo1eQ.text: awesome burger and beer selection. so many options and different flavors that have me wanting to go again. only problem was the service. because there was a ton of people looking to eat, it took a bit to get everything.

ocXZ_G1hvUNGwzHHCDoJAA.text: wow...bring your appetite yinz guys.  dahn'air at fat head's you will be so stuffed by the end of your meal that you WILL need to have a designated driver for the ride home.  mmmmmmmmmmm...n-nat.  and, since you're in Pittsburgh i'm assuming you like your beer.  me too.  awesome selection.  run there, waddle out.  hell yeah!

zYOvf_ViP6K66-3y417ulA.text: This place was great! I had the Turkey Bacon Swiss Sandwich and a couple of beers. (large selection of food and beer). I was dining alone and all 3 bartenders made it a point to stop by and chit chat even though it was super busy.

Qv5gs7PWkkrsxfPT3bybbQ.text: If i lived near Pittsburgh, I'd weigh 400 pounds because I would be hooked to eating here every day.  Food is amazing.  Large portions and affordable.  I had the Jack-O Headwich, which was excellent.  I barely finished it, didn't even touch the chips that came with it since I was so full.  Wanted to try a beer, but I was just too full to drink one.  These guys know beer, and they have the best selection.  For two people sharing an appetizer and walking out stuffed, the bill was $36 without tip.  Not bad considering our appetizer became lunch the next day.  Just a great place with a great environment.

uIyX_jULQ0ZqkcbBwH1y3Q.text: Good service, good selection of beers,  and good chicken wings.  Chicken wings had a good crispness to them even under the tasty sauces.  We had the mild Buffalo sauce and honey BBQ sauce.  Also had the grilled shrimp salad which came in a huge bowl.   However the shrimp was not seasoned which was a disappointment.  Husband had 1/2 rack of ribs which were tasty and filling.  Beers are on the pricey side but they have a wide variety that will satisfy east and west coast patrons.  Bathrooms are clean enough and service was friendly and quick to fill your glasses.

PYkQyfyPp47H0SJXOAcs9w.text: Fat Head's Southside Slopes sandwich made an appearance in the in-room touristy magazine at the Marriott, and the ad was effective as hell-- once you lay eyes upon this animal, you know right away that your life will be incomplete without trying one. It seemed as though every beer advocate in town congregates here, and with good reason... despite the huge crowd, the tap list is an all star roster of fine brew at decent prices. The Southside Slopes was the star of the show, however. It's a beast of a sandwich with cheese and grilled onions atop pierogies and kielbasa. It starts out very good, with the kielbasa dominating each bite. It gets even better as time passes, with the cheese and pierogies melting into a creamy potato concoction that wonderfully complements the sausagey overtones. Trying to finish might make you uncomfortably overstuffed, but that doesn't make each step of the attempt any less of a religious experience. If you're in Pittsburgh, it's a must-do.

fe1K5ErHidfHHA7_W7XNxg.text: Big big selection of beers, appetizers and sandwiches. I had the wild raspberry beer from Colorado, it was very good. When we arrived on a Saturday for lunch it was packed! My party really enjoyed their chicken wings, I believe they just ordered original. The perogies were also tasty; tender pockets of potato-y goodness.I had the veggie sub with grilled green peppers, onions and black olives, prov cheese and french fries. Definitely was my first time having fries on a sandwich. It tasted like a cheesesteak sans the meat, pretty good. The sandwiches are HUGE though and come with either fries or potato chips. You'd be best off sharing one of these bad boys. The soups were good, as was the soft pretzel and one of the chicken sandwiches. My aunt did not enjoy the Tuna Steak sandwich so I guess avoid that. Service was relatively slow and was the biggest negative for this place. We waited quite a while for our food to come out while other tables were being served. We also did not get as much attention as I would have liked from our waitress, we were a large crowd of 7.

Vh42GXh2cERtJL3KtsDcfw.text: 4 or 5 years ago, the wait wasn't so bad at Fat Heads.  I originally loved them because of the wings... try the Garlic Parmesan.  I'm glad to see an "older" Pittsburgh restaurant become so popular.  I like the chips and the Rachel sandwich is great.

6ZxU1KNT69MtRMcVfj15AA.text: The service was good. My wife enjoyed her burger. I had the South side slopes. I don't know what Maxim Magazine saw in this sandwich to rate it #5. The home made chips that come with the sandwich were not crispy at all and under seasoned. There is however a great selections of beer to choose from, and a staggering amount of draft options. Maybe next time I will go to drink and eat bar food. There are several better options locally for dinner.

CgG5Fb1ANojEcitJsqAnmQ.text: 42 beers on tap. 25 varieties of burgers, and 30 different headwiches (they call them that because each sandwich is as big as your head. Not to mention 13 varieties of Buffalo wings and all other kinds of munchies).  Great atmosphere and better than average for a bar menu.

XwCQZbYj31eruIsQ0PeYAw.text: I really like this place, sure it's busy and you'll have to wait for a table but it's totally worth it.  I first visited this place about a decade ago when it was a much smaller place and not as well known, but they've always paid special attention to the food and beer selection.  I was here yesterday with a larger group of friends and we had a blast.  We didn't have a reservation and there was about 8 of us, so the wait was about 45 minutes.  Great excuse to have a few belgian beers prior to lunch.  We ordered some fries with bacon and cheese and also some fried mushrooms as appetizers, greasy goodness!!  The server was really good, she definitely knew what she was talking about with respect to beer selection and was very generous in offering samples of different delicious beers.  She was friendly, knowledgeable and then had a beer with us after her shift was over.  The wings are a must have when you visit.  My favorite item on the menu is the chargrilled wings which are delicious.  They are baked and then grilled, so they are not greasy at all and are actually probably relatively healthy for you... relatively...  The garlic parm wings are also great and I suggest you definitely try these as well.  I also ordered the steak and egg "headwich" which is  definitely as big as my head.  It was enough for three of us to share along with the wings.  And, to top it all off as if 6 belgian beers, wings, steaks, and eggs weren't enough we also tried one of the desserts (cheesecake) which was a little better than average.  Overall, this place has one of the best beer selections in town and probably the best bar food in the burgh'.  It's a must visit when you are in the city.

UcH6GBwjHrfT9TYng43QLQ.text: nice tap selections and the wings and sandwiches are great as well.

FKK2D3FcWbiVBG9ylwQg1Q.text: Fatheads is a great restaurant with a great beer selection, but one big drawback: the crowds.  I have stopped by at 9:30 on a Monday night, and had a 45-minute wait.  I have found that the crowds have gotten larger and larger over time, to the point that it's not that enjoyable anymore.  I'm all for having a few beers while waiting for a table to become available, but it ends up that you are crammed in the bar area for 2 hours, and you end up having too much to drink before you eat.  In the event that you DO get a seat in a reasonable time period, try the South Side Slopes Headwich: Kielbasa and Pierogies on a sandwich can't be beat.

c4uQZMsgyI2KQF-Tkd0zIw.text: This place has a a great beer selection.  Good brews from both Pittsburgh and the east coast.  I had the Southside Slopes, which has been named the best sandwich in america.  I would get something else if I were to go back.  Not that it was terrible, it just wasn't any where near the best sandwich I'd had.  The bun was very good, the kielbasa was delicious, but it just didn't all come together like I'd hoped.  Some of the other sandwiches looked a lot better on their menu.  The chips that it came with were very good.  If you're looking for good pub food in Pittsburgh, I'd check this place out first.

ZrkAZIoxh1yV2gH_pkZ_yQ.text: I think the best way to describe this place is bar food, elevated. They feature a massive amount of options, wings, burgers, headwiches (a sandwich the size of your head), salads and awesome starters.   I tried the cheesy bacon fries, spicy parm traditional wings, and Renee's red hot and blue burger. Diet starts tomorrow. All so good. The French fries have a delicious seasoning on them and the portions were great.  Fat Heads is known for their beer after all. They offer a long list of seasonal and year round brews that you can order in flights or by the glass. The Fat Heads hop juju and Hefeweizen were so tasty.   If you love variety you will love fat heads. The menu and beer list are diverse enough to satisfy just about everyone and with most entrees priced under 12.50, it won't break the bank.

dSO4s7HTs1iNKs8I0uCLPA.text: Yea I defiantly ordered this, without sauce and this is how it come. Now I am out 20 dollars. Perfect. Te cooks, can't even follow the simplest direction. *sauce on the side*   Update: I called in and they gave me a comp. meal for my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

20h1jYHu1qmXVWrLdczJfA.text: A good selection of beer and great food. We started with grilled wings - very saucy with just the right amount of heat. We moved on to their nachos and these were incredible. They were loaded with cheez wiz, seasoned beef, olives and sour cream. The key difference is that the chips were house made chips - these things were incredible. I als tried several types of beer. The fat head berry beer was great - served with a handful of blueberries.   I also tried the sour cherry and the pumpkin - both were great. The kicker was this ginger with rum and a lime - out of this world. There were several other menu items that looked awesome - we'll have to come back

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UmEyjORKsCghFip2jFnuLw.text: This place is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh. The variety of different types of sandwiches is a selling point I use if I'm going to dinner with friends. This place is a sandwich lover's paradise and it certainly has something for everyone.

rr6p2Id7JyPIZYxx9Q_k0Q.text: This is a Pittsburgh staple.  It is known for its large sandwiches.  If you are in Pittsburgh, put this on your list.  This bar/restaurant can get crowded at peak times.  While not a sports bar, there are plenty of TVs to catch the Pittsburgh games.  The bar area is a little on the smaller side so it can sometimes be hard to get a seat.  There is also an outdoor area which is nice.  As I said, this place is known for their sandwiches some of which are rather original.  I suggest you check out the menu if you think you might come here.  Most recently, I had the salmon Reuben.  I really like this one.  Good sauerkraut.  Good salmon.  Good times.  I had a cup of French Onion soup to start.  This never disappoints.  While the food is great for bar food, Fat Heads also has their own line of beers.  I like the Headhuter IPA.  The bar has 30+ drafts from various micro-brews.  The beer selection is really great.  This place is located on Pittsburgh's South Side which is a long strip of bars and restaurants.  Be warned that it can get crazy on the weekend nights as it college folks descend on Carson Street for the many beer specials.  I would recommend coming on a weekday unless you are under 25!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon Reuben

-NrEynqBfFj42gRR44uxNQ.text: Inexpensive. Large portions. Everything is made from scratch, including their sauces, home made chips, fresh cut

8ekdgAvooRZ0WrnX2aYyMA.text: Good spot to get burgers or sandwiches. The burgers and headwiches are huge and theres a large selection. Solid selections of beer as well... Get the bumbleberry or you can get a flight for about ten bux. You get 5 picks for your flight and its not a dinky little shots its actually a decent portion.  I kind of didnt like my choices for food as much but I think they were still done pretty well.  Food- Voodoo Burger (House smoked pulled pork coated in our Killer sauce, Swiss, roasted red peppers, fresh sliced jalapenos and a drizzle of our ranch dressing): The pulled pork wasnt very tender. The burger itself was great though. Also didnt taste much of the killer sauce. Prob wouldnt get again.  Double D headwich: Definitely an interesting sandwich. Think of a cheesesteak and then add pepperonis and two large banana peppers stuffed with sausage. Its like an italian cheesesteak kinda. I prob wouldnt get this again just cause they have so many other options, but I def enjoyed the sandwich. Only complaint is the steak coulda been better but it was still pretty good.  Overall I enjoyed the menu selections they had here and ill def be back

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beer flight
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Double d headwich inside
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Double d headwich side view

dSpUQVhxMiqivfFSobTY-Q.text: It may have been what we ordered, the boys burgers were very dry at medium rare, and well done...they got both of the burgers cooked to those temperatures. The fries were plentiful, but didn't keep the heat once they got to the table. Would have preferred less fries that were piping hot. The smoked wings were delicious, and the Pittsburgh salad was different but also tasted good, we got it with steak, and the steak was tender. I suggest you use a ranch on the salad because the balsamic vinaigrette was gross. Our waitress was very pleasant.. We went at 9:30 and there is a door man to check IDs, it was me and my teenage boys and granny... He thought the boys were grown, but then let us in once were told them their age and we were there for a family dinner, lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tons of fresh cut fries
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Painting on the wall
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smokey Burger!

OOw445kYu0EiqzJZYdoN-Q.text: Love this place.  We have been going there since they opened in the early 90's.  Great to see how they have expanded over the years.  Love it!

NEzVpvy4BnJz7A6DOQs8Xg.text: When you travel you always EWTLE (eat where the locals eat!) Definitely the sandwich shop locals flock to! Huge headwiches (sandwiches the size of your head) and great beer selection. Bumble berry IPA is a local favorite! The menu is loaded with burgers, sandwiches, sides and wings.   I had the Cuban which was a take on the great South Florida treat. Slightly different, it doesn't replace the classic but not bad if you're in need of a fix.   Why three stars? Parking and location. Carson Street is the biggest PIA and so is the South Side. But, don't let this stop you from going here, use Uber, Lyft, hitchhike, bike, rollerblade or get a ride from your gramma.

Vp4scsPkXMlTsld3CuPeXQ.text: I love the GLUTEN FREE MENU!!   I thought i wouldn't be able to eat anything here but they have a large gluten free menu. The people I went with really loved the beer. The potatoes skins are delicious.   The ambiance is nice. Its a great place to hang out with your friends. Server was prompt, the food didn't take to long. Im from out of town and this place was recommended by a coworker and i am glad I tried it.

LXc_35qJ3WqrnsuUfNpI8A.text: Hoping to go somewhere new after my graduation, I sent the family a list of places.  With a bunch of picky eaters and one person with Celiac's, Fat Heads fit the bill.  The menu is huge, and anyone can find something to eat here.  While we were driving over, I tried to get a spot with No Wait, but since we were a party of 5 ("Large party"), that was not allowed.  This was a bit disappointing, but we ended up only having a five minute wait when we were quoted 30 minutes.  It could have been so much worse.  We arrived at 3:00 PM on a Saturday so this may not be the place to go with a big group.  I ordered the Bumble Berry Honey Blueberry Ale ($6) to drink, and it was one of the best beers I have ever ordered.  I really only drink ciders, fruit beer, and liquor so I had some concern ordering a beer at all.  But this beer smelled delicious, didn't have an after taste, and was outright amazing.  It was so refreshing and great.  For my meal, I had the Southside Slopes headwich ($12), which was kielbasa, pierogies, cheese, and horseradish.  The kielbasa was great, and the pierogies were an awesome addition.  The sandwich was so heavy with a beer so I only ate half.  It also came with a huge side of chips.  The portions here are gargantuan.  Splitting with a friend may always be the best option.  The service was friendly and quick, and the atmosphere is very bar/saloon-y.  There is no smoking, which is a lovely thing.  This is a fun place to try local beers with some unique food options.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bumble Berry Honey Blueberry Ale ... $6
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Southside Slopes Headwich ... $12

d-vdGrJCdc04sRmwzW-DNA.text: Fat Heads is one of those places that I would love to frequent if frequenting didn't require a 7 hour plus drive. For my son's recent graduation, I allowed him to pick from the plethora of elegant and eclectic restaurants in and around Pittsburgh and, without any hesitation, he picked here. And, as I quickly learned, with very good reason. Food, while casual, was delicious, well priced and served in mass quantities. Even my appetizer portion of cod & chips was way more than I was able to finish.   As far as beer goes, their menu is huge offering an unmatched variety of both local and exotic crafts which, to my delight, included a grape beer which I though was awesome. In interest of full disclosure, however, my company thought it tasted like Manischewitz with bubbles. Okay, so it kind of did but what the hell's wrong with that? Service was also polite, friendly and attentive. Crowd was mostly mixed with a healthy serving of hipsters complete with requisite tight bottom skinny jeans and man buns. Nothing wrong with that, however.  I guess I penned this just to add my 2 cents but in reality, it's really not necessary. The other 500+ excellent reviews speak more about this place than my few paragraphs can. If anyone of my local NJ friends are ever in Pittsburgh and looking for a friendly, cool and laid back place, might I respectfully suggest Fat heads. I think you'll be glad you did. And if you're a local, I have a sneaking suspicion that you're already well aware of it. Stay thirsty, my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grape beer!!

DfdHZh3mXhLR1vrbDDXJ4A.text: I was in town on business, and this restaurant had good reviews, so I decided to try it for dinner. I came in a little before 6pm and didn't have to wait to be seated. I had a burger for lunch, so I decided to try their wings and a side of french fries.  The wings were good, but not the best. French fries were huge! It can be shared with a few people! The service and the staff were good. People kept coming in while I was here which showed how popular this place was.  I would come back to try one of their burgers next time.

_kPzBQBxASRFdCfRe9Pkvg.text: I've been to the Fat Heads in North Olmstead, Ohio, but it was sadly two years ago... remembering that there was one in Pittsburgh on my night I spent there, I went -- obviously... that's why I'm typing up a review, right?  For a Monday night at something like 10:30pm, it was surprisingly busy. The Pirates' game had just finished up, but even still, I was a bit shocked. The building has one of the better sports bar vibes I've seen, and I really liked it. It's not a very large dining space, but it's not exactly cozy either.  My girlfriend and I decided to get the buffalo cauliflower appetizer ... this was before I forgot to remind myself and her that the portions here (or, at least in North Olmstead) are absolutely insane. The buffalo cauliflower was, how shall I say... boomin'. The cauliflower are flash fried and not breaded, which I wasn't expecting, but they were awesome. The buffalo sauce is tasty with a surprisingly hefty heat, and the bleu cheese on the side was incredible. I love me some chunky bleu cheese.  The hipster cheesesteak I ordered wasn't as delicious as the Cuyahoga burger I had at the Ohio location, but it was still great -- loaded with thin slices of steak, some sausage, a little cheese, a hefty amount of broccoli rabe, and a bit of cherry pepper mayo. I enjoyed it, but I couldn't help but feel like I either needed some more cheese or seasoning on the steak.  Service was great, food was really good, and the beer is some of the better stuff you'll have (the Bourbon Barrel Aged Battle Axe was fantastic), assuming you enjoy craft beer. There are a ton of dining options in Pittsburgh, but you'll be hard-pressed to find one that will fill you up quite as much as Fat Heads.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hipster Cheesesteak with Buffalo Cauliflower -- I forgot what my girlfriend got, but it was *stereotypical Italian chef kissing fingers*

WGN9uCWy75X6XY12Ne4Jsw.text: These sandwiches are the size of a small human head. The pierogi and Kielbasa sandwich was by far my favorite. I did not need to eat dinner after this mammoth sandwich.  Adding an extra sauteed pierogi is a mere dollar, the kielbasa sandwich came with two, I say it's worth the extra dollar.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kielbasa Sandwich

H_X92SFrU_W1--7OPTZgLQ.text: Fatheads is flawless... every single time. They never miss a beat. This place is a must stop if you have never been. I am talking most likely the best sandwich I have ever had.  Everything they do here they do well. So many options too. They have a spinach artichoke chicken dip which is AMAZING and served with fresh pitas. However all of their sandwiches are so large an appetizer definitely is not necessary (yet almost impossible to pass up).  I typically get the Buffalo chicken sandwich which has celery on it! The crunch withe the chicken and spicy buffalo sauce all goes together so perfectly.  Not to mention they have so many amazing beer options. The headhunter IPA is one of my favorite beers around. The atmosphere is lively and typically around dinner there is a wait, so get here early! If there is a wait.. grab a beer and wait it out. You will not be disappointed.

CySYP1iZ05-aQYqC7eiIng.text: Recently stopped here with a good friend of mine for burgers. The food comes in plenty, you will not leave this place hungry. I do think the burger could have been seasoned a little better, but it was good nonetheless. However, I really want to brag about their fried pickles. They were the best I've ever had, and I keep thinking about them! I'm going to have to go back for them alone.

JYDdbaoY7nAMQaaMVAfDNw.text: Love this place  Special whole wings  And Hafevazen bear  Always million people here  Love this atmosphere  Like spend my time in this place

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qkVMDBOdSkzqIru55OaoZA.text: Food is good, beer is good, hostess's are bad.  Had to stand around and wait an additional 15 mins after being told the system "kicked us out of line, it does that sometimes..".

tq2_52EShvcJMbhUW5sQoA.text: So when you tell me a place serves sandwiches the size of your head, I'm instantly intrigued.The menu was complete overload but in a good way since everything looked tasty. I was kinda sad that I wasn't hungover since 85% of their menu looked like it could cure a hangover in a minute. I ordered the Mo Betta Beef N Chedda and settled on that. I got a little nervous since I didn't want to have food envy but felt confident about my selection.   And confident I was. Placed in front of me was one of the most beautiful sandwiches I've ever seen along with a heaping pile of potato chips. It was so on.....I said hello to my sandwich and took a picture of it for the memories because I was sure it would be gone very soon. So Tiffany vs. Food was on but unfortunately Tiffany failed. The leftovers were just as orgasmic as they were in the restaurant. When we left it was around 1:30P and they was a wait going on with a line out the door so be sure to go there early if you go on the weekend.

5uuZNgM7Hn7GGa1O9BZNgg.text: Towering tap list for all walks of life - check. Wings - check (both fried and smoked/grilled!). And "Head"wiches with one-off combinations of meat and toppings - check. For the pulled pork paladin, the quesadilla off the Munchies menu is saucy BBQ love with a kick. Further, the carnivore will feast whilst the vegetarian will be content with several starters or even the Hot Babushka Mama sandwich. Fresh-cut fries are a fan favorite, but the (free) no swap rule forces you to eat homemade chips that are as good or sometimes better than their fried familiar! The cast of characters is par for the course on da 'Sahside.' Just expect it. And the bar is the only way to go (service is just as good) since the 'Nowait' expected wait time was highly inaccurate, at least during our last visit.

C-dxGId9RFdjy2koT1UGaw.text: I love this place, tonite I enjoyed the multitude of beer options; they have some really great original beers. Just an FYI, not a place to go if u want the basic brew, or even a Guinness/Harp Black and Tan. Don't get me wrong- good, original beer options, if that is what you want. My companion was wanting Guinness......no go here. Food choices are amazing, and include oversized portions of unique sandwich and burger options. Great brisket and grilled wings among others. Would have given 5 stars, but wanted to bring home t-shirts for my family and after making my cab wait for 10 minutes, I had to leave after I asked for 2 medium tank tops......Really???..... kinda ticked me off to end my visit there!

rdOJ-qxB7_9nfhL8UhV8Sg.text: Enjoyed the experience of going to Fatheads and can see why it's a local favorite. That being said, given the ever growing quality places to eat in Pittsburgh, I would pass on making a visit here.  - 'Spicy Parm' wings were quite good and would recommend - Tried their signature 'Southside Slopes' - semi interesting to try but overrated and not sure it deserved to be in the category of "top tier sandwich"

OM5S2hgdyKz2ziiJ6rVF_A.text: One of my favorite places in southside. Fried pickles and their accompanying sauces are to die for. Josh was a jem. His attention to detail was so refreshing. Great spot!

QHymapzKaN4IExFm_kdydA.text: Great vibe, huge sandwiches, great apps, awesome beer list.  Great spot to bring the family right across the river from Pitt.  Outstanding draft selection that will not leave you thirsty.  Diverse selection of styles that should please every palate.  My daughters and their friend had a blast sharing appetizers.  Boisterous and fun.

jFxZN6LGKQ6wU6Bqv8YXZg.text: I'm thrilled that Fat Heads heard their customers and brought some of the retired menu items. Yesterday was the third time I've had the Beefed Up since it was reintroduced. It is the most amazing sandwich in Pittsburgh!  Smokey tasty meats and their wonderful mustard just makes my day.  A friend living now in Minnesota was visiting and purchased a jar of the mustard -- her German friend said, "now I've tasted the only good mustard in the U.S."  Another friend was visiting from Los Angeles and raved for the rest of the day about the Fat Italian.  KUDOS and many thanks for a life long culinary experience in the 'Burg.

9riP3xA2iy1qojJi7o8pgA.text: We liked being able to check in via Yelp to cut down on a usually long wait time. Black bean burger is perfect for vegetarians and their fries are to die for! Only draw back to our visit was slightly slow service. We will return regardless!

mBkffcu5h3a9FF0xJFMQvg.text: Meh, this is a beer and burger place that is a bit overpriced and exactly what you'd expect. I've never had bad food here, but I've also never been blown away by anything. This is pretty short review for me because it is so un-noteworthy to me.  Also, it gets crowded a lot, so expect to have to wait a while for everything.

z48csEbdIkXmU-kwVmyFkg.text: Wait time is ridiculous.  They seat people who arrived after us.  Gave me a lame ass excuse.   Service sucks

VVAhlfQRqUhO0pExtT5Hpg.text: This review addresses only the wings, as I did not have any other food or drink.  I came on a Tuesday night for the wing deal. Cost is now 60 cents per wing, and you cannot order the Char-broiled varieties. You can, however, order any number of any flavor (not restricted to 5 or 10 etc per flavor) so you do get the bonus of trying lots of flavors.  I tried the garlic-parm, smoky barbecue, cajun ranch, sweet sour, spicy parm, jalapeno cheddar, and killer flavors. The only ones worth eating again were smoky bbq, cajun ranch, and sweet/sour. The cheese-based ones were soggy and cheese was gunky. The killer - yes it was hot - but tasted gross. Like really really gross, I suppose from the vinegar component.  The wings come out fast enough. That's to their credit. However you can tell the wings are frozen and mass-cooked. The size is not particularly large (compared to Quaker or Library) and the meat not tender, though not burned. The flavors though are just squeeze-pumped on it seems as opposed to specifically addressed. A glaze sauce can't be prepped the same as a wet sauce as a dry rub.  So I guess if you're looking for 2-3 wings of lots of flavors, this is good. But I usually like to eat 40-50 wings. Tonight I stopped at 25 because I was already paying $18 and the flavors weren't particularly exciting. I won't be back for the Monday wing "special" with better options out there.  Jason's rank order list of Pittsburgh Wings (updated occasionally): - (tie) Quaker Steak (Robinson) - buffet tuesdays - (tie) The Library (Carson) - buffet tuesdays and sundays - Quaker Steak (Pleasant Hills) - buffet tuesdays - Fat Head's (Carson) - 60c Mondays

QRwiBPhCtxCR0Pz_IG5Xxw.text: * Is your doctor yelling at you because your cholesterol is to low? Come here.   * Are you a beer aficionado and looking for a great selection? This is your place.   * Are you a carnivoire and just need to sink your teeth into some flesh? You've found a new home.   * Are you sick and tired of menus that lists the calories and crave a 4000 calorie meal? Welcome to Fat Heads Saloon!   And yes the sandwiches are as big as your head. They are almost beyond belief. To make matters worse, or better, they are served with a mountain of homemade excellent potato chips. Be warned:these platters are so big that if you are by yourself, you would be out of your mind to order an appetizer.   You could have a "normal" sandwich here but that would be criminal. The giant gourmet sandwiches are called "Headwiches" and they are the stars of the show.   I attacked the Expert Pastrimi. It was Pastrimi grilled together with hot sausage and onions and topped with a fried egg, sharpI cheddar cheese , pickle and hot pepper mayo. Are you kidding me! This incredible creation was beyond fabulous. Wash it down with an excellent craft beer and you have one hell of a meal. By the way, these monster sandwiches go for about ten bucks and are worth every penny.   Part of the fun here is watching the faces of other diners as the waitstaff brings out these bad boys! I travel a great deal and have eaten in hundreds of places. These folks are a five star gastro pub experience!

7tUnO-Yrx1ftj5F75Bs6CQ.text: Great place for excellent beer selection. I am a fan of their food. Not a fan of their wings. They were bland and dry.

PIbw_7V2sdSyL2YJbQ6MFA.text: Great beer selection, loved the bumble berry blueberry beer saw a lot of people order it while I was there. Prepare to spend close to 15 for two beers. No music which was a bummer so we didn't stick around for a second.

RJzU0YLbtSk6n10eJbfnbg.text: Came here with a group of 6 for my birthday dinner a few Fridays ago. The staff accommodated us and we only had to wait about 25 minutes for a table, which really wasn't too bad considering we did not have a reservation and it was a busy Friday evening. The one and only issue I had with eating here was the noise level of the restaurant. My friends and I practically had to scream at one another to be able to talk, but I will forgive this as my food experience far outweighed my slight annoyance with the noise. I had never been here before, but after hearing all the hype, I had pretty high food expectations going in and I was NOT disappointed! Fat Heads is my favorite kind of "cheat day" food - giant cheesy sandwiches, fried goodies, giant portions and awesome beer. It was everything I wanted it to be and more. For apps we had a solid selection of buffalo cauliflower, pulled pork cheese fries, nachos, fried pickles and pierogies. Everything was AMAZING and the pickles had an incredible spicy dipping sauce. For dinner, I went with the "Jack-O" steak sandwich and it was also incredibly good with a side of their homemade potato chips - everything was SO DARN GOOD and needless to say we took tons of leftovers home and rolled out of there barely able to walk. Guaranteed you will not leave here hungry. Definitely will be back, and totally worth a trip! Fat Heads, thank you for living up to my sandwich expectations!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Jack-O&#34; Steak Sandwich with homemade chips

ykON7wPw53wVbBwyvNFvpw.text: Excellent food and atmosphere! Was here for one of their firkin Friday's! Only complaint was I ordered 20 wings but had to get only 1 sauce. Bacon cheddar fries are a must!

Mf9rARJ4PrKtdxJCucssJw.text: Yes, Yes and more Yes.  The Southside Slopes (Kielbasa and Pierogis and onions on a bun) is the best before nap meal lol.  The beer selection is top notch as well as the beer cave upstairs.  The homemade chips are another reason to order food.  I remember before a Aesop Rock concert once at The REX me and by buddy Ryan went here and just ordered a huge plate of those with just cheese and bacon, filling.   I forget the name of the beer but it's like 10 percent alcohol, get that.  It's a little expensive but well worth the visit.  One of my favorite Pittsburgh places to eat.

3v4KY7rgyYPX65NqfwvWfg.text: My husband loves the headwhiches!   They are huge but he finds them satisfying.  I like the beer selection which is a combo of their own brews plus others so usually something for everyone on the beer menu.  Also try the French onion soup it's my favorite thing on the menu.

dBVBm8Y_zsYZkGBmsv4pag.text: Great place to get good food and tasty beers a flight of beers and the jack o does the trick.

wzuR1NKlkv6-YUFAX8J6Xw.text: The food here is just STUPID good. Like when you have to stop eating and give your food that "WTF" look before you keep eating. This is not typical pub food by any means. I'm surprised we don't have one of these in Texas b/c the food is surely BIGGER & BETTER here.  I went with a couple people and we ordered some original wings for an appetizer and DAMN were they good. The wings were seasoned well, then tossed in a moderately hot wing sauce which had an amazingly unique and delicious flavor to it.  I ordered the Chick'n Little Headwich and even with all of the hype around the size of the sandwich, I still had a shocked look on my face when our waiter brought it to the table. The contents of this sandwich read like an Artery Clogger list: Chicken Fingers w/ Wing Sauce, 2 Fried Eggs, Ham, Bacon, Cheese etc. I know, it sounds a bit ridiculous but I guarantee you won't feel that way once you've taken that first bite. Although this one meaty treat probably shaved 6 months off my life, I think it may have been worth it b/c it exceeded all of my expectations and I had set the bar pretty high.  I love that this place is also a brewery and from the couple of beers I tried, a pretty good one at that. If I lived in Pittsburgh, I'd be a regular here so at least drop in for a bite and a brew and find out if you think its as awesome as I do.

86TvzfvguhRsL5a36YEt8g.text: My sandwich took me to a new whole dimension. Great atmosphere and amazing service a must go!

YgJ_F6vCSBpSQaTP8jWtrg.text: This place is a classic.  They have a great beer selection, HUGE portions, and a consistently pleasant staff. I now understand the meaning behind being "fat and happy" LOL.  If you're planning on going there on the weekend, be prepared to wait (they do get quite busy) but will always get you seated. Once you sit down, prepare for a feast (definitely worth the wait).  I usually go with one of their famous headwiches or a burger, however I've been here so much that I've probably tried mostly everything on the menu and have yet to be disappointed.   Whether you live in the burgh or are just visiting, try and make it a point to get here.   Five stars. Two thumbs up.

Gtzr89_vLkaU5PuAVzJpPQ.text: Only 4 stars and not 5 because we didn't try the food.  Great beer selection and friendly bar staff. Be prepared to wait at least an hour for a table on a Saturday night.  RANDOM TIP: Ranch sauce is amazing!

jpUX1xedO0UBpqjLdHXMwA.text: The food was solid and the service was good. The wait was super long but I would go again.

sqmf7TvSP81OPahuc7hguw.text: This place is truly incredible. It is the quintessential Pittsburgh restaurant.
