When I think about Pittsburgh, i think about the steelers, the three rivers, and fat heads restaurant.... I have been coming here pretty frequently for the last 14 or 15 years and it's always a great experience..... They have the best chicken wings in the world, a fantastic beer selection, and just a cool atmosphere in general. There is nothing pretentious about it - they know that they are serving food that isn't very healthy, and they don't apologize for it. You go there for chicken wings and fries and enormous sandwiches and beer. It's not a place for health freaks. But it's a place to get some great food, Pittsburgh style.   The original chicken wing sauce is outstanding. They also just added smoked wings to the menu. They are pretty awesome, particularly with the Carolina sauce. And they changed up the menu a bit. Some new sandwiches and such. Still a great place, even with the new menu.

IiOADovW2MzELQqNYTzm4A.text: Went for our second visit a few weekends ago...just as great as I remember! Had the tuna steak sandwich. The tuna was perfection! And the fries...omg, to die for! I get the Parmesan cheese and garlic fries. If you love garlic, these fries are for you! So much garlic a vampire won't get within 5 yards of you, so yummy! The hubby got the colassal club and boy was it HUGE! He thought it was wonderful as well! He got regular fries and enjoyed it very much! We will certainly go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum...fries and the tuna burger

Q_BtL4dXTzoq-xJRztduvg.text: Staff was great in explaining just how large the food is and it was.  Had great pulled pork G-man headwhich with homemade chips and buffalo cauliflower, which was very good crunchy mild buffalo sauce with the blue cheese dipping sauce.  Wish I did not have to return to work so I could try the beer!

Q0gF1OuRmh1hkvvgn4gCFg.text: Great service, amazing food and cold beer make for a perfect lunch meeting spot and talking business easier

NVI5kMbaI300rn3iIuBmNw.text: Real good beer and pretty good food. The sandwiches are certainly not made for a petite women of my stature. I could not even properly bite the thing without removing half the toppings. Not a huge fan of the chips but the locals seemed to ask for ranch and that made them much more enjoyable. Hasty service .The award winning kielbasa sandwich was amaze.

pwaZmAEX4vrFyaByI9zyHw.text: One of my favorite sandwich shops ever!But bar service is something to be desired. Full bar & great draft selection. Head Hunter IPA is a go-to. Pick any Headwich - you can't go wrong - just remember they are enormous & messy. I would give them 5 stars on food - but service at the bar is awful.

W5OoMwrYQRf1ynq3uA12NA.text: Riding on Reputation!  I've been going to Fat Heads for over 15 years.  I recently went this past Saturday for a dinner with my wife before a movie.  Over the past six weeks there was a DRASTIC change to their menu.  At least two pages of the menu were deleted.  Prices raised and even some popular headwiches were removed.  They are also very strict about fries vs. chips.  This is not a cheap restaurant if you want a beer either!  Miller Lite pint is 4.50, which is double what is charged next door at the bar.  Depending on when you arrive at peak time is how long you wait.  They have opened up a significant amount of seating over the years.  While yes this is a South Side staple, I feel selling beer has moved to the forefront.  Wings are still amazing, and you won't be able to move after a headwich.  It's just a shame with some of the changes.

eac11U7Kyk-7C5teWxjKGQ.text: It has been awhile since I've been to Fatheads. They have changed their menu significantly. I used to love their salads, so I figured I would try the brisket salad. I was disappointed when the salad came out, no longer in a bowl but a plate. Also, the lettuce was wilted and brown for the most part. There were only about five cherry tomatoes on the entire salad and not many other veggies. The best part of the salad was the brisket. Also, it appears that they are focusing more on their own beers as opposed to other selections, which is cool, gotta admire them for that. So, the food isn't as good as it used to be. But I wouldn't be opposed to coming back for their beer.

ZODQs9tszkFTSKn7JeyODg.text: Gotta love Fat Heads! Awesome beer both theirs and others. Great food and huge portions, the sandwiches are as wide as your head! Insane but great. Lines out the door on the weekends. Brewery is in Cleveland!

geF7ySUamWLxMdg4t7b6NA.text: Fat Heads never disappoints! The burgers and wings are delicious and it's a great restaurant to eat at. Great location, great staff. The mixed drinks aren't anything special for the South Side, but the people I went with love the beer. This place is definitely worth checking out.

q23q7zXkV352AagJiWZOaQ.text: Visiting from Milford, Ohio.  Spending a couple days in Pittsburgh for my hubby's bday.  Fat Heads was on his list!    My first turn off was that we were immediatly seated outside.  Any place I've been to, I've always been asked, "would you like to sit on the patio?"   We weren't asked and it appeared there was indoor seating available.        That's my only complaint.   Looking @ the menu, I thought the prices might be high until I saw the portion sizes!  wow!!!    After enjoying those fresh cut fries and drinks, we headed up stairs to the retail shop.  Hubby bought a pint glass and T-shirt.  The sales guy was a sweetie, engaged us in conversation, very good at his job.  If you eat here, you get 10% off your purchase in the retail shop.    If I ever find myself back in Pittsburgh, I'll find myself back @ Fatheads.

qstXaXQA_31H7Qch2hT-qA.text: Love FatHead's! With all of the food options on Carson St, I always find myself back at Fathead's. Great beer selection, wings specials on Monday night and out of control Delicious sandwiches.

UkD1nUCQWV5rBqv0tkkx9A.text: Whole wings are awesome, had smoked dry with original sauce on the side . If ordering a sandwich you will be sharing or taking home. Very good.

GFvZz7tFWadTW1yi4eU-Dg.text: My favorite place in Pittsburgh ! Excellent food. Excellent customer service. Been coming here for years. BEST BEER SELECTION IN THE BURGH !!

S4lqzUwYm8zpaPCpO-0SHw.text: Fat Head's has always been a staple of mine for beers since I became interested 'craft' beer years and years ago.  The restaurant itself has been transformed over the years.  It now offers a wider bar area, more indoor seating and now outdoor seating.  They have even started producing their own line of beer (brewed in Cleveland).    I personally like coming here for the beer.  The tap list is quite lengthy.  There are over 40 beers on tap continually.  The beers range in style, thought I typically see more IPA's on the menu.  They have IPA's, Pale Ales, Stouts, Imperial Stouts, Farmhouse Ales, Brown Ales, Pilsners, Hefeweizens, Red Ales, Lambics, Porters, Rye Ales...etc, you get the picture I hope.  They also have one beer on the hand pump.  Though many of the beers are Fat Head's brewed beers, they do have lots of other beers from breweries from within PA, the USA and around the world.  As a personal note, I really love the Head Hunter IPA and the Goggle Fogger Hefeweizen.  Despite the constant turn-over of taps, I find the tap lines to be clean and have never had a beer that tasted funny.  Most 16 ounce beers (the lower ABV ones) go for roughly $6.00.  Not extremely cheap.  The food menu is rather extensive.  They have tons of sandwiches, wings, salads, appetizers, burgers, chips, fries...etc.  The portions are enormous and there is always leftovers for me (which is shocking as I can put down some food).  If you have never seen their menu, it can be overwhelming.  It does change from time to time too.  I usually have good success with the food, though sometimes, it has not been great.  But that is not the norm.  The wings come in a variety of sauces too.  I really enjoy the wings and those are my go-to  My favorites are the char-grilled wings with Fat Head's Original Sauce or Beasty Barbecue.    Overall, if you are on the South Side, Fat Head's is a great stop.  It can get extremely crowded around dinner time and lunch time.  They do not take reservations, so wait times can be lengthy.  If you have some place to go after you eat , this may not be the place to choose.  The bar area is an option, but this area gets crowded as well.  The service behind the bar is always fast and efficient.  The bartenders see you, trust me they do and they will get to you quickly.  If you have questions, please ask them, they know their stuff.

l_lHaPeJI_4NwcJW8iZReA.text: The wait on a Sat afternoon was insane. The food is good if you like greasy, bar food. The portions are large. We bought the plate of gaic fries for 2 of us, and we had to take home more than half it was so big! Hamburgers are good. There were alot of heavy drinkers already at the bar the Sat afternnon we visited. I got the feeling it gets pretty rowdy with drinkers. Not quite my style.

toSWomYc5MNrsA8do9PQwg.text: A nice restaurant/bar in Pittsburgh's South Side region! Fat Heads is one of my favorite breweries, so I may be a bit biased when I say that this place has one of the best beer selections in the city. The food is standard "American", but done pretty nicely. The burgers are my favorite thing on the menu. A nice place to grab dinner and a couple of drinks before a crazy night on East Carson St!

RfhBAJObDbK7YuwWhza-Pw.text: Delicious! Went there today with my boyfriend for the first time in a couple years and it was amazing. The service was great as it usually is, very friendly, attentive, and for being crowded, fast. We ordered the stuffed banana peppers and nachos as an appetizer and omg. Both so delicious. The nachos were HUGE. Jalapeno cheesesteak as the entry and it was amazing! One of my favorite places.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pedros nachos!

tSId_ZaZgAhr9MIskjXj8A.text: This is one of my favorite places to go!  We always start with an  order of Frickles (but we devoured them before I could take a pic) and each got sandwiches. Boyfriend had the Southside Slopes which is amazing. I mean, with kielbasa, pierogies, onions and cheese, what's not to like?! I had the Mighty Fine Bovine and it was the bomb. The mix of brisket and pastrami is perfect. AND THE GARLIC PARM MAYOO! Man was that so good! The hot pepper kraut really added a nice bit of spice and crunch too. Pro tip: get a side of ranch to dip your chips in! Beer wise, they have so many on tap that if you can't find something you like, the problem is you. I almost always get one of their beers because #drinklocal.  Just some housekeeping things: there's a lot across the street and street parking all along Carson St. they recently remodeled the place and the downstairs didn't seem to have as much seating as before. But there are seats upstairs. I cannot recommend enough downloading the Nowait app and using it here. That thing is a lifesaver.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mighty Fine Bovine

ZoDF1aLpSOxNHLBZKqXVQw.text: Fat Head's is a Pittsburgh institution, one I dont get to as much as I used to, and as it turns out they're under construction right now. For some reason they decided to cover 75% of the restaurant and bar in subway tile. Doesn't exactly scream "Fat Head's" to me, but oh well.  The star here to me is, and ways will be, the beer. I definitely don't come here to try another brewery, and stick to Fat Head's beer every time. The top choice being Hop JuJu when it's available, but I've rarely had a FH brew I didn't enjoy.  For the food, it's top of the notch bar food. I know some people enjoy huge portions, but can't say I do. However, I've adjusted my ordering here to accommodate. Personal favorites are the fried pickles which arrive in a basket with 2 sauces and basically 5lbs of pickles. And for the entree, smoked original wings, every time.  Now my MAJOR gripe: I hate nowait, I hate that Fat Head's uses it. We showed up right at the exact time listed with 1 table ahead of us, but when we checked in we were told we still have to wait. Why was that an issue? Half of the patio and restaurant were empty. I just couldn't fathom it (see photo).

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frustrating that they use nowait, you arrive on time, still wait, and the restaurant is half empty.

cwP81d6EU4jXAp3uKYj30g.text: Over the years my wife and I have come here on many occasions and we usually just stop by for drinks.  We have ordered food a few times but Fat Heads is one of our favorite bars to go to in the South Side to have some drinks.       On our most recent visit we stopped here after brunch from another restaurant.  We were still a little hungry but we just couldn't find anything that we really wanted to eat here.  The few other times that we have eaten here the food has been ok.   Now a days for us we would probably would only eat here if we were out late and needed some food.         I'm a wheat beer kind of guy and I love German beer.  One of my year round favorite beer is their Goggle Fogger Hefe Weizen.  It's a great summer beer but they have it on tap all year round and it taste just as good in the winter months.  My wife loves IPA's so she enjoys their Head Hunter but they always have a good amount of IPAs on tap that she likes to try as well.  No matter what type of beer that you like you will find something here on tap which makes this place so good.       Overall I think we usually get pretty good service here.  The first few times we came here we didn't particular care for a certain bartender but it's has gotten better over the last few years.  It is the South Side so during busy times it can be very hard to get a seat at the bar or in the restaurant.  That's why we like to come here on Sundays because it's usually not too busy so we can sit down and have a good time drinking our favorite beers at the bar.  Cheers!

wxKlFOSp__sRPiKDA2KB4A.text: My girlfriend and I stopped by Fat Head's for lunch on a Sunday. It was fairly crowded and we were seated at a table upstairs. The menu is full of sandwiches, burgers, other bar-type food, and headwiches (sandwiches the size of your head). We both decided on burgers. I ordered the smoky burger and she ordered the gluten free triple bypass burger (and substituted the beasty BBQ sauce for the smoky BBQ sauce). Both burgers were juicy and flavorful, and the fries they were served with were solid. We were both pleasantly surprised by the gluten free bun. The portions were very generous. We couldn't finish and had to take the remains to go. Our waitress was friendly and the service wasn't too slow.  I'd definitely go back, but I'd probably have to prepare my stomach ahead of time. If you plan on going to Fat Head's (which you should), bring an appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogies
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Twisted Brisket Headwich
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Triple Bypass Burger (Gluten Free)

NQ7xzPxoD-QElu_7BFwN8w.text: This was one of the first restaurants I had the pleasure of eating ate when I first visited Pittsburgh. Still enjoy this place now that I live in the Burgh. Good food in the youthful Southside.

Cb6zTbrfO9slkCd17DShdg.text: Ended up here on St. Patty's weekend, but not intentionally. Very busy but they handled the crowd well. Awesome choice of beers on tap. Worthy of a stop if you are anywhere near Pittsburgh!

_rRNQWrReIbG3UcI6Rt6Eg.text: I really don't know why it's so popular, the chickens were not fresh at all, and came out cold, it's chewy, old and tough. That were the worst chicken wings and drumsticks I have ever had! The worst part was they don't split the flavor, so if you want two flavors you need to order 10+10and pay $3 more just for splitting the flavors. I am pretty sure you can get much better chickens at KFC or Popeyes or any other fast food restaurant and pay only half of the price for the same amount of food. Won't come back!

6ceu3QwvpRWe1OHApfXc4g.text: The beers are great, the food is good. Crazy big portions. Grabbed a sandwich and an IPA. How can it get any better than that?

MZh3FirmKYRMflaXJO3EcQ.text: Great food and drinks! Service was amazing! Styrofoam take out dishes and plastic straws!!!!! Not cool! Hey it's 2019!

3PQ5QBJQeQXirp6au28Dmw.text: Fatheads has the best sandwiches in Pittsburgh.  I usually go with the Aloha chicken which is chicken with ham, provolone cheese, grilled pineapple and extra medium wing sauce.  It is always perfect and the high quality bread they use helps every sandwich hold up and stay together despite the heavy toppings.  The buffalo chicken sandwich is also one of the best I have ever had.  Make sure to get their homemade chips as a side.  On top of the sandwich options, they also have great appetizers including wings and the spinach and artichoke dip.    The atmosphere is fun, especially in the summer when the patio area is open.  Overall I have never had a bad experience here and look forward to being back soon.

D7x0mUKzuHGKRQDLUgsvWw.text: Fun restaurant. The staff was friendly helpful and fast. The food was good, but not great. The fun ness and multitude of options kinda makes up for it not being great.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Twisted brisket
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pedro&#39;s nachos- really good

tqGR1mE40ozFCrrDzBQT5A.text: This place has my new favorite comfort food ever!! It's too bad it's too far away for when I need it.  We visited during the Thanksgiving weekend for lunch.  We each had one of their holiday beers, both were very good!   For an appetizer we had the fried pierogies, amazing!! And for dinner I had the hot babushka mama which was essentially a grilled cheese, with pierogies, mushrooms, and onions all inside. Let me tell you, this was heaven!! The definition of comfort food!! Like amazing! If you like pierogies I would definitely suggest trying it!! You'll be oh so happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Probably the most delicious sandwich ever!
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot babushka mama, essentially a grilled cheese with pierogies inside
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jones burger

fQ805Ca_7CbMbDRr_kvLYw.text: Stopped in for dinner with our 6-year-old daughter after a long day at Kennywood. The hostesses were super welcoming and interactive with my daughter during the short wait for our table (checking in on Yelp helped this for sure!) We enjoyed the giant pretzel and buffalo cauliflower appetizers along with our FatHeads beers.  Thankfully we decided to split the Twisted Brisket headwich because, as the description explains, it's HUGE!  On the other hand, it was so good that I wished for more.  I enjoyed the Benjamin Danklin IPA and my husband enjoyed the session IPA so much we bought a 6-pack to go.  Great service, awesome food and beers. Would definitely come back next time we are in Pittsburgh!

347z85Pwl_WUNmMhmg12Aw.text: Yum yum yum! I come here if I want to be FED with decent food. Their headwiches are truly big, I mean they are literally the size of your head. The menu is huge, and their beer list is extensive! (I love their bumble berry, it even comes with a couple of fresh blueberries on top!)

jRKTIaxN3tC8GGuuS4spXA.text: I love the Pittsburgh salad with steak, however this time I went they used different steak than they normally do, it was not as good. Also the service was very slow and we had long waits from when we sat down it took 10 mins just to be acknowledged by the server. Once we got our meal and I asked for more ranch I had to wait about another 10 mins just to get the ranch while he was getting water and dressings for other tables. He just seemed to pay a lot more attention to other tables and not mine. We are younger so that may be why, but it is not right. Once I got the extra ranch I asked for and we finished our meals we sat for 30 mins before he finally brought us the box and another 10 to get the check, although he acknowledged up multiple times and we told him we were finished up. He just kept us waiting a long time for everything and prioritized other tables. I hate tipping low, but I had to due to the blatant ignoring of my table.  Edit: he also took my boyfriends plate when I wanted to take his chips home. Thanks Adam now I can't enjoy Fatheads awesome chips as a snack later.

8qXOgDbMEyRmBqCJYVnDPw.text: I've always has a good experience here. They don't have as many vegetarian options as if like, but they have a "made in house" black bean patty that you can substitute on any burger. I ordered takeout and got their jalepeno bacon burger with a veggie patty & no bacon. (Woman on the phone said that was from an old menu, but they made it happen anyway). I was pleased that they went off the menu for my order, and it was delicious. The sandwich was pretty spicy, but goat cheese really balanced out the heat. I also enjoy their buffalo cauliflower. Can't go wrong with that! This isn't the place for a light meal, so if you're looking to fall into a good coma, and have a nice beer selection, this is the place to go.

6jZMUl7UjPGyFjGUjsdW9g.text: Love this place, great and their triple bypass burgers is literally to die for, really rare burger, spicy pulled pork and of course a fried egg. It's been 4 years and I still dream of this place.  While CA is fun, Pitt is home

g6WvWJyjf5LzIWWBD5fySg.text: Awesome beer selection, 42 on tap I believe, including 3 Lindemans.  They have a fun little gift shop upstairs too.

SdQiI8-98V6tIVECKleOIQ.text: More draft beers than you can imagine! Great burgers and BBQ Brisket. Excellent home made chips and expect to bring home a doggie bag!

RVWOaPXjzIAryC6RcEMJiQ.text: I visited this establishment to have lunch out with the girls. We parked right across the street and noticed Fat Heads for our return for lunch spot. We walked a few blocks checked out the stores and even got a piercing. When it came time to enjoy lunch it was a sad state of affairs! The bathroom was bad real bad smelled and only one toilet could flush. The bathroom was gross. The bathroom is located right next to the kitchen. I should have known better. We sat to order. My chair was sticky and wet. I ordered the Turkey cheese melt. The bread slices were very large but not toasted enough making the sandwich soggy inside. The chips were good served on the other side of the platter. Everything was big but not executed as planned. I was not willing to finish my sandwich because of the poor quality but my friends enjoyed their sandwiches. I guess the bathroom is a big thing if you can not clean it what about the kitchen? I am getting to the point why eat out anymore. Just eat things like wings and fries. If you want a good well executed meal do it yourself. Things have changed nobody cares anymore about service and customer comfort. That is what makes you come back again. The waitress was nice and suggested salad and i should of listened to her. Probably won't go back anymore. My husband use to take me to all these places and back then it was good.

00FITwsldIa-UUibmRTjmQ.text: Good selection of beers and food is decent bar food.  Huge selection to choose from and portions are huge.  Be prepared for a wait if you get there too late and want a table for dinner!!!

mdFWEkEVBj7wPHUxENUaSQ.text: Quick table-service, even with the late night busy crowd.  Fantastic beer selection.  We had the pepperoni roll and soft pretzels.  Both great for sopping up the day's "activities".  A little loud, but deal-able.  Better offerings than typical bar choices.

0JXdEjNX2oywcb2j-dCIAw.text: Amazing sandwiches - must try the south side special with kielbasa and pierogies. Wonderful beer selection to wash down your monstrous sandwich.  Bit loud with music and chatter but that contributes to the atmosphere.

pVXV-KfKaDr9vWwpZMqz4w.text: If you are in Pgh and haven't been to Fat Heads shame on you!  If you are visiting, get yourself to this idealic Pgh Saloon.  Everything is great especially the headwiches and wings.    The FatCap is my favorite sandwich.

aGNG5NOBDRwVko_xtO4xvw.text: Wonderful beer selection and great bar food. Typical Pittsburgh place with friendly atmosphere, great beers, and fattening food. I would give it 4 stars due to the crowds and the wait you must endure, but then I can't blame them for being popular. 5 stars.

NLZ7XkhWvir7hgiBODQ7zg.text: One of the biggest draft lists in Pittsburgh. Huge sandwiches and delicious chips

HMjI8GZElSS6-su4OeXT6w.text: Impressive beer selection, great sandwich menu.  One of the "safe" places to go in the South Side, where you can enjoy time with your friends over a good meal and great beer.  Real laid back vibe, competent staff and good prices. Seriously great beer selection.

qZQKFtW4-f3yRr2yE2XHKQ.text: I've been here more times than I can count, my fiance's name is even on the wall for all the beer he's consumed! The food tastes great, huuge portions so it makes for at least another meal the following day, and the atmosphere is fun. You can't go wrong, whether it's with a salad, chicken sandwich, burger.. whatever you chose you'll love! Not to mention the beer selection is pretty good. The only problem I have is that they do not take reservations and the manager would not allow us to reserve tables for our rehearsal dinner. We are such loyal patrons and this is how we're treated? However, I will still be visiting every time I'm back in town.

u6AZVFExigez0UrMkqXq4Q.text: I used to live across the street from fat heads when it opened years ago. Great place, and quality food.

wTe-YGIUHLSVz0vRg8HPqQ.text: I was back recently after graduating in the spring.  Fat Heads stood up to the test of time.  I've never seen a tap list as good as the one featured at Fat Heads but the real icing on the cake are the Headwiches.  I'm pretty sure I took years off my life eating The Slopes (although I think that the jury is still out on the sausage/pierogie diet?) either way it was time well spent.  I will always take the time to visit when I am in town.

JWr66vPmUK6Cxf6WqiLEdg.text: I love beer! I especially love craft beer! So obviously this place was the place for me. There were so many beer selections and it was so hard to choose.   We had lunch here. The sandwiches were good but the beer is where it is at! I think we ended up spending about 5 hours here.   My friend was a little too tipsy to drive so we went next door to the tattoo parlor (bar + tattoo parlor= crazy drunken tattoo ideas!). I ended up getting not one, but two tattoos to waste some time for my friend to sober up. In reality, I wanted the tattoo that I got and had been planning it for a while, Fat Heads just helped move the timing of my tattoo up a bit. The timing worked out because by the time that I was done, my friend was all sobered up!

SuUmK0mHNUCF7kKJgjXw7Q.text: Awesome beer selection.  Extensive menu.  Should be something for everyone.  Tuna steak sandwich was good.  Fries were awesome.  Buffalo shrimp- out of this world.  Waitstaff was friendly.  Nice large bar area to wait in.  Nice environment.  I would definitely go again.

4TdQTGDzbn8uyczxvveWXw.text: Just had to update because I stopped in here for a quick lunch the other day and had the Jalapeno Cheddar Chicken Salad...the most delicious and gigantic salad ever created (this salad can't even feign to be healthy...I had to ask for it sans french fries).  I sat at the bar and was served by Apple, a bartender who was genuinely thrilled to be working the bar, or at least he did a damn good job of pretending to be!  Very entertaining staff, delicious food, quick service...Fathead's earned an extra star for me on this visit.

tG1V1PeoGBWyPw3e9fmOww.text: Mmmmm.  Delicious wings of all varieties, great beer list, but the real star for me is the Ol' Smokey burger, to which I am addicted.  The burger is juicy and perfectly cooked, topped with cheese, onions and barbecue sauce, and served with a side of "creamy horsey sauce"--basically sour cream mixed with horseradish.  The burger is to die for, and the horsey sauce tastes amazing on the fresh, crisp fries.  Minus one star because this is the only restaurant at which I have ever literally tipped nothing.  It was an isolated incident in which our server went MIA and we couldn't get anyone else to help us (with, for example, the fact that our order was wrong, or the fact that we needed to pay the bill).  In fact, the service is generally not great, but the food and beer are so good that I don't much care.

KDNJByiQvQAAL_kMWgoZmA.text: Tons of beer selection. Good price.  The food is not bad.  I've tried a number of the sandwiches and burgers and they are all pretty good.  If you want good beer and high cholesterol, go to Fatheads.  Just be prepared to wait in line.

F8bc-bXXFDnv868ZzB0xeg.text: Great unique menu! Best restaurant in Pittsburgh for micro brews!!!

g3FlrD6UXiZtARhusO59ow.text: I've never had a worse experience at a restaurant.  After waiting more than an hour my group of six was seated.  Twenty minutes later we got the chance to order drinks and appetizers, only after we stopped the waitress to ask if we could order.  The appetizers didn't come out until we'd been sitting an hour and ten minutes!!  The nachos I got looked delicious but they were literally ice cold, not even just room temperature.  I sent the nachos back and asked if we'd be getting the food soon -  the waitress impolitely let me know that "appetizers come out before the food."  When I told her that they usually come out within fifteen minutes of ordering them she told me "the kitchen is very busy with take-out orders."  Deciding to just wait it out, I'm starving at this point, we waited another half hour.  At this point we've been seated an hour and forty minutes.  We got up and decided to eat elsewhere as fat head's evidently doesn't have time for the patrons actually in the restaurant.

R0NBsHbdQlg5Z1PqGnWjFg.text: I have been here a few times and I try to get something different each time. The menu is a little overwhelming as there are so many different sandwiches to choose from.   For starters I have tried their fried pierogies which were good but not what I thought they would be. I was expecting an extra crispy pieorgy with soft filling, but they just were not as "fried" as I thought they would be. They were still delicious, but I wanted something more crispy.   The sandwiches, or "headwiches" as they are called there, I have tried are Jack-O, The Divine Swine, and PCI. I have also tried their Fiery Voodoo Killer Burger. All 4 where good in their own way, and also served with extra crispy fresh potato chips! Out of the 4 my favorite would have to be the Divine Swine. It was a good pulled pork sandwhich and the sauces they use are alright, not my favorite. Fiery Voodoo was extra spicey and I really couldn't finish it. I completely underestimated the spiciness of their killer sauce! PCI is a typical Italian sub. My least favorite was the Jack-O. I was expecting a more thinly sliced beef, but this was thicker cut and kind of hard to bite. I had to use my knife to cut it to eat it. It wasn't bad, just not my taste!  I have only drank here once and only tried their Bumbleberry Honey Blueberry Ale. This was AMAZING. I am not a big drinker, so when I do drink I like fruity drinks or a lighter beer. This combined both of what I loved into a yummy refreshing beer. It is served with fresh blueberries in it, and I will for sure be getting this again! One of my favorite beers I have tried.  I will be back here whenever I crave a burger and beer! Always quick and friendly service and a great bar atmostphere. I love looking at all the pictures and nick naks on the wall, and find something new each time! Worth trying!

oYv6jfyXksekkWbT6NhHjA.text: When you are craving many beers and greasy, yet special, bar foods, Fat Heads should be one of your obvious choices. I like sitting at the bar the most because I love looking over and over their beer list and checking out all of the cut fat little guy taps.  The beer is awesome, and there's SO MANY to chose from!  I love that they have Arsenal and Framboise on tap, too (yea... I drink mostly girly drinks)! Over the years I've had a wide variety of food at Fat Heads, but this most recent time I opted for the Cheesesteak and it was delicious. Their chips are something to talk about too, homemade chips are the type of things I dream about, and these chips are sure to be in my dreams. Service is always spot on. I've never had a bad experience here!

fWYSg_uVd_Dl67wyoh2BUQ.text: Fat heads has a great selection of craft beers and good food. I hear that the burgers are amazing (but I don't eat meat). The place gets pretty crowded almost every day of the week, but service is usually pretty good too. I wouldn't come here every day, but for a dinner here and there, it's great.

_0DzF-CaqeL9x47Dwa8agA.text: Its impossible to go wrong at Fat Heads. Its a South Side Classic and if you are visiting from out of town, this is a must. I had dinner there tonight with my sister & her 10 month old. The wait wasn't very long and they text you so you can walk around outside and not have to worry about your buzzer going out of range and missing your table. It was Wing Night so wings are only 60 a piece. We got the Smoky BBQ and Garlic Parmesan, both AMAZING!! We also ordered entrees, but ended up taking most of that home. The wings are pretty filling.   I'm a big fan of the Beer too, the Hop JUJU is a favorite of mine.

Jxm6atDvh0IYM2yMlJ6CNg.text: Omg, Bumble Berry beer is my go-to!!! I love everything about Fat Head's menu. I get a different sandwich each time and I'm never disappointed. The deep fried pierogis are so yummy!   I really don't have a negative thing to say. Perhaps just a suggestion- being able to make reservations would be great!

MdJdMkqO42HV5BN0gHtw5A.text: This is a great casual joint!  I prefer coming on Saturday or Sunday afternoons and grabbing a seat at the bar.  They have a great beer selection and some really great ciders (peach).  Although most people go there for the enormous sandwiches and huge selection, I go for the Pittsburgh salad.  They use filet and slice it very thin and it is outstanding!  If you are a fan of fried mushrooms they are one of the best I have ever had.

GFeMwp-DQMFsqj9sVzWSiQ.text: Awesome sandwiches and wings. Good beer selection.

-fUrcWmpH-xmZFFbYpopig.text: Waited an hour for garlic fries and they didn't taste like garlic at all. Smokey burger was just ok. Chelsea our waitress did not smile one time. The beer was pretty good but not worth the wait.

nKnrE4fdkvPlL_F3oGss7Q.text: Food is great! Had the King Jung Moo burger with fries and ranch. Burger is massive and they are very generous with the fries. Enjoyed the Springtime Daydream and Bumbleberry beers. Delicious and refreshing. Service was quick and friendly. Only downer was a very drunk table next to us who was overly loud and obnoxious.

DrVD9UJbJBx_reYDl_Yu4g.text: Being a huge fan of Fat Head beers, I was very excited to try out the Fat Head Saloon. Unfortunately, the only thing that didn't disappoint was the beer itself.   The bar tending was standard, nothing exceptional about my experience at the bar, but then again, how hard is it to pour a 16 oz beer? The beer though...exceptional, as expected!!!!  However, let that be the end of your expectations for the night. If you want any sort of service, or if you want to feel like the restaurant wants you there, don't attend the Far Head Saloon. I was originally greeted with a frown when I said I would likely just drink at the bar, but when I decided to sit at the bar tables I was asked to stand up as our table was "needed". The table proceeded to be empty for another hour. Sam, the server, was not friendly, nor accommodating as she clearly talked about my group because I went to the front to ask a menu question and they told me not to sit at another table within the restaurant.   If you like Fat Head beers, definitely make a stop to get a good draft, but your experience at your local grocer will far exceed the service of this bar. This establishment truly needs a refresher course on customer service!

b5wDt-9T07ear5yzZe3UHA.text: They have a great beer and cider selection I have not seen on the west coast! I went for the concord grape cider which was light and refreshing! wish I could have tried their blueberry honey fruit beer! It sounds amazing!  For the food the special for Friday was fried pickles (surprise!). I love pickles so wanted to order this even if it wasn't the special. For my entree I got the cajun tuna taco press. My bf got the cubano sandwich.  We got our drinks and appetizer first. The fried pickle basket was a pretty big basket and I was really full just from this! These fried pickles tasted a bit better then other places where I've tried fried pickles. Seems their batter sticks to the pickles better and the pickles were sliced instead of the normal pickle spears other places served.   For my cajun tuna taco press, its pretty much a wrap and I enjoyed it as it was definitely on the lighter side of the menu and the spices on the tuna were on point. Nice flavorful spice and actual heat. Both my bf's entree and mine came with fresh made potato chips. There was a lot! If I'd known, I probably wouldn't have ordered the fried pickles. The homemade potato chips are really good though and I kept eating these even after I was full.  Great beer and great food to accompany the awesome drinks!

EGDE7BkR3XW44XZKxLd0tg.text: Second time I've been to this place. Me and a friend met up here this time after a long day and it was totally worth it! Had to wait for about 15 mins on a Tuesday night but we didn't mind too much. Beer selection was awesome and the food was great as always. The artichoke dip is phenomenal omg! Mmmhmm. Love it. My friend had the killer and the honey chipotle wings but didn't like the honey chipotle that much! Will definitely be back every soon

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delish
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy

_ws5zlroY3n9NWEAxiynKA.text: Wait wait wait...before you go to this place based on the 4 star rating, make sure you know what you're getting yourself into.  Mother Flipping Sandwiches the size of your head, that's what. These things WILL clog your arteries so make sure you have a strong constitution.  The sandwiches are served with homemade chips (delicious) and a normal sized beer look puny in comparison.   I'll be honest though, if you can get around the fact that this stuff is really REALLY bad for you. It's delicious.  They come filled with sausages, fries, perogies, cheese galore and lots of meat.  My tip to you: Skip the bread, get your knife and fork and eat the middle of these things. You still won't make it anywhere near through all the filling but at least you're using the room in your stomach up on the good stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Notice how small the full pint of beer looks next to this sandwich.
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best eaten with a knife and fork, skip the bread.

_JnJ14nWBnz2hCVhcxLBiA.text: Love Fat Heads, but no restaurant establishment should ever charge for a side of ranch. It's a condiment. That'd be like charging for ketchup that's already sitting at the table.

rxWmqVMAcUaZtOV4rQyZ4Q.text: What a fun little spot in the center of town! Being from out of town, I always like to try new places to eat when I'm in Pittsburgh. Some friends brought me to Fatheads and immediately I loved it. Very casual, down to eat spot. Family and kid friendly during the day.  The waitress didn't appear to have to many tables, and it took about 5 minutes for her to come over, address us and get us drinks. She walked away before we could order an appetizers, so we waited about another 5 minutes for her to come back.   Once everything was ordered and delivered all I have to say is YUM! I got medium wings - and they were delicious. Not the best wings I've ever had, they were a bit undercooked however they hit the spicy spot I was looking to kick.  I had a great experience here and I will be back in the future!

PxXbxd6ZWp6qgQ4jkCx1lg.text: I gave it two stars bc the sandwiches were good but everything else was not, including the service. I emailed them about how awful my wings (5 tiny wings for 6.95), as well as my turkey bacon wrap (8.95) was. Told that I would get a refund and a gift card. Never heard from them again. In fact - I bought lunch for all my employees and no one liked their food. I work for a large company in south side & can guarantee you that we will not be returning. I had also previously dined in before and was displeased with the cocky attitude from the waiter.

FngNKsu14AyNBvooYrYiQQ.text: It seems I may be in the minority, but I wouldn't go out of my way for Fat Heads.  Perhaps I was in a bad mood because the only thing worse than Pittsburghers driving in snow is Pittsburghers parking in snow (and it was impossible to find somewhere to park on Saturday afternoon).  Perhaps it was the hour plus wait to get a table - 4/6 people in our group wanted Fat Heads, so I was forced to wait.  Hungry Angelica does not wait well.  I don't know, but something wasn't making this trip super-special for me.  Three of us got burgers.  While they were good, they weren't amazing.  I was getting full and wanted to finish the patty sans bun, which was a mistake.  My burger, the Renee, comes with cheese, cheese sauce (overkill), mushrooms, and bacon and you really need all of that cheese because the meat on mine was a little dry and had no flavor when eaten off the bun.  Another had the Nicole and noted that the fried onion straws were basically non-existent.  I've had that before and they pile it with onion straws; this time, there was only a sprinkling of chopped pieces (the leftovers perhaps).  A third person had a classic bacon cheeseburger with an egg and it was finished with great gusto.  Also ordered by others were wings, a steak sandwich, and a taco salad.  The wings were good and spicy, the steak sandwich wasn't commented on, and the taco salad was good, but just kind of there - nothing special.  Pros: extensive craft beer list with a cask on tap, huge menu (though it has direction - you know you're getting some good, classic bar food), wings, bar atmosphere. Cons: inconsistencies in the kitchen with preparation and presentation, some burgers not living up to the hype.  Will I come here again? Yes, but I'll order something different and it won't be during a busy afternoon rush.

p3Ty-CwjgrrJqceu8wb65w.text: Turned away paying customers because someone in my party had a milkshake from the milkshake factory from down the street. We understand that you don't want other  businesses advertised in your establishment but keep in mind of all the places in Pittsburgh to eat, we chose yours. You have lost our service. Absolutely ridiculous.

I5PiNv5sq4nZAlMb04pPcw.text: Good beer, great service, and excellent ambiance. Had the bean me up coffee imperial stout and it was fantastic. My buddy ordered a beer he didn't like and the bartender was more than happy to get him something different. Great experience.

DVtxiq0RBay6h3tbQr3e4Q.text: I've been here a number of times and have never been disappointed! The bumble berry beer is especially good!

vMJQxEfPrAczgE2fHQznaQ.text: LOVE Fat Head's! Always has a great atmosphere. Their salads are the best - massive portions and loaded with lots of fresh vegetables. On our past visit we also tried the fish & chips app - the fish was terrific! We only wished it came with more as there were only 2 pieces. Very much enjoy their draft beers - bumbleberry is my favorite. Service here is usually great. Tough to find parking on E Carson which just comes with the territory. Definitely worth a visit! Lots of tvs if there is a game on.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

cd35cZmKmbZtnaQxd7YlWw.text: Always a good beer and sandwich at Fathead's.  This is one of my must haves when I visit Pittsburgh.  This visit we started with a few beers of course.  I had the Sierra Nevada Pale Ale which is always good, followed by a Fatheads trail head pale ale, also a great choice.  Appetizer: Smoked chicken and 'choke dip $10 This was alright, probably the only thing that I had I wasn't crazy about.  Sandwich:  Buffalo chicken Sandwich served with homemade potato chips.  I got the extra medium buffalo sauce, which was so good.  The homemade chips are so awesome here and I look forward to them every time. I get an extra side of ranch to dip them in.   Service: Fast, friendly. No complaints.   Tips:   They do not take reservations.  Get there and have a beer, or you can use the "no wait" app.

JUevek9HfRncv2txW-o8tg.text: One of my favorite places to eat in the south side! Hip place with a Pittsburgh oriented menu. The outside section is a nice added bonus. Never been disappointed here, the servers are very efficient. Really enjoyed the South Side Slopes sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. There&#39;s an egg on the fries!
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Southside Slopes Headwich

4VRTvS4K3mHugKqlP5rVzg.text: When I go home to visit, I always make a stop here, whether it is a drink with friends or grabbing dinner. The beer selection is out of this world. My favorite is the Head Hunter IPA, but they have a choice for everyone's palate from light pilsners to dark beers. They brew all their own beer and have seasonal ones as well! For food, my go to buffalo chicken sandwich tossed in the spicy parm sauce with a side of fries. I usually have leftovers for lunch too. Their wings are also delicious. The specialty headwich sandwiches are also great and huge! The only downside is that it can get super crowded and waits can go up to 2 hours for a table. They did just renovate the bar space and it's much bigger to accommodate more when you're waiting for a table!

-9DAW9rElDEApPZIv0n-ZQ.text: Very overrated sandwich. Would recommend other local places. Poor service, and pretty rude when you tell them your receipt is wrong.

kLrmgH0v--0nV9REwpZpJg.text: My favorite restaurant, ever. The food is always delicious, and the staff is super friendly. Excellent menu options and if you're a beer drinker like me, they have quite the selection.

CKWS7LA-JYegIUf_NvkuOg.text: Starting going back in 1995 for wing night. Wings and sauces couldn't be beat. Last 5 years or so the wings aren't as good. Sauces are great. They may par bake prior to frying and the wings end up being too tough n chewy. Service and beer always good but wings aren't good anymore.

ogx36JQqZxROi_ZMwBuTxg.text: One word: delicious!  The menu is definitely overwhelming cause everything looks sooooo good! Even the beer/cider list is amazing! I ended up getting the pumpkin cider and for my main entree the Mcminn's Chicken Dance. This sandwich came with chargrilled chicken breast, spicy parm sauce (SO GOOD) with a fried egg, cheddar, lettuce, tomato, pickle and cherry pepper-mayo and a side of chips. The spicy parm sauce is definitely what tops off this whole entire sandwich!   The headwiches are what they are mainly known for but that's just way too much food for me. I ended up with the sandwich and it was a decent amount of food. I highly recommend coming here when you're starving!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mcminn&#39;s Chicken Dance - HIGHLY RECOMMEND

7_NUSh_pkXUqeTTNxYf3vg.text: Stayed in Pittsburgh for the weekend,  checked out of our hotel and came to check this place out. One of the few places open before 4pm! Lol none the less we were happy about it because the food was amazing! Enjoyed the pierogies to start with sauteed onions (so good!!) and then had the "Beauty and the Beasty" and the pulled pork chili burger... both were awesome! Great place, great atmosphere and good drinks to boot. Check this one out!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The beauty and the beasty and the pulled pork chili burger

e1lwPoxQ_507KL6-lb4Nug.text: I'm going to first say i've been going to Fat Heads for over 10 years and love the place for the most part. I normally go for their wings, though some of their sandwiches are pretty good too. I will say the quality of the wings can be a miss sometimes. The spicy parm particularly aren't consistent, but when they are done right, they are awesome. The wings are really only affordable on wing nights, but they are a bit pricey even on wing nights these days.  Now, I went here last night with a few people, and I will have to repeat what others have been saying recently. Immediately we noticed their menu is drastically different.  A full two sided page is missing from the menu. They have even less wing flavors (they didn't have many to begin with). The menu is actually even smaller if you pay attention, because there are actually new items on the menu. Why such drastic changes?  We started off with the bacon cheese fries, which are every bit as delicious as they normally are loaded with thick, real bacon bits; however, the portion is smaller than it used to be. I had one of the few burgers, which was pretty good as well, but a new one to me. Not sure if I would order the Kim Jong Moo again. The lady got the spicy parm wings, which were good, but could have used more parm (again hit or miss).  A friend ordered the new, we believe, "original buffalo cauliflower", which was barely cooked cauliflower drowning in hot sauce. It was neither deep fried or topped with blue cheese, in our opinions, as the description stated. Super pricey at $9 as well for about 10 pieces of cauliflower. Pretty dissappointing and the waiter offered no sympathy when we mentioned our dismay with them.  Finally, this place has been under renovation for the better part of this year and I wonder if it will ever be finished. Please finish the new bathrooms soon, as the current ones are pretty foul. I'll give them a 4 for now, but with recent changes and increased prices, I'm starting to think this place might become mediocre and a 3. There are still good things on the menu for sure, but the changes leave me miffed a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. We are waiting...

rQf03SZcgllgDXXcjYsmYw.text: Stopped in on a weekday for lunch since it's usually packed . Server was super nice and helpful. Ordered hot and spicy wings and some home made chips and a burger . Burger was undercooked too much to eat, the wings were so rubbery and very tasteless. Maybe it was a bad sauce or who knows but I even asked for extra crispy as well . I'll put those 2 things under stuff I'll never order from there again. The chips though were amazing , crispy and tasty . Ranch dip was pretty funky as well . I'll try again someday but I'm not going to go out of my way to eat there ever again.

eGG3uZWRmj4D4TKCTcU6Iw.text: Giant sandwiches and great beer, what's better than that?   Although fat heads brewery is located in Ohio, fat heads in the south side is a pittsburgh must! Their menu is huge! Tons of unique "headwiches" (sandwiches literally as big as your head), burgers, appetizers and huge salads.   Last time I went I tried their pepperoni roll appetizer. I have to say I wasn't super impressed with how large it was for the money it cost. The pepperoni roll was good but nothing special and not worth $9 when you can get a similar one at get go for a little over a dollar.   I usually always get some sort of chicken sandwich. They are always delicious and packed with flavor. Another thing I am not a huge fan of though is the fact all chicken sandwiches and burgers come with their house made potato chips and it's an up charge if you want to switch your side. Personally I do not love their chips but also don't want to pay an additional $2 or so for fries or something else.   Their salads are hugeeeee and come in a big bowl. I've had their chicken salad most recently and it was delicious.   One thing I especially love about fat heads, is of course, their beer. You can find their six packs for a lot cheaper than what they sell in their store. My favorites are their seasonal spooky tooth (pumpkin delishisness), bumble berry (blueberry delishishness) and their head hunter IPA. They always have a ton of other awesome beers on draft as well!   Great place to kick back, enjoy a giant sandwich or salad and have a beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken sandwich with tons of their house made chips

GUDpcIqmpCUClP6_Dh5GEw.text: They have good burgers and huge salads. I wish there wasn't always a wait when I would like to get some grub.  There have been a few times the wait was bearable but other times this was definitely not the case.

PGcNBDs0RpOJx4Q0plv_rg.text: Stopped here after a bike ride with my family. My son and I split one of their enormous sandwiches. It was a pulled pork with garlic broccoli sandwich. My wife got the Pittsburgher salad and my daughter got chicken tenders. Their portions are absolutely huge! The service is always good and their beer variety is fantastic. I ordered the bumble berry beer which surprisingly wasn't cold enough. I was a little disappointed by that. It is a little on the pricey side, but it is on the south side of Pittsburgh so you got a figure that you'll pay a higher fare because it's in the city.   Overall, fatheads is one of my favorite places to frequent and we will be back for sure.

SFIDw_RIb8vXKg3favB-vA.text: Fathead's is a Southside classic. They have local PA brews on tap, very large and delicious sandwiches and pretty good wings.   I've been here many times and the reason why I give it three stars versus four is because of consistency. The quality of the food varies in consistency as does the service.   On a good day, Fathead's is an easy 4. Some of their sandwiches, especially the spicy ones with habanero have some really unique (for Pittsburgh) and well thought-out flavor profiles. And their wings are also very good (Original Sauce is excellent) albeit not cheap. On top of that they also serve smoked wings, which may be the best way to eat wings in general. So the food can really be quite good.   It's just that in order to rise to a 4th star for me, repeat visits have to be at that level. So it's a very solid three, and I try my best not to succumb to grade inflation.   So if you like good beer, good food, big portions and really don't care about the service on any particular day, then go!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wings with Original Sauce (perfect blend of richness, spiciness and just a touch of sweetness!)
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House Burger (comes with a scoop of pimento cheese dip!)

fZGuCmVjP_-adZnZlYE7BQ.text: Server: Tori  Music Type: None outside.  Great waitress, positive and informative, i mean down to the top 3 highest sold beers in Pittsburgh. The giant pretzel was excellent and can be made to order with regard to the amount of salt. Its soft and crunchy the only complaint i have is with the cheese, the flavor is just not quite right for me. Im not a big mustard fan but if you like mustard i believe these are likely some of the best.  She recommended any of the headwich but also recommended the smoked wings. We ordered the big beefy sandwich and added fries along w the smoked wings w sauce on the side. The sandwich was great, flavorful the sauce reminds you of a sloppy joe but in a good way. The wings were not seasoned enough for my liking. Its possible that sauce would've made them better but we went w the recommendation. The ranch is also one of the better ranches ive tasted, possibly made in house.   One irritation is the "hassle to make fries w sandwhich" rule. The fries and chips are good but both are not seasoned enough which is ok for the fries because most people add ketchup but the chips need help.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Big Beefy BBQ and 5 Huge Smoked Wings
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Giant Pretzel
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Vra7Q_iNBlyhtyvM0g1zUQ.text: This place is overrated. I came here because someone told me they had amazing food. The only amazing thing we had were the smoked wings with original sauce. I would definitely come back just for those. The sauce is a bit spicy depending on how much you like. I had the beermark headwich and the person I was with had the bay of pigs headwich. Both were very dry as there was so much more bread than sauce and meat. Their homemade chips were good though.

IWypykrbJPaAP-CjxvwiGA.text: Very poor food taste. We got wings, a philly sausage ensemble and the voodoo burger with fried pickles. The only thing that's good there is their blue cheese! To die for. Not sure why this place is so highly rated. Service was mediocre and beer was somewhat flat. Bartenders were not friendly either.

vHd5eb0T90Ktcmk79wjnbA.text: Fat Heads has a great gluten free menu. Not to many restaurants offer such a large menu for gluten free.  Fat heads has a separate kitchen for gluten free items. Best place for burgers and wings! We are regulars and yes they know our names! Lol. We go at least once a week!

9NFDOF8yBWr3BzWzgZidTw.text: Was in Pittsburgh for 2 nights for a Penguins game...we ventured out to East Carlson street for the second day of our stay around noon. We were just planing to hit all the bars and find one we liked. Well, we ended up here for 6 hours. What a great time we had.   The sandwiches are as big as your head, and loaded with all the ingredients and they are absolute deliciousness.   I drank The Epic Big Bad Baptista...very dark bourbon Stout. 12.5%...after 4 of them I was feeling very well. My fiance drank the rhubarb cider as well as Fat Heads own BumbleBerry which I have to say for a lighter beer, it had great flavor.  Nonetheless, stop here, sit at the bar, make friends around you and enjoy yourself. I will absolutely return to this place on every trip to Pittsburgh.  I believe our Bartender's name was Carrie, but I could be completely off...however if it was, she was great, and very personable. We had a great afternoon here.

uhrJ06aPZWb_D_-5r5uyWw.text: Great beer selection with OK food.  This is one of the premier beer establishments in Pittsburgh.  It is usually extremely crowded on the weekends though.  It's pretty famous for the headwiches and burgers that are as big as your head, which are A-OK in my book.  They also have a lot of the traditional pub fare, which can be hit or miss.  Also, it's non-smoking!  Yay!  Definitely, will keep coming back here.

slhBLrF4ywryl2DthAPNSw.text: Amazing beer selection. If you have the opportunity, sit at the bar while it's slow and let the bartender walk you through some different samples. The bartenders are fabulous and really seem to have a grasp on the styles. Definitely one of the best bars for craft beer drinkers in the city. The sandwiches and french onion soup are  fantastic. If you're going to go for a Headwich, I'd definitely get the Southside Slopes.

GjGKtmRQfMF5j_44FjNtUw.text: I have been to the Cleveland location over a dozen times and have always had great service and food. I came to the original location because my whole family are big fans of Fatheads and wanted to check this place out.   Everything was great until the last ten minutes of our time in the restaurant. There was a mix up with the bill. Myself and the people I was with misunderstood something the waitress said and asked her about it. She started off nice, but quickly turned nasty and started raising her voice at us. We asked for the manager and he came out after a few minutes. Nice guy, didn't give us any problems and quickly took care of the situation.   After our bill was adjusted, the waitress came back, slammed the receipt on the table and in the snottiest tone I have ever heard said, "I took care of your bill and just so you know, I didn't charge you for your ranch dressing, which we are supposed to do" and stormed off. Um, ok, thanks for doing us a favor?  A friend and I went to the restroom before we left and when we were walking back to our table, we walked past the kitchen (which is right next to the restrooms) we could clearly hear the manager and the waitress talking about our situation - kinda unprofessional, knowing that people can see and hear everything going on in there.   It is a shame because we had high expectations and left knowing we will never go back to this location again. Had the waitress right away, before the situation escalated, said "let me get my manager," our experience may have been a lot better. And knowing that we had a high bill, and being good tippers, she could have had much more than the average 15% but instead, she got a 3% tip and hopefully a lesson in how to talk to customers.

f44iFhyUyZdku5ph5m7_YQ.text: I'm not traditionally a gigantic-greasy-food-&-beer type of girl, but the men in my life have raved about Fatheads enough that I figured I'd give it a fair chance.   The atmosphere is great, dimly lit, brick walls covered with beer paraphernalia, and TVs with some sports game on. I'm informed that there's usually a wait, but we didn't have to wait at all.   Our server was really helpful. After telling her that I really don't like beer at all, she suggested that I try a framboise lambic and brought over three samples for me to try. Very friendly and accommodating.   The food was great as well, a big chicken sandwich for me and a great burger for my boyfriend.   Overall, I was pleasantly surprised that I loved the food and atmosphere at Fathead's.

YSGKP061n4ewW74bRFLHLw.text: One of my favorite places to go out when i visit Pittsburgh. I haven't had the food yet, but the beer selection is excellent. One really annoying this about this place is that I've stopped by a few times when they are closing or are closed before their posted closing time. It seems that they don't stick to the posted hours and instead close when it gets slow. But, I guess the reason I am most annoyed by that is, because I like the place so much.

-6Ua3qky44gpVO_2_km-8Q.text: One of my favorite places in Pittsburgh!   You cannot go wrong here.  Very extensive beer menu, great sandwiches, and wings.  Could be my favorite wings of all time with a great variety if flavors.   Sandwiches are fantastic as well.  Many many beers to choose from.  What more could you want?

E93AIdNMvInov2S61pUwog.text: The wait is never that terrible, unless you're down on a Friday night - and even then, grab a beer at the bar to nurse your sadness. It's not like there isn't a few to choose from.  Fat Head's has one of the greatest beer selections I've ever seen. Add to that a constantly rotating stock, and delicious food (I recommend the Beauty and the Beastie sandwich, pulled pork and cole slaw, piled high and spicy to boot) and you've got a winner. The only drawback is conversation can be difficult when it's crowded, but if you're looking for a quiet sit-down restaurant, there's other places nearby.  Go upstairs to buy individual bottles and six-packs of beers you want - thanks to PA's archaic alcohol laws, this is one of the few places you can get beer in anything smaller than a case.

1kGDnLqW0R_1vOmVXcNEzw.text: There is no better combination than a Chicken McMinns sandwich and a Head Hunter draft. The most unique sandwich menu in Pittsburgh. A must try location.

uIbD4Hyp237uHSSZwNKC8g.text: Vegetarians-great black bean burger, incredible service and micro-brews.  Easy atmosphere.

8ICcQMET5lYfYFRWskoR5Q.text: A big menu selection with even bigger size portions (so big I took half of my sandwich home). I thought my meal was delicious and was impressed with the amount of sandwich/burger options on the menu that I was torn between.  Definitely a place to check out in Southside.

EYEANW5KwgK9Z2NdugFoIg.text: Update: I've been here three times this week and each time has been terrific - sandwiches dangerously good, starve yourself all day to prepare, HeadHunter each night, other beers ok but not as terrific. Had the Double D, then the Expert Pastrami, each time excellent and memorable. If you aren't a big fan of smorgasbords on a bun, this might not be your place!!!

26CPZ4JCaylJv-b2Sm53hw.text: What can you say about this place? Excellent craft beer selection including several Fatheads Brewery beers. The sandwiches are enormous, and my personal favorite is the Bay of Pigs, fatheads' take on the Cuban. The wings are delicious as well.

s_9TsM6h9S6btr0TXW0R9w.text: Beers are good as were the wings, but the burgers were a BIG disappointment. Flavorless and uninteresting.  Portions were way too big--bordering on ridiculous.  Service was good.  Would go back for a beer and appetizer but that is it

VI0j363Q-gZfnzcJeHLDCw.text: Originally wanted to go to Fat Heads for its beer menu but was easily pleased with its enormous menu.  And I do mean, enormous.  First off, the portions are obese-like.  I shared an order of 20 garlic-parm wings, 20 original wings, and bacon cheddar fries.  I also order the planet r headwich.  The headwich was what is expected from reading the description.  Nothing gourmet but yet tasty.  I fell in love with the garlic-parm wings as the combo really work to perfection.    Considering the gimmicky feel to the please, it's definitely a local joint and definitely a great eats.

XSahbWrpmMDw2ZWH6Tsdqg.text: Been here a couple of times during a weekend away in Pittsburgh.  Everything is excellent and the craft beer lineup is top class.

k5yNZe8Bm1GGmEg01_0FgA.text: They have some crazy sandwiches but they seemed a little bland to me.  The concepts were good but the execution was not.  The craft beer selection is pretty good and they have some ciders from Arsenal.  I would stop in for sure but there are other places in the city I would eat first.

9_sNcUkQPC8onEQhOuAy1w.text: I have been to Pittsburgh and both times I have had drinks at this bar. The food is excellent, as well as the beer selection. Lots of IPAs on tap. Also, the surrounding area has lots of bars and restaurants. If visiting Pittsburgh, you have to go to the South Side.

AHu-Dom1Qy9vC2eYSpeUBQ.text: The wait wasn't as bad as I expected after reading the earlier reviews. Top notch beer selection and the sandwiches are huge. Unfortunately it was either the liquor or the killer sauce in my sandwich that attacked me the next day. I am not a fan of the killer sauce.   I would have purchased some silly solvenier crap at the gift shop upstairs but there was nobody there to cash me out.

FrpnjUqoFehAYYNgSCIohg.text: It's a good thing I don't live in Pittsburgh because I would eat here too often for it to be good for me. If you want a good, plain burger/sandwich with lettuce and tomato, you can get it here.  If you want a fantastic burger/sandwich with anything and everything but the kitchen sink on it, you can also get it here.  Definitely worth a stop in.

XkcyIwP8_xha3ksb7IMIzQ.text: great place to go with buddies on Carson st, provided the wait isn't too long.  the portions are massive even for me, and the extensive draft selection is great and they have several of their own brews on tap.  the environment is spacious and clean and the staff very friendly and attentive.

u2PZTRrd2Dg-N9amxC0zfQ.text: Fat heads has amazing beer selection! My favorite has to be the honey blueberry beer, which has floating berries in it. The sandwiches are bigger than your head and you will never leave hungry. A little pricy but worth it for the amount of foot that you are getting. I also like the open eating area when it is warm outside!

WbZgix5eepgZnH49B1k0uQ.text: -The Fat Heads Saloon is located on East Carson which is a great strip of bars in downtown Pitt.  We stayed at the Double Tree which offers a free shuttle so it worked out beautifully.  After our beer buying trip around town we headed back to Fat Heads. It's a big place with a very nice bar.  Early in the day it's pretty dead, but at night its PACKED.    -At lunch I had tried the Headhunter which was outstanding.  I also tried a Ballast Point Sculpin because I had heard how great it was and we didn't get it in Buffalo.  -Fat Heads has a great beer menu with lots to choose from. Not only do they have about 10 beers of their own, they also have about 20-25 guest taps.  -The food was okay, servings were WAY too much food but I guess that's why it's called FAT Heads.  -Upstairs is merchandise and beer where you can create your own six pack. There's only about 4 coolers full of beer and let me tell you it isn't cheap. A six pack of sculpin was about 40$..ouch.  -On my next trip to Pittsburgh we went back and enjoyed their delicious beer once again. However this time around we got to experience Sunshine Daydream and this was a fantastic beer. A session IPA, at only 5%. I've had session beers and this one kills them all.   -If you're looking to buy their beer they only sell the Headhunter and Blueberry in bottles, the rest you can get growlers filled, however it MUST be a Fat Heads growler (they will take your non-Fat Heads growler however and replace it with theirs for free). But you can purchase their bottled beer at Fat Heads or simply walk up East Carson and buy a case at the beer store down the street.   -Street parking only.

8EGnLOjHTaP58h-kUJYMKA.text: My boyfriend and I went to your restaurant tonight. Our server was Melissa. Every time I requested to try something or a description of the food it was never a problem. We tried soup,wings, sandwich everything was amazing. The service was top notch the hostess changed our table. Thanks everyone for a wonderful night. Go to this local business and have a great time.

wq6uIdWSnigkjriLDO94Qg.text: I am a HUGE fan of this place!!! Everything I've ever ordered has been amazing, but I definitely have my favorites. I always order the smoked chicken and choke dip. I wish they made a pasta with it! Or even a sandwich! I tried making it before but something about theirs is indisputably the best. Along with that I'm crazy for the Mighty fine Bovine. The hot pepper kraut is something special and the brisket? Sheesh! I can't say anything negative other than sometimes if you dine inside it's usually packed and hard to find a spot with a TV if a game is on. And if that's the case, order takeout! It's just as delicious!!!

Ju1-AUZwep_lannvPpCrhw.text: Clean old fashion bar with extension menu. Large unusual beer selection. Beer logos painted on brick walls gives the room an eclectic look. Our group had spicy shrimp, coconut shrimp, mussels. Sandwiches included burgers, Rueban, portabella wrap, tuna wrap...We like Fat Heads.

Wq9JdK7amXmI-cnO4kzTjg.text: Good food but the server sucked. Not friendly and he would not check back with us unless we waived him down. We ordered Coconut Shrimp and Wings for appetizers. He brought out the shrimp but no wings. After 10 mins we flagged him down and asked about the wings and he said "oh I thought you wanted them with your burger "?????  No idea why he would assume that.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beach Burger.
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coconut Shrimp

8Op1LIy4VHWkLulW3hm_tg.text: Amazing food and great servers! The meal wait time was a little long (about 15 - 20 minutes) but well worth it. I personally recommend the bacon cheese burger with fries. The fries are crispy and just the right amount of saltiness and  the very juicy but not dripping wet medium well burger is amazingly full of flavour. I would give it a 5 star rating if only the wait time for food was a little shorter but then again it was a busy night and that, I understand.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon Cheese Burger and Crispy Fries.

BNp3Z73aOC8yiK2RY0Y5rQ.text: Waited nearly 30 minutes for 2 medium burgers that were served to us well done, not even a speck of pink. Claimed to be half a pound, but appeared more like a third. Our server also left much to be desired as she mostly ignored our table when there was clearly a problem. Prior to serving the food, I had to yell at her to stop and asked if we were going to get our food soon since it'd been an extensive wait and people who arrived after us were minutes into their meals. She went to check on it and came back after someone else had served us asking, "Was that quick enough for you?" No, actually, it wasn't. Other than the bartender who was incredibly nice and attentive, I couldn't find anything nice to say about this place. Over-hyped. Come to Buffalo, we have significantly better gems than this.

3BamnBZ1Seyu40DIArtMfQ.text: Fatheads, I'm officially in love with you!  Having relocated from Buffalo, NY, I've been searching for good wings.  I never thought it would be such a hard task.  When I was lamenting over the lack of a good wing, my coworker recommended Fat Heads.  I may have to kiss him tomorrow.  Ok, maybe not, but they officially have the best wings I've had outside of Buffalo.  First, they actually call them wings.  Just wings!  They serve them with blue cheese, celery and carrots! And they are plump in size and cooked with a nice crisp.  Mmmmm. Their beer list is impressive as well.  I tried both the Santa's cinnamon apple cider and the Fatheads Holly Jolly Ale and loved both. The sandwiches looked incredible and came with home made chips.  I'm not sure I'll ever venture to that side of the menu because of how much I enjoy the wings, but there were plenty of unique and interesting combinations to satisfy any taste buds. I'm really looking forward to a repeat visit!

pD0CgHK5hp37x0tCRd-bbQ.text: I love fatheads! Everything I get here is always massive and delicious. The service is good too.

IMjVE0PzHdjddgLL3xV8Fw.text: I've been a regular for years. Beer selection is excellent (about 40 on tap) -- and I only drink IPAs but usually I can find something I haven't tried before. But, often it is never there again. I miss Gordon, for example. Headhunter is always on tap. I have seen people drinking Bud Light in bottles so they have that, too.  The ribs get my vote for unsung hero. No one ever mentions them. Wings are tasty. I like spicy parmesan. Burgers are super, although I am not particular about the "doneness" of a burger. I have also enjoyed many sandwiches with pastrami and/or brisket.  Overall, above average bar food with a great beer list. You may have to wait for a table; but once you are seated, you never feel rushed. Servers are friendly. In reading other reviews, many rave about the portions; but, a lot of it is bread, plates overflowing with chips, and salads constructed from a head of iceberg lettuce.  Try the ribs. The full rack is 2.5 meals including fries. Beware the angry onion rings. Spicy going down and coming out the next day. Not recommended for vegans.

wC2xpofuAmvSQruwaypHXg.text: Mixed Grille is one of the best breffases in all of the Burgh.  Small diner, but super good food. Plenty of parking in the lot across the street.

R79-L6UUErO3ZE13JSANYQ.text: Their sandwiches (called headwiches) are huge. During weekend nights, the bar area gets to be pretty crowded, and you an hour wait for a table during dinnertime isn't unusual. They also have a huge selection of beers. I'm not a beer drinker, so I can't say much about that. It's pretty loud in here, so you do have to almost yell to talk to your buddies.  I came here on a Thursday around 6pm, and surprisingly, there were plenty of open tables. The headwiches consist of interesting combinations of just about anything a person might put on a sandwich. Normal sandwich meat, fried eggs, steak, mushrooms, pulled pork, brisket, bacon, chicken fingers, etc.  I ordered a Portly Fellow (one of the few things without meat), which consists of portabello mushrooms, roasted red peppers, spinach, tomato sauce, basil pesto, onion rings, mozzarella, goat cheese, and parmesan. Yes, the different cheeses sounds a bit excessive. It was just as massive as the other sandwiches, and there was a pretty good balance of flavors. I had some bites with a massive glob of goat cheese and nothing else, which was not particularly pleasant.  Some of my colleagues got burgers, which are much smaller than the sandwiches. You can consider them normal-sized. They all enjoyed their burgers as well.  Sandwiches are served with homemade chips. Some were really crispy, others were soggy from sitting in a puddle of oil. Burgers and some other items are served with fries. The fries are maybe almost steak fries, so there was no crunch to them. I would have preferred the fries over the chips, but they do NOT allow substitutions on that -- as explained by a long paragraph in the menu that I did not fully understand even after reading several times. All in all, a pretty good gigantic sandwich with chips on the side that I did not care for.

HX_xiuvlez_Z_gXXSCp28w.text: Their own brews, big portions and bar centered atmosphere leads me to love Fat Heads. Although I'd love to get fries instead of chips for some of their sandwiches. (Cough cough) For the winter beer we grabbed a Pimp My Sleigh and Holly Jolly. Neither disappointed. The only thing I miss are the hot onion rings.

ohWw_24uhX5hRiiO2fOwLg.text: Fun place to watch a Pittsburgh game! Great food and service. The Southside Slopes sandwich is a must-have. It was char-grilled kielbasa and sauteed pierogi on a sandwich...enough said. Tons of food options (including some vegetarian) and lots of beers on tap. Their own Fat Head's beer was awesome, too. Definitely try this place, and come in with an empty stomach!

ZNLBjJ50-VeOLAXFsV3pHg.text: The reigning champion of wingdom, so far.  I'm a Texan and these are, by far, the biggest wings you'll see this side of heaven.  The 'original' are phenomenal & the cheddar are a unique change of pace.  Try them grilled as well.  Haven't had a bad flavor yet. The fact that they have an amazing beer selection, just adds to the euphoria.

MxzcDQdkouk-62ldyCinIg.text: The amount of diverse Beer options at this place makes is deserving of a 5. The food options are immense and a step up above most bars/pubs, but they have an ethnic twist representing several of the original settlers of P'burg with a big representation from the Eastern European cuisine, such as perogies, shoved into huge sandwiches. The place is also just fun, with alot going on and a True mix of clientele, from families with young children, hipsters to bikers, and it works. For these reasons we put Fat Heads at the top of a must visit spot in Pittsburgh. The surrounding Southside neighborhood is also fun to explore with several other diverse food options.

UfMoPBII9zsiIp22segs5A.text: Was in town for a date day with the wife & this place was recommended by a good friend who had been there numerous times. I was familiar with the brands beers, but not their food. Absolutely did not disappoint.
