Plenty of awesome beer options - both of their own and other varieties - and the food was top notch (I had the Philly Steak...VERY GOOD.) Prices were not bad & the neighborhood is interesting in that "hip, cool" kinda way.

gy7UNeG9rmh9FldWjuTwcg.text: Fat Heads is my favorite casual bar/restaurant in Pittsburgh.  They have an enormous selection of 40+ tasty beers on tap as well as several award winning microbrews made in house.  They are all listed with their alcohol percentage and are well described and organized by category on the menu, so whether you like porters or pilsener (Or even if you don't know what that means yet), they'll help you find a new beer you'll love.  They also have a 6 pack shop where you can take your favorite beers home with you!  The service is always fast and friendly, the ambience is fun and including outdoor seating in the summer and most importantly the food is AMAZING!  Fat Heads are wizards with the noble potato.  My personal favorite is Pedro's nachos, fresh cut potato chip piled high with ground beef, sour cream, cheese and everything else delicious.  They have similar plates with potato skins and fries as well.    All their portions are deadly serious, I usually split one appetizer or entree between 3 people and still can barely finish it!  Their menu is lengthy, offering every kind of bar food you can imagine: Wings, Subs, Burgers, Salads, Headwiches (Sandwiches the size of your head), etc.  Every single dish I've had there has been the platonic ideal of bar food.  Always full flavored, generously portioned, hot and freshly prepared and home made.  If you're getting fueled up for a wild night in the south side or a game downtown, look no further then the Fat Heads Saloon!

wz8Su086N9SraAsysGi9LQ.text: Never had a bad meal.  My family & I love this place.  Great selection of beer too.  They are also on the NoWait app so if you're on your way you can get in line and not have to wait as long when you get there.  The patio is great to sit on in the warmer weather, and they close it off when it gets colder.  Great atmosphere, great food!

PpffX9DKHn0GErmVEVK0NQ.text: Oh my goodness, where do I even get started about Fat Heads? This is my all time favorite sandwich restaurant. Although the only thing I don't like is that you have to get chips instead of french fries. But that's not really something to complain about. Anyways, I have always gotten the Turkey Wrap and it has always tasted better every single time I've ordered it. Their food always tastes fresh and they put exactly the right amount of each ingredient in their sandwiches. I would recommend anyone to go to Fat Heads due to their amazing customer service and delicious sandwiches and wraps.

zz5x7OO7gn0JziC7SyIcMw.text: Everything is over the top huge, and battered. Really greasy.  I wouldn't go here again. Dissappointed.

Gifg1z2tCgDeZuJKN4w_wQ.text: WHAT? Sandwich's as big as your head, with tons of different stuff on them...  Awesome beer selection, great atmosphere...  This place + some friends= one of the best times you ever had!  FYI: they are pretty cool about you doing whatever you want to a headwich...more sauce, add this, extra that, :)

_4mPu5qjM9o7RV69Bl5x4g.text: This place has a spectacular beer selection,  and the brisket French dip is to die for! If you go on the weekend,  it'll be completely packed,  so consider going during the week.

o4NHle7orGoXYBzGmR5kFw.text: Not that this place needs another review, but I'd like to give the out-of-towner review.  I've heard good things about this place on yelp as we were trying to fine a pre-game restuanrant on Carson.  We were expecting long lines thanks to previous yelp reviews so that wasn't a big issue.  The bar was extremely packed so we went to one of the bars next door to have a couple of beers before dinner.  We went back to FHS after about 45 min so our name wouldn't be called and us not be there.  We asked one of the friendly hostesses how much longer the wait was and she said not very long so we made our way to the bar.  Within 2 min she came and got us and said we're not next but she saw us and didn't feel like screaming, which was very nice of her.  Onto the food.....  We both had a burger, I had the Renee and my girlfriend had just a normal burger.  I gotta say it was much better than I expected and I left with a full and tired belly.  The waitress was not overly friendly but not overly attitude-ish as well.  She helped us out with some after dinner bars (see my review of Marios).  Fat Heads is definitely a place to go if you're visiting Pittsburgh or if you are extremely hungry.  I'll probably go back when/if I visit Pittsburgh again.

ymoYwbcApt5LW59J0q8Htg.text: We went to the Cleveland location first, then we went here.  This one is nicer and you can tell it's the flagship location.  The menu and portions are absolutely ridiculous.  You really don't need to get any appetizers here unless you want to take food home.  BUT, if you do get an appetizer, the shrooms are probably the way to go.  Never impressed by a fried mushroom before, I was impressed with these.  Big mushrooms with a really great horseradish sauce alongside them.  My girlfriend was a big fan of the Angry Cheesesteak as well.  And my buffalo chicken salad was huge and satisfying.  Great service and a great beer list, too.  Headhunter IPA!

aP-Dlz85pHOafUTL1s5kuQ.text: One of Pittsburgh's must visit bars. Fatheads is almost always busy with a 30-60ish minute wait for a table every Friday + Saturday night. With that statistic, you'd think this was some kind of fancy, trendy restaurant. But, it's really not, it's a bar. A bar with a great beer selection, including their own brews, and a really delicious menu. This just goes to show that some of the best, most popular places don't have to be fancy or have a trendy foodie following. It just has to be damn good.   I'm a fan of their killer sauce hot wings. It makes me salivate just thinking about them. They have a huge selection of sandwiches, both heart-attack style and healthier. The big famous sandwich is the Southside Slope piled with kielbasa, pierogies, and toppings. But, since I am not (or try not to be) that much of a glutton, I'd go with the Meatless Millie, their pierogies sandwich with sauerkraut.  **I interrupt this review with a public service announcement**   You can not check out the Pittsburgh food scene without eating pierogies. what are they? don't ask, just order. Places to get good pierogies: Fatheads (duh.), Bloomfield Bridge Tavern (BBT), Church Brew Works, some Polish grandma's kitchen.   **Now back to your regular programming**  With a good selection of salads to choose from, even your healthy eating friends will enjoy Fatheads. But the real question is: why do you have healthy eating friends? and why would you go out to eat with them?   Oh, and last but definitely not least, the beer. That you'll have to experience for yourself.

w7eEz_97XCAWbI6_MBkbQA.text: Love fat heads. Just visited again after a long absence and better than ever. Fun atmosphere, great service, lots of beers, great sandwiches. Always a long line so sometimes i go elsewhere. Not any more.

DfbAfEwkm9HS_y2ptI6NMQ.text: The menu was great a lot of good things to choose from. If you order an appetizer make sure you have some one there that will help you with it. It is like a meal in its self. All the sandwiches are very big and It is difficult to finish your sandwich after the appetizer. They have pretty good beer selection but you prob won't want more then 1 because you'll be so full from the food. Which isn't bad considering the beer Is a little pricey. My waitress was not bad just seemed very busy.it was hard at times to get ahold of her to ask for something else. Overall this place has great sandwiches I would def eat here again

fo4vhbzTEA2eowLppksBAg.text: Pittsburgh isn't exactly a great food city, but the places that are good are really good. Fat Head's is definitely one of the best in Pittsburgh.  The plates here are enormous, the beers are ice cold. What more can you ask for?  I ordered the Bacon Burger with fries. The burger was good, however it was a just a frozen patty. I believe it was a half pounder topped with cheddar cheese and bacon. The bun was definitely a highlight, lightly toasted but perfectly soft on the inside.   The beer selection is extensive. They have a great draft selection of their own microbrews as well as domestic and imports.   Overall, the service was very personable, the food was good, the beer was good and the price was right. Definitely worth it if you're in Pittsburgh.

O60uwQlQKLMy2SeQs8i0xg.text: The Good:  I always take my out of town guests to Fat Heads.  It's one of my Pittsburgh "landmarks".  I love the ridiculously over-sized sandwiches, and I'm a sucker for house-made chips and fries.  Plus, who can resist that beer list?  If you've got a large group, order apps.  Pierogies!  Pretzels!  More Chips!  The Not-so-Good:  I'm always disappointed with anything that includes Parmesan.  They always use WAY too much of it.  It makes me sick.

cD7Iz0GcLbDow-X969zcKg.text: This place is crazy popular and for several reasons.  I came in on a Saturday afternoon that was bumping.   We were told it would be an hour long wait, so we headed to the bar which is of a big enough size to hold enough people waiting.  I had two different beers which were fantastic.  The food was worth the wait.  Perogi appetizer was really good.  I order the bacon cheeseburger which was good, although the patty was a bit too small for the bun.  The bun was of really good quality, which is super important.  The fries were also good and large in number.  Sandwiches come with chips, I grabbed some and was BLOWN away.  These are not chips from a bag, these are fantastic homemade chips.  So goooood and reasonably priced.  Also, if you buy a mix-n-match six-pack of beer in the little store up top, there is some special deal like $10 off or something.  Worth checking out!

UKdV70m_KeM5UmpPlFCdlQ.text: Took my wife here for the lunch on Saturday. At 2 p.m. the place was packed as they were kicking off local Micro Brew week.  This place is outstanding and a must go to for the beer geek. The selection is outstanding, including their own. If you like an IPA, and they have their Head Hunter IPA, gotta try it. One of the best in the country. The food does not disappoint either. Great food. I highly recommend.

VQlOl2EftCYpGLhqwBaOpQ.text: My favorite bar food in Pittsburgh  As a Pittsburgh resident since college, I've now been enjoying Fat Heads for 18 years. Great wings, enormous sandwiches, and a great beer selection. Fine dining it is not, but bar food done spectacularly it is. A great meal or drink stop, although the lines on a weekend evening for a table will cause many to walk away, but it's worth the wait.

rB4wv0XyD5MsOusN3LJk4g.text: Good craft-brewed beers, and a more ambitious selection than you usually find in one operation (lagers, pilsners, ales, porters, etc.).  The food is good and the portions are really enormously large and huge.  Good service.  Maybe not the cleanest place, but it is a bar in Iron City after all.  And speaking of bars ... how about leaving the screeching kiddies at home?  Please?

wd62g95ZqdEfiSEWi3IQdw.text: The food and the beer selection are top notch. The service is not.   Depending on when you go and where you end up sitting, you're going to have a different experience each time. If you end up along the back left stone wall past the bar, you're probably going to get a full-time waiter / waitress that knows what they're doing and is very personable. If you end up anywhere near the the outside patio or the front desk, you'd probably get better service at a Dennys. Maybe that's where they put the part-timers who don't last, who knows.   The front desk is horrid. It's a bunch of women who don't know how to assign seating and scoff if you ask to be moved away from the tables that are right near the 20 degree doorway. One particular blonde should have probably been fired the day she was hired. As good as the food is, the last handful of times my party and I had been treated like animals because we didn't want to sit in a refrigerator while we ate. That's not how it works.

rsyKBKlq3gwBS-YpEn7Gig.text: This is one of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh's South Side. Draft beer selection is one of the best.  The new menu is great.  The old menu was good too, but they made it smaller which helps out.  (There was no need to have every type of sandwich imaginable....makes it frustrating to decide.). I highly recommend the Turkey Reuben, and the chips are phenomenal!

7Ct8JT_DTEPilzPZu9QLig.text: Fatheads makes some really nice beers.  The food portions are huge, good value.  I never have been amazed with the flavors.  I think their food is mediocre at best.  I have to say the portion size is the draw.   Hard to get a table or seat at the bar.  Always seems busy... Overall though its definately worth a look.. Would rate 3.5 if I could, but definately not a 4.

t8CGXxOch6-qGgp_ACPzCg.text: Mussels and stuffed banana peppers were very good. Baked pierogi left something to be desired, a little too much dough. We got here very late, and had a fairly large party, but they still accommodated us, so kudos for that. The front/bar area was PACKED, but the back seating/eating area was spacious. Definitely going back.

hsfH1H7sDHmuQnNSpRzmJA.text: How can you go wrong with a place that serves burgers bigger than most plates, makes their own homemade potato chips, and oh yeah...has great microbrews. If you don't drink and/or are a vegetarian it is probably in your best interest to stay away from here. For the rest of you, if you don't mind a little wait for some really good food and even better beer it is imperative that you give Fat Heads a try when in Pittsburgh.

uD9jIRfvvOKft0adWz5HbA.text: This is a Pittsburgh fave in Southside.  Come hungry, portions are enormous and reasonably priced. We had the Southside Slope, Original Cheesesteak, & pierogis.  Sandwiches & Headwiches come with House Chips - no substitutions allowed.  If you want fries or rings, you have to order separately as a side.  Everything was good!  Service was outstanding, although it wasn't very busy.  Great beers, good atmosphere!  Definitely worth visiting!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogis
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Southside Slopes Headwich

lfpD71HQRNSbozF0YnBK1g.text: We came here on a big game evening and it was as you can imagine: packed. However, we were still able to get a table for two. At first, we were seated by the window and there was a cold draft. We asked to be moved and the waitress politely obliged. I ordered a steak salad and my friend ordered the Triple Bypass Burger. He thoroughly enjoyed that burger. In fact there was nothing left on the plate. My salad was decent. The steak was pretty tender, but it could have used a little more flavor. But I guess that's what happens when you get a salad at a burger joint, right? Not bad at all, would come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Triple Bypass Burger
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caesar Salad w/ Steak

iyINx3PBwPRNrfxJ8mV_jQ.text: We were in town for a concert and have been watching to come here for awhile. Finally got our chance   Glad we did. Our waiter was very friendly, the beer was awesome and the food was great. Wish we lived closer, we'd come here more often. I also loved that that you can put yourself on the wait this with the Yelp app.

KYhI3bng__JnXH_0TdxSbg.text: Was in town visiting friends for the weekend and we stopped through here for a bite to eat.  Wait time: We were a party of 6 and we were told 45 mins, but the wait was less than 30  Food: I got the chicken spinach artichoke dip and it's DELICIOUS. The wings and bacon cheese fries were also delicious.   The only thing I didn't like was that you can't swap your fry selection. I so wasnt very impressed with the burger I ordered. It lacked seasoning.  Service: Our server was awesome and all of her recommendations were spot on!  I didn't have any of the drinks because I was driving home right after, but I'd definitely visit again!

dC4irYo1jRV5n9QTTz1iBg.text: A solid bar that serves lots of house Fat Heads brews spanning many styles that you've probably never even heard of, but also has lots of guest offerings from other breweries. There must have been at least three dozen offerings when I visited.  Better yet, the breadth of the beer offerings is matched by the sheer breadth of food offerings here. I personally enjoyed the house Bumbleberry Honey Blueberry Ale alongside one of their "headwiches," named because they're "the size of your head." No kidding! The "mo betta beef n' chedda" was packed with house-smoked brisket, house-made bacon, roasted mushrooms, sharp cheddar, and chipotle mayo. Absolutely delish! No matter what you pick, chances are that it'll be quite a few notches above regular, humdrum bar fare.  The ambience is boisterous even for a weekend morning, and service is super fast and efficient. A great find thanks to all you Yelpers out there!

K5geQ6ZCXtogdcMEYvjMxA.text: They have an extensive beer list and a large bar food menu. I'm not blown away by the food but if you're in the mood to down a ton of calories, this is the place for you. Also there is usually a wait on the weekend and the bar is always crowded.

sEMvv9MCdnrfNmBRlpcpWA.text: A group of us ordered lunch from here recently. I think they managed to mess up everyone's meal one way or another. Fries were unsalted. One guy and I ordered the same burger, and he wanted no sauce on his...they ended up omitting sauce from mine as well. I asked for lett/tom/on & pickle on the side....received none. Other people complained about their food as well. Additionally, we ordered for a certain time, giving them plenty of time to prepare, but the guys still had to wait 20 min after arriving. They suspected they didnt even start cooking until they arrived...also mentioned it wasn't busy at all, so they really just have no excuse. Really disappointing...won't order pick up again.

vjWp3fo1yQ7ReOR-d4JykA.text: Stopped in while on a visit to the burgh. We had garlic Parmesan wings, French onion soup (excellent) Caesars salad and it was good. Service was great. The specialty beers were fantastic. My niece had the steak salad and was very happy with it. This is a great find.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zI2Q_oY1qa09DnVXWqu8JQ.text: A friend of mine introduced me to this place when I was on a visit to Pittsburgh, and I fell in love with it. Some of the most unique and delicious sandwiches I've ever had. Unfortunately I heard that they have decreased the size of their menu and have gone downhill since my last visit - I hope that's not the case!

ozB_kpWIhlzZivjBHVL_rQ.text: Our group of 5 came in after an 8 hr day at Roethlisberger camp. We were starving. The only complaint i have is that you can't check in with a group larger than 4 so we had to physically go into the restaurant to check in where we were told the wait would be an hour. The app told us 9-20 minutes. Not sure how those apps are updated but the app was correct, not the actual human employee, which we found odd, but were very happy it wasn't an hour wait. And very glad we didn't end up leaving to find a restaurant with less wait time. We've never eaten here so we didn't know the deliciousness we'd miss out on had we left.   We sat in a little waiting area/gift shop before we were taken to our table. We had time to look at the menus to see what we wanted. The descriptions of the different meals were all really well written and some funny. They seated us upstairs (the kids really liked that) The kids also got a kick out of the name of the establishment. Our friends ordered the giant pretzel that came with 3 sauces and the cheese stix appetizer. Really delicious.   The sandwiches we ordered were huge! And they came with homemade potatoes chips. My son ordered the Big beefy bbq headwich. I ordered the Southside Slopes headwich (not something I would usually order but I'm glad I tried it) I ate half of the sandwich at Fat Heads and could not wait to eat the rest the next day for lunch. The food was great. The waitress and service were excellent. I would definitely go back here to try another one of their sandwiches.

SklOJG07jfnbHmY2yNQGPg.text: Overrated wait too long for mediocre food they have a great beer selection service is slow.

cLmZ-6TGCkEnYFK9ttBbZw.text: This was my first time visiting this restaurant and it was so worth it. A couple of friends and I came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. They didnt do anything special like sing which was honestly kind of disappointing. I had looked at their menu before visiting as I heard their sandwiches were big and tasty. However, when we got there, we noticed that Monday night is Wing Night and wings are 60 cents each. We knew this was a game changer that we had to go with. I went with some Garlic Parm and Black & Yellow wings as we could mix and match sauces. I also added some onion rings as a side. The wait for our food was pretty long and for about 25 minutes even though the place didnt seem that packed. My Garlic Parm wings were probably my favorite but had too much cheese on them so I was happy I did not order a lot. Some of my friends got the same wings and another type of wings with parmesan cheese and they both agreed about the cheese. The Black & Yellow wings had some type of tangy barbecue sauce which were pretty tasty too. The onion rings were very flavorful and extremely crispy which I enjoyed. I tried a couple of the home made chips that come with sandwiches but they were honestly not that great as some weren't crispy and tasty enough and just tasted plain. Overall, the wings were definitely the highlight of the meal as they were really good and great for their price. Everyone was satisfied with their meals and very full. Our server was very friendly and visited us pretty often. I definitely recommend coming here for the wings and beer.

jKNrhmB4dmSIbs4SOlbStA.text: A better version of TGI Fridays with a local bent. Sports, local beers, new takes on bar food, and attitude. Tons of better alternatives blocks away.

otLz4rvu81c001Zud5XORA.text: Beer is awesome. Atmosphere is good. Wait staff were above average. I would recommend just for their beer menu. Ive gone to this restaurant a few times now and gotten a burger. It is a pretty good place for a burger and side but not spectacular.

VZjwZn4kKe6XWhxFnngfRA.text: You can't say anything bad about FatHeads.The beer selection is large they not only have there name brand beer but have a great selection of other brands.My favorite is Bumbleberry .You can order anything off the menu and it will be a great choice.some sandwiches come with French fries or chips and they don't let you switch them but both are good so it's no big deal.Sometime there's a very long wait till you can get a table so I would check before you go.Upstairs they have a little shop where you can buy beer or t-shirts.Its worth a trip up the steps

uy4aAfhTPDyoWtUxB9Jycg.text: First time visiting Pittsburgh and luckily was with a local. We ventured to Fat Heads for a beer and sandwich. I got the chipotle chicken cheesecake.... AMAZING! We also got the onion rings. The batter surprisingly had a kick and it was a happy surprise. Their beer selection is great and the October fest was very festive.   The venue is very chill and casual. Has old school subway tile behind the bar with a crazy cool metal tin ceiling. The side room has an open air feel with doors that open up to a small patio. Lights strung ahead, makes for a cool scene.

cIJFFVJul6vATkaPPKLYKQ.text: This place is a lot of fun. The atmosphere, the staff, and food. Do not eat for at least 4 to 6 hours before go. Food is fantastic and outrageously large portions. The Headwich is the size of a 10 year olds head. I highly recommend the Mighty Fine Bovine Headwich...fresh pastrami, brisket, spicy kraut, onion cheese, pickles, and olives. Home made chips. I could not finish it. Do your self a favor and go.

XGfWhyj2c6mjK_Yk1Mxfkg.text: I moved to the Southside a decade ago and Fat Heads stands the test of time! I went for many wing nights in my day and it's always a great space to stop in for a good beer from their giant beer list.  My go-to sandwich has always been the McMinns Chicken Dance. Spicy chicken, an egg, lettuce, mayo, on a bun - with their signature chips... so. good. I always get this when I'm doing take-out, and frequently still get it when I'm in the restaurant.   The salads, known as head-wiches are full salads! Friends tend to love these as you can get everything possible in a salad there! The potato skins are a great appetizer, and the burgers seem to be favorites of friends too!  They've recently renovated with a great outdoor space and updated bar area. They also have their beer to-go and souvenirs in the upstairs loft area.

WYSXegXk2Utj0DwojmlskA.text: The smoked wings... ssssssooooo good! Definitely the place to go if you are in the mood for good beer and wings!

gNwwvTcFRW3C139zewpFeQ.text: Shoutout to the bartender who sat with me while my drunk ass loudly brainstormed whether Fat Heads was a Cleveland brewery or a Pittsburgh one. We ultimately decided that the beer is from Cleveland, but the food is from Pittsburgh. Whether we're right or wrong doesn't matter. We used our intellect and teamwork to arrive at our well thought conclusion, and I refuse to hear any other theories or ideas about it.  Now that we have that settled, I'm sure you want to know about the food and drink. Consensus: it is gooooood. My friend and I ordered some much needed apps. We had frickles (fried pickles), shrooms, bacon and cheddar fries, and the original smoked wings. Sriracha thousand island and horseradish accompanied the fried veggies, which was unexpected and a delicious touch. I am the sauce queen, so you can take my opinion as canon. The fries were cooked well, but the cheddar cheese sauce tasted like lukewarm cheese whiz. It's kind of like they decided to play Philly with the fries. Someone's thought process had to have been "Okay, we hate Philadelphia. We're the better Penn city. How do we show it? Ooh, I know! Let's take one of their star food items, make it gross, and toss it on one of America's greatest foods!" That's totally fine and a Pittsburgh type of thing to do, but you could warn a girl first ya know?   But okay, move over fry-wreck, I need to talk about wings. MMM wings. I may be considered the sauce queen, but I can appreciate a properly cooked smoked wing. You don't sauce a dry wing. That would be an abomination on both my sauceland and the domain of my ally, the smoker. Luckily Fat Head's is aware, and gives you the option of order extra dry rub on your smoky deliciousness. No sauce here buddy! These wings are huge; they are the full wing, after all. We ordered a 5 piece, and considering the other apps we had, were very pleased with our choice. Had we ordered more we would have left a lot of food on the table. I don't know about you, but I hate wasting good food.   The beer is as varied and plentiful as you can imagine. Fat Head's is an excellent brewery, but the saloon makes the smart decision of offering other Pennsylvania crafts so you have to attempt to make an educated decision. Then again, in my head, there's no such thing as a bad beer, but there are some beers that I absolutely adore and some that I'll drink because it's given to me. (I'm looking at you, Bud Lite.) My friend had the Blueberry Ale, which is one of their more famous beers. I'm not a fruity beer drinker, so I went for their Shakedown stout. At 8.6%, this was not a good follow up to all the high ABV stouts I had earlier, but I like to keep some things in the family, ya feel?  Fat Heads is a great option on the South Side, and if you've never visited before, you'll find you have a lot of places to choose from. Just do me a favor, and make time to stop in for a fat pint.

7pjFVsBYhqBmA15ij-n9oQ.text: Delicious burgers and fries.  Visited here back in August 2009 and October 2010 which feels like forever ago but I remember this as one of the best burgers I've literally ever had in my life. The service as I remember was fantastic, they were 100% on top of serving us, refilling our drinks, making sure that anything we needed was fulfilled. We went at lunch time on a Friday afternoon so we had a bit of a wait, plus we were a party of 10 but they sat as us soon as they could. I'd recommend anyone to try Fatheads out if you're in Pittsburgh! So yummy! Just wish I lived closer.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Wb2gcdToweCVrJ5WcqgQ4Q.text: Came on a random night and had Josh as our server. We were treated like a dollar bill at a strip club (really well and just felt so loved)  Had the triple bypass hamburger and it was "die Scheie" aiiiiigghhht? Wig wam wa da tay

xDETfxRwqC0mm9_rjwIZmg.text: Okay. I feel like this place should be more talked about than it is. I think it was on Outrageous Foods with Tom Pizzica so that's where I heard about it. It's a restaurant-brewery so don't bring a date here thinking you'll have an elegant evening. In fact, this place is probably the opposite of elegant (but really, aren't those places the best ones?)  The main event here is definitely the headwiches. Some (or all?) of them are named after regulars and contain some bizzare combinations of ingredients I would never have thought of but are oh-so-yummy together. I tried the southside slopes and the "mo" betta beef and chedda headwiches. The southside had kielbasa, fried pierogies, grilled onions, american cheese and horseradish sauce while the "mo" betta beef and chedda had smoked beef brisket, portabello mushrooms, bacon, sharp cheddar, and chipotle mayo. I believe the menu said that the southside headwich was Maxim magazine's #5 best sandwich in the nation and it definitely didn't disappoint. I'd go so far as to say it was the star of the evening, and maybe even my whole visit to the Pittsburgh area (foodie-wise, at least).  The headwiches are all served with their housemade potato chips which are AMAZING. Thinly cut but still thick enough to be more than crispy oil. They were perfectly seasoned and stayed delicious even several hours after dinner as a late night snack, when my second wind struck.  The appetizers all looked pretty tasty also. Unfortunately, in anticipation of the huge headwiches, we opted only for one: the char-grilled wings smothered in smoky barbecue sauce. There are 14(?) sauces but I can't really take the heat so I stayed out of the fire! The wings were fantastic, let me tell ya. It was recommended by our waitress along with the smoked chicken, spinach & artichoke dip and the pedro's nachos made with their housemade potato chips.. if you're with a large enough group and on the fence about which appetizers to order. Don't get too ambitious if you're not because I saw an order of the chicken, spinch, artichoke dip pass our table and it was LARGE.  The place also brews its own beers. When we went (around 5p), their house-brewed beers were half off for happy hour until 6p. I also noticed that they had a late night "happy hour" where their headwiches were half off from 10p - midnight. For the beers, typical stuff. I ordered my usual hefeweizen but I noticed they had a bumble berry on draft which was a blueberry-honey brew that I'd kind of wished I tried. The draft menu changes frequently--as the taps run out--so you'll just have to go and see what's available. There are 42 varieties to choose from so don't worry about not being able to find something to your liking though.  What else, what else.. we didn't stay for dessert but the meal overall was fantastic. If you're visiting the area (like I was) and are into souvenir things, there is a gift shop upstairs that has t-shirts, a few of their beers (bottled) and other knick-knack things for sale. If you have your receipt from the meal, you can get an additional 10% off too!  Oh wow, that was a lot of words. Like I said, lots to talk about with this place! Can't believe there aren't 1000+ reviews raving about it. Give it a shot; there are lots of eateries in the downtown area but this place is definitely a gem you don't want to miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Still delicious even on a rainy day
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Headwiches x2

I4vw8iPmAvKsOgFQf9TXlA.text: Great Beers, Great Food...  I think every sandwich should have pierogies on them.    I have heard about this place since I arrived in Pittsburgh.   We gave the hostess our number and proceeded to the bar.  They have a great beer selection.    We had a couple of beers and then were alerted our table was ready.      They have a large menu with burgers, sandwiches, etc...    Many items needed to be tried by me and now I have another reason to come back.  I orderd the Southside ... Sandwich - It was yummy.    This is a layered sandwich with sausage, pierogies and onions.     Very good flavor.     It was served witht heir housemade chips.  Service - Very Good - our waitress knew her beers and provided good recommendations.  Food - Fantastic - the sandwich was really good.   The sandwiches run $10 - 15  per... It is worth it.  Atmosphere - this place is crowded and has a great vibe.    Please note their side room gets very warm in my opinion.    (I believe this serves as their outdoor section in the summer)  I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mmm...Southside

Vccq626phsb8hmpR5BYh0A.text: Ran out of fish by 7pm on a Friday during Lent which was not a good start after waiting 30+ minutes for a table. Limited choices for non meat eaters.  Veggie Bean Burger was OK, but too soft. Draft beer selection was good especially if you like IPAs, but I would have liked more variety.

BTiMrN09IyiiPcekPzEdLg.text: I am a huge fan of spicy food.  I come to Pittsburgh at least once a year & found Fat Heads a few yrs ago.  Although I come to Pittsburgh on business, Fat Heads is the highlight of my trip.   I'll name a few of my favs: Chargrilled wings, the best.  The Quadruple bypass burger, awesome.  Homemade chips, great. The "killer" sauce... LIKE NONE OTHER in great flavor, & the heat is straight out the depths of hell!  To put the fire out, there is a wall of taps that gives you the power to choose how you're going to put the fire out.     This is a place that you must try, but you will need to return because you will not be able to try it all out in one visit. Just like going to Disney!   Oh, I almost left out service.  Great staff!!!   Tiger

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked Chicken, Spinach, &amp; Artichoke dip with fried pitas
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;KILLER&#34; chargrilled wings

LjLjhf4FRuPQBUVhPGmc_Q.text: My boyfriend and I went to fat heads for the first time this weekend. We were in Pittsburgh for the very first time and we saw that this restaurant had good reviews so we decided to venture out and try. It was around 7 pm on a Saturday night. At first the hostess told us it would be about 40 minutes, but we ended being seated in less than 10. We sat in the indoor/outdoor area which was perfect for a sunny Saturday night. The food came out very fast! We started with the spicy parm wings which were the perfect about of heat and flavor. Afterwards we got two burgers which came with fries. My boyfriend got the pulled pork chili burger and the buns they use and perfect because it holds everything together wonderfully! I was full, and happy. The prices are fair and reasonable. I wish there was a fat heads near my house because I would go every weekend!
