She came back constantly to check on us, and brought our food and drinks out in a timely fashion.   We ordered a bunch of things and left with a lot of leftover. We split 2 soft pretzels(obviously not homemade but delicious none-the-less) and the fried pierogis. Both were tasty! For entrees my sister had the deluxe veggie burger and enjoyed it. My fiance had the t-bone and ate the entire thing. My older sister had a half rack of ribs and a few garlic Parm wings are they were both delicious! I ordered the Jack-o headwich and it was spicy and delicious! Huuuuuge portion and the homemade chips were to die for. I loved it, and my brother-in-law enjoyed the rest when we got home!   When all was said and done we all left full and very satisfied. I'd want to come back for wing night since they were some of the best I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlic Parm wings
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jack-o
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. T-bone

Z6zeS2xvJ3Ewzec9QAMafA.text: A wonderful fusion of craft beers and heart stopping sandwiches. If you're going prior to a Steelers game be prepared for an hour wait. I would highly recommend the Extreme Pastrami and house stout.

v0tYNlQk8tjbw1kZiOnsKg.text: Fat Heads is THE BEST. Their menu is huge and every single thing on it is amazing...particularly the smoked whole wings and the Kelsey Burger. Regardless of what you order for dinner, you MUST TRY THE WHOLE WINGS! They are amazing and I've never had anything else like them. The bar has an extensive beer list with some of Fat Heads' own brands being the best options on tap in the house. I recommend the Bumble Berry (it's served with a few blueberries floating on top).   We used to live in the Southside and would frequent Fat heads often. Since moving to the suburbs, we regularly make the trip into the city to get our Fat Heads fix. It's also my parents' favorite spot to visit when they're in town.   Definitely use the No Wait app to find a seat if you're stopping in on a weekend night. This place is popular!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

I3abHM4s6T-Q1YgV7blGSw.text: Place has awesome vibes. Service was decent. I had the Headhunter IPA which was great. I ordered the Bay of Pigs sandwich; luckily, I like spicy food. The Killer sauce is made using habaneros and all even for me it was very spicy. The waitress described it as "having a little kick". The pulled pork was phenomenal. The bread, however, absolutely stinks. Reminds me of the pack of white bread buns you pick up at a convenience store.

clYp-0_tCny2XW2Y0jNxXA.text: I'm really disappointed I went here yesterday with my boyfriend and I ordered the fried buffalo cauliflower and my boyfriend ordered a pulled pork sandwich we also ordered two beers. Our food came out before our beer which was only in about 5 mins. My cauliflower wasn't good at all it tasted like it was still raw it was very hard and it was drenched in oil. I was really disappointed it looked really good but didn't taste good it needed to be fried longer. The fresh homemade chips that came with the sandwich were not fresh they were not even warm. Since our food came out in 5 mins (faster than our beer ) it makes me think it wasn't fresh it was a mess up or something and they just brought it to our table because the restaurant was busy and the food definitely didn't taste like it was just made.

piBEVZq4OPhg0-u3JQJQsQ.text: All you need to know is get the wings!  Seriously some of the best wings I've ever had!  We also had perogies which were fantastic as well.  Great beer selection too.  I can't wait to go back to this place!

LNBwTkcpyvibVHnI6Famqw.text: This place is a great place to go on a Sunday afternoon or after a game. They are known for their huge sandwich's called "Headwichs", which they have many to choose from. The wings are good, not great, but good flavors. They have a huge pretzel which is awesome. If you get the chance and want a good sandwich and great beer selection while in the burgh, check out this place.

PvfC35U-Ott206uOaHsrNA.text: I ordered the Renee Red, Hot and Blue Burger and really enjoyed it. The burger had the perfect amount of blue cheese on it, not too overwhelming, as well as just enough hot sauce to give it a bit of a kick. The onion straws and bacon on the burger were nice and crispy, adding a crunch with each bite. My bun tasted a bit stale, but I was able to peel off the top bread layer and still enjoy my meal. With every burger they give you a huge amount of fries, which is more than you need, but they're delicious and great for sharing. As far as drinks, they have a big list of their branded draft beers. The Bumble Berry is by far my favorite! It's smooth, not too hoppy, and has a hit of blueberry.   Service here was excellent. We got seated right away and our waiter brought us water glasses within minutes. Both our burgers came out in a reasonable amount of time, even with them being busy on a Friday night. The waiter checked on us a few times throughout our meal, but also gave us time to relax, talk, and enjoy our meals. I will definitely be coming back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Renee Red, Hot, and Blue Burger

akQuCHqdyiK5_6yzquHeCw.text: Came here Saturday 2pm. This place is always busy, so prepare for a wait. We waited around 20 minutes for a table of two.   Staff are very friendly and accommodating. The atmosphere is super casual. Loud noise levels.   Ordered frickles ($9), Southside slopes ($13) and beauty & the beastie ($12) headwiches.   Frickles came with two sauces, Honey mustard (sweet and creamy) and Sriracha Thousand Island (spicier than expected, couldn't eat!). Tasty batter, although the proportion of it to the pickle was 3:1. Still, pretty delicious. Watch out, as all the fried coating will fill you up quickly and you won't be able to enjoy the reason why people come here for--the headwiches.  Southside slopes: chargrilled kielbasa topped with sauteed pierogi and onions, American cheese, horseradish sauce. Solid. Only one pierogi inside, and pretty tough dough, so watch out.   Beauty & the beastie: house-smoked pulled pork, Beasty BBQ (got substituted for regualar BBQ, as I don't handle spicy too well), pickles, onions, slaw. This was underwhelming. Maybe my expectations were too high from all the hype that I've heard about this. The reality was very plain and not very satisfying. Bland, fatty pulled pork with barely any sauce, not enough cole slaw. The bun itself is huge, but there's much less filling inside than you expect.   Headwiches come with house-made chips. Those were my favorite part of the meal. Enormous, thin, golden, light, and perfectly crunchy. Need more salt, but you can always sprinkle some from the salt shaker on your table. Really enjoyed these crisps and will miss them every time I eat chips again.  Not the best sandwiches I've ever had, but an interesting local Pittsburgh experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. South side slopes headwich
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beauty and the beastie headwich. Pretty underwhelming. Housemade chips were the best part.

bdGEalO6TZxDuAAysa0Qxw.text: Absolutely delicious! We got the Pierogi and 2 different Headwiches. Everyone in our party tried everything ordered and everyone loved all of it. It was busy, they said 30 min wait probably... we only waited 15. Great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogi and Headwitches

KAD1jMMfnQ-cKavpbEgXuA.text: Tried this place for the first time last week for lunch. The hubs ordered the Expert Pastrami and I ordered the Classic Bacon Cheeseburger.  The food was awesome! Not only were we impressed with the sandwich/burger, but the fries were fantastic. Maybe the best I've had at a restaurant in The Burgh!  They have an extensive beer list which is nice and the service is spot on. They were slightly busy but we were sat and helped very quickly.   We will definitely be back!

bJMoUnZrwKV7pm9cQhuzCg.text: We dipped in here to watch the World Cup and have a couple of beers and we had a great time. The bar was packed, but the bartender Ally absolutely killed it. We didn't have to wait on anything even though she was serving at least 30 other people. We split the quesadilla and the chili cheese fries and had more than enough to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Pulled Pork Chili Fries

EshTvRPZM-poMofuKUa1mQ.text: This is a popular Southside restaurant. They are always busy and folks obviously love it. The brew beer and have a large selection. They also have really big sandwiches. The atmosphere is casual. We like their wings and think they are some of the best in Pittsburgh, especially the beastie wings.  We're not keen on the rest of the menu so that's why the rating is 4 stars. If it were for wings alone it would be a 5 star rating.

bJD1lJXOXxu4lDAb0501iQ.text: Amazing beer selection and great food! Decent value too. Use the no wait app for reservations to minimize the wait.

VFE7r69kX26qqQrDDl0NCQ.text: The hostesses, all 4 of them, were completely clueless. Werent seating people, wait was 40 minutes when told it would be 15.  When leaving i couldnt find my keys, and the bus boy told me he had a set but refused to show them to me. Im 30 years old. Felt like a criminal. Food wasnt worth the awful service, and drinks are very expensive.

hSRyKaDjjJNuj2H4idHPAQ.text: Love the subs and wings  , been coming for years. In love with the home made chips. Always great service and the food comes out fast and hot.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bomb

E7igQrEKZUkMhjQA5O1uLQ.text: I've been here several times now and my impression has improved since my first visit! It could be due to my continued occupation in Pittsburgh that has reduced my expectations for good food, or it might just be that Fat Heads is a great spot for Pittsburgh fare!   They are home to several interesting and memorable brews such as the bumble berry (served with fresh, floating blueberries) and the headhunter (a solid IPA).   The portions here are enormous! Even though they don't use the best ingredients for the dishes, the entrees are still spectacular to look at due to their massive sizes and for that reason, you can never really be disappointed. I highly recommend the Pittsburgh salad with chicken, and most importantly, I highly recommend sharing it with a friend!

em7Y83YLun9aUfm2UDyZAA.text: Fat Heads Saloon was the first place we eat out at after moving back to Pittsburgh. The entire 18-hour drive back to Pittsburgh my husband talked about Fat Heads' wings. Our first Monday in Pittsburgh, we headed here for wing night. Unfortunately, their wings on special are not gluten free, but I was able to order the whole wings which were gluten free.  The Fat Heads original sauce is a good enough to drink (or at the very least douse all over your meal). They have a great selection of drinks and food, but we seem to venture here more for wings than anything else.

NtnPvmrsnAActKdlgatqlw.text: Great place for big sammies, as always. Fried pickles are raved about and are decent, but not worth a rave. So much breading. AC wasn't working upstairs, which doesn't impact the food, until you order the very spicy jalapeno cheese steak. Obv I'd go back, but change a few things on our order.

JM-3O4yApomQGXqsOgXscg.text: We haven't been here in a while so we were excited to stop in. We used the yelp app to reserve a spot in line in advance, which was helpful! The ladies at the front who were greeting people and seated us were very friendly. It took a while before our waiter came over and unfortunately when he did, I was sadly unimpressed with the lack luster recommendations. I asked which beers were lighter than others for my flight and he told me he didn't know because he had been "out of town for a few days." It was a bit odd. I did however really enjoy the Guns and Roses Rose beer which was delicious. Their bumble berry is always fresh and a hit as well. We ordered chips and beer cheese as an appetizer which was very good. Took some time to come out though. I got the spicy parm wings and they were fantastic-not too spicy but just right! My boyfriend got the black and yellow wings and he thought they were really good as well. We enjoyed all of the food and beer, but service was extremely slow that evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy parm and black and yellow wings
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips and beer cheese
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

x90W-PKJCO1MICCirBl6Qw.text: I've been wanting to try this for awhile, especially given this is the original location. The three of us stopped in on a Monday evening around 8:30 pm. The hostess was apparently too busy to acknowledge us or another pair of patrons, blatantly ignoring us without politely advising it would be another minute or so before they could take down our names. I dismissed this as it being a Monday night and on some days, you're bound to get the "B" team of apathetic millennials  who have a skewed view of customer service. We were told the wait would be around 15 minutes. We went to the bar to wait and as each ten minute interval passed (10, 20, 40 min) we saw tables get cleared but no patrons being sat. After 45 minutes I approached the four hostesses at the counter doing nothing but playing on their phones and asked if they had an ETA as I saw a few booths empty. We were immediately sat but no recognition or apology was given. We ordered appetizers and entrees. Drinks were brought out quickly once ordered, but food took more than half an hour to arrive at the tables and all of our appetizers and entrees were dropped off at the same time. Our waitress apologized for that - she was the best part of the evening.   My steak sandwich was dry, but all the other food (wings, pierogies, other sandwiches) were very good.   The weirdest part of the night was that my friend lost his keys and asked one of the bus boys if he had any turned over to him, who said yes he had them but refused to show them to my friend. We are a group of 30 year old professionals so it was odd to be treated like criminals. We eventually found his keys in my car but the entire exchange was off-putting.  Based on the poor service, I will not patronize this location anymore.

aFlTGDhMOnOsufe4A1Z1dQ.text: I don't care for the burger I had. It was so messy that I couldn't even eat it like a normal burger. It took away from the enjoyment when the burger crumbled apart and I ate a deconstructed burger. I also wished you could change the side for free.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ArDS3c4M9okSiYqIQT6e1g.text: We got to fatheads around 9pm on a Saturday and they said it would be about a 45-50 min wait. We gave them our number to text us. The place was worth the wait!  I had a blueberry infused beer, it wasn't too sweet and had a nice crisp flavor. I got an order of the fathead wings and it offered a nice kick. The wings were cooked well and has a great texture.  We were seated near the bar but the bar and restaurant areas were still pretty separated which was nice.  Even though it was busy I didn't feel rushed and the waiter was extremely helpful about choosing a beer from the expansive beer menu.  Next time I'm in Pittsburgh I'll have to stop by again.

gB22AIaqwDz2RnYlHjtZRQ.text: Absolutely our FAVORITE place to get a sandwich and a beer in Pittsburgh.  Once we discovered Fathead's, a lot of other places in Southside never saw our faces again.  They easily have the best beer selection in Southside, and the signature sandwiches are otherworldly.  My new favorite is called "The Angry Cheese Steak."  My son is a big fan of the outrageous "Fuddwich."  It's always a dilemma deciding what to order, and we frequently get on the trolley to Southside just so we can enjoy a couple more of the beers served from their 42 taps without having to worry about driving home.  Service is EXCELLENT, and there is outdoor seating for those who enjoy watching the freak show walking down Carson Street!

KGI3Lw9kNQVIqI0r-JuDsw.text: Wow. Portions are huge and the food is awesome. If you are a local or visiting from out of town, this is a great place for dinner or a drink before the big game. I will  visit again.

hJgagFw8DP5t4NTtjHHDNQ.text: Very nice atmosphere! A lot of variety so I will come back! Very filling and huge burgers:) The wait staff was perfect.

MaJ_OoY_iuvONhuWIr2qaQ.text: If you're thinking about eating healthy do NOT go to Fatheads.  Healthy and Fatheads are polar opposites of each other, but if you're in the mood for some awesome bar food then head on over!    Our group ordered the nachos to share - wow it was a huge portion.  Word of warning to tortilla fans - they do not use tortilla chips in their nachos, but potato chips.  I was pleasantly surprised by the use of chips and they had so many toppings on the nachos, my taste buds were dancing around like little fairies.  Happy fairies for sure.  They nachos had beef, an overabundance of jalapenos (yay), lettuce, black olives, of course cheese, and a whopping dollop of sour cream on top (I'm not a huge sour cream fan, but you can avoid it if you wanted to).    For my meal, I had the Hoff-wich (it's a wrap).  Do not confuse this with David Hasslehoff in any way - apparently it's named after one of the employees at Fatheads.  We mistakenly made a comment on the name of the wrap and The Hoff (David that is) and was quickly put in our place by the employee who the sandwich was named after (ouch!).  Let's be clear, there's no shame in naming a sandwich after the original Hoff.    The wrap was very tasty.  It had enough spiciness to keep me salivating but was toned down by the chipotle mayo.  Also just a note about the mayo, it's more like a cream cheese consistency not really like mayo.  Again, not a huge fan of creamy stuff like cream cheese (and as mentioned above sour cream) but it worked for this wrap.  So it was grilled chicken, Fathead's original sauce, lettuce, black olives, bacon, and chipotle mayo.  *slurp - sorry I had to wipe my face from drooling.    For a beer, I had the Anderson Valley Winter Solstice - talk about a taste of the season.  Highly recommend as it's a great winter beer.    Fathead's lets be unhealthy together forever!

0yLeF5_Fp0kVAxm1pGEbXQ.text: Delish! Love the nachos & burgers plus a great beer selection.

FjsYJR1ZPwB-wM8bbGNIJQ.text: Best place on East Carson! I'm slowly but surely working my way through the menu. The Chicken Little is my hands-down favorite sandwich,  but every time I go there, I try a new Fatwich and one of the seasonal brews on tap!

rkyfr0q-dguu5XonfmWbyg.text: I stop by about ounce a month with my wife it's out the way for me but well worth it the bay of pigs rocks a must go.

2u_YAGgqXw5vPWF5y1XfEQ.text: Had Aloha burger...delicious. Great craft brews as well.

MOelERX8BIiDfplThuRmew.text: These things are huge and good!  Started with the pierogies and got the Cool Colossal Club sandwich. Food was great. It's a little loud, though.

SNG_cmGIGukq1ZkrV51KQA.text: Took my parents here based entirely on the reviews on Yelp and I have to say, it was awesome. They have an incredible selection of beers to choose from that make the wait go by quickly and then once you're seated the real fun begins.  We got three appetizers which were good, and then all 4 got Headwhiches. Holy sandwhich. If you're on a diet, this isn't the place for you. I had the steak headwhich with their spicy ranch and it was awesome. Their service was great and the menu has something for everyone. It is a bit loud but that's not something I mind. Others might though.   We were told a wait of 1 hour at least but were seated in 30 minutes. All in all, great place.

zHz84HOtvUDsp_5GoNWkww.text: My host was excited to take me here, "the sandwiches are as big as your head!" This sounded intriguing yet painful. And for a food hunter like me, the prospect of being full is a downer, but I let go and caved in.   They were easily good. This place has a formulaic feel like TGI Fridays, but it's forgivable because they only have one more location (in Cleveland, a town the locals loves to hate).   The menus are fun to read and if the portions weren't so damn big, I'd get wings and fries too. Great bar food, great beer. No wait, outstanding food and beer. But still, it's just so refined I could never call it a favorite. No, not like Pickle Barrel.

yABWQy_zwkTyBQddNxv1hA.text: Fathead's has always been my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh. Unfortunately, I don't think I can say that anymore. Just went there a few days ago and could not believe how many choices they removed from their menu. It's pretty unbelievable. At least two full pages of food are gone! Several of my favorite sandwiches are no longer on the menu. I'm devastated that the steak and bacon club is gone! I ordered one of the new brisket sandwiches and it was okay, but nowhere near as good as what used to be on the menu. My girlfriend ordered one of the new sandwiches as well and she hated it. Wings are still great, and so is the beer. But it's just not the same anymore. Sad to say, but I don't see myself coming here as often as I used to. I recommend piper's pub across the street.

ANJ731wXacqUo2EK8_nCKA.text: Definitely going back to this place, if only just to try some of their beers. I made a promise to myself to try an Iron City beer while I was in Pittsburgh, so that's what I had here. I regretted it afterwards reading about their microbrews. Oh well, gives me an excuse to go back.  I also had a Southside Slopes sandwich. Really really good. Who'd of thunk it? Pierogies on a sandwich. Mmmmm. So good.  I'm glad I made time to check this place out after reading the reviews on here. Great sandwiches. I'll report back on the beers next time I'm in Pittsburgh.

ObkiiL3lbGuVgeiQjNIXvQ.text: This was my favorite part about visiting Pittsburgh. The food was awesome and the portions are HUGE. I'm pretty sure my salad would have been enough for like 5 people. There was also a huge selection of beer. I got some kind of blueberry beer and they put blueberries in it which I thought was a nice tough. I can't wait to go back!

pW9MWH0PzJHvoVMvf2l-3A.text: Finally got in to try some food this past weekend.  Had a hard time deciding what I wanted to order.  Ended up getting the ultimate veggie burger.  It was a homemade black bean patty, which was great with lots of delicious toppings including an onion ring!  YUM Yum Yum!  My fiance got a chicken sandwich that the bar tender recommended, and I didn't hear a word from him until he was done.....I would say that means he liked it!  He got chips with his sandwich and I got fries.  The fries were OK, but the house made chips were awesome!  The amount of food is ridiculous, so go hungry!!!

t_8RzlPPVsskK6rOev2Dnw.text: Fat Heads is a Pittsburgh landmark.  Great beers on tap (including their own) and excellent food.  Portions are as huge as the name suggests, and the sanwhiches are delicious.  I had the McMinn's chicken dance, which was suggested by the bar tender.  It was great, with a heaping mound of those homemade potato chips to go with it.  The only real drawback to Fat Heads is that it isn't exactly a secret and thus is packed with people on the weekends.  We were lucky and stole a couple bar seats, but the wait can be an hour plus if you have a group looking for a table.

bm4d-O9dGQ6M1Ad9KLNhqQ.text: Great burgers and beer selection. A lot of people like the chips they serve with the sandwiches but I'm not a fan. On a few of the times I've visited it's gotten pretty cramped inside, although it's hard to hold that against them. When the food is this good, the restaurant deserves to be crowded.

0ogDJnbrcrI1lWrRgoOzIw.text: Fat Heads and Fat Waists and Fat Everything. Lucky it's good.  Stopped by here because I had a vague memory of coming here when I was in college. These are facts that are only relevant to me. Anyway, we got here at about 4:00 on a Wednesday and it was no problem getting a seat. I hear it does get very busy though.  They have a huge selection of beers, including some from my home state Michigan (Bell's). Cool. They also have Miller Lite if you feel like getting verbally insulted.   The food is definitely huge. I got a sandwich with an egg on it, and my accompanyment got a burger with a perogie on top. Perogies, of course, being the official topping of Pittsburgh. Both sandwiches had the right amount of moisture, but it was too much for one sitting. They also come with sides of either fresh potato chips, or fresh french fries. Good stuff.  Overall, this is a good place to stop by if you're very hungry or want a decent beer. Or a heart attack.

a2xoHFH8843fMPFFdk6nkw.text: Stopped in with Classy Mike (and our Pittsburgh-resident friend, Mr. Matt-bot) on the first stop of our New York to Los Angeles road trip.  Though we'd obviously be eating out every day of the road trip, Classy Mike and I set the goal to not gorge ourselves until we got to San Francisco.  So, like total idiots and hypocrites, we came to Fat Heads on our first night.  (For those unacquainted, bring Classy Mike to a place like Fat Heads to finally get the answer to the question, "Do you need THAT MANY chicken wings?")  Fat Heads is obviously positioning themselves to capture the vibe of Fridays/Chili's while offering better food and a better beer selection.  On that, they clearly succeed (on all counts - it is LOUD in there, uncomfortably so).    They've chosen to go the "Society is looking for healthy food, so we'll ironically just position ourselves as incredibly unhealthy and a place to get a giant fatty sandwich" marketing route.  I had the aptly named "Mighty Fine Bovine", featuring both brisket and pastrami.  Perhaps, though,  the Fridays-esque nature of the restaurant naturally lowered my expectations.  But I thought it was pretty good - oddly, the sandwich didn't come with that much meat, but a huge amount of bread.  As someone who prefers smaller portions and generally tosses most of the bread, that was fine with me.  But I could see some, ah, fat heads, being perturbed at that.   Also, the wings were solid.  I'd be remiss if I didn't point out that the menu notes that the sandwiches come with homemade chips, and that you can't substitute them, because they take a lot of hard work.  Therefore, it continues, you should think that you're paying for the sandwich and getting the chips for free.  But this is stubbornly arbitrary - you can't take one part of a package that you're paying a flat fee for and say that it's not what you're paying for.  Ugh.  Food: 17/25 stars Ambiance: 9/25 stars Service: 14/25 stars Bathroom: 18/25 stars Probability of going back: 50%

Qv4OX6FQhAgk3hb2TjTWeA.text: While visiting Pitt, a friend of mine brought me here before headed to the airport and man was I in a food coma my whole flight home. This place is known for their headwiches and in-house brews. The headwiches are HUGE but only disclaimer is that you can only get chips with it. You can only get fries when you order the burgers. The menu is overwhelming as there is so much too choose from and it all sounds amazing. When I went home to Miami I actually saw their Fathead beers at my liquor store which I thought was pretty neat. I ordered the Chicken Little with a Fat Head's Goggle Fogger Hefeweizen. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Little....nothing little about this thing

EZcVtHQYvBENbcwZQaqajg.text: I stopped by here this past Tuesday afternoon with my father for lunch.  I would say that I had been here about 20 or so times before but somehow my father, a native born Pittsburgher, never has.  We arrived at the restaurant in the midst of the lunch rush as was evident by the three takeout orders that people paid for in front of us.  Once the hostess took care of them we were seated in the dining room.  The inside of Fat Heads looks much like you would imagine a sports bar to look like with a number of TV's all over the place, a bar and then an area behind the bar where they have a list of beers that they have on draft (42 according to their website).  For lunch I decided to have the mighty fine bovine headwich since I have never had that particular headwich before.  It consisted of smoked brisket, pastrami, swiss cheese, hot pepper kraut, onion, pickles and garlic-parm mayo all on a huge bun (the menu claims almost as big as your head and I believe it) that has two olives poked into it to make it look like eyes.  My headwich came with a side of homemade potato chips and ended up being really good as most of their sandwiches are.  I really enjoyed the brisket and pastrami and only wish there was a little more hot pepper kraut and mayo in order to make the sandwich a little less dry and a little spicier.  Even with my headwich being somewhat dry, I still really enjoyed it and my father told me that he enjoyed his steak and hot sausage sub as well.  The bottom line for me is that I will head back here again in the future.  I absolutely love their sandwiches and next time I will hopefully not be on my lunch hour and so able to imbibe one of their many beers!

HMYZVaMSocDXujojFTAKMQ.text: went to Fathead's last night. My daughter and her fiance are visiting from Phoenix, AZ and we wanted them to eat some burgh food!! We ordered 2 Italians a fish and I had the mighty fine bovine.  This was absolutely the best sandwich I' ve ever had. Eating my leftovers as I write this review. Will definetely go there again

Uyaty7YplJnGGpNqB0yeNw.text: I have been here a few times. I'm not much of a "south side" fan. That being said, I have not been here for quite some time. A girlfriend and I decided to do an early dinner dine here because of the fact it would be too busy any later. We were sat outside. The weather was a little chilly and it was drizzling, however the heaters on the ceiling did their jobs and we stayed dry and warm.  The server introduced herself right away and got our drink order. We ordered the fat heads dumble berry beer. Which was served with blueberries (cute). It had a hint of berry and honey. The server checked in on us 2 more times before we finally decided our food order. Everything on the menu looked.. Read great!.. The smell of other tables burgers made it that much harder to choose. We decided on the brisket salad and the jack-o burger. The salad was huge! The brisket was thinly sliced. The salad also had fried onions, a small hard boiled egg roasted red peppers and banana peppers. It also has blue cheese crumbs, but I ordered mine without. Tossed in a Dijon vinegarette that gave it a nice spice/kick! I enjoyed this salad very much! The burger was a tender steak(an actual steak!), roasted red pepper, sharp cheddar, onion rings and a very very killer ranch on a thick but not overwhelming bun. This is a spicy burger. We love spicy, and are very used to spicy and this burger was very spicy! So if you can not handle too much of spice this is not for you! The service was attentive. The server knew her menu and everything we asked about she knew. The atmosphere was comfortable. The prices were not very expensive. Good eat. Good drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

k5j0cq-zCquDNRWI-9IB_w.text: Fantastic!   For an unsophisticated guy from LA, this is the place ;)  The wings are out of this world. The reuben is delicious. And the beer...so so good.   The overall vibe is so cool and so Pittsburgh. Friendly people wanting to help and good football on in the background.   Thank you Phat Fatheads!

D9mpOpbizyfaT7DHRc9Zag.text: A really solid place to get great sandwiches and beer - I can't give a place as loud and less-than-clean four stars, but I can say they have great wings and the portions are insane!

EUFPvcG0DGB6rR5XGrduhw.text: The wait is always crazy! You get a ton of food and the prices aren't outrageous. It's a place that will please everyone bc there is so much to pick from but definitely come hungry (and thirsty too).

v8_m3FHCjAi1ih-IegtT6w.text: Great sandwiches, huge and excellent craft beers. My kind of amazing rock and roll. First time on the Southside of Pittsburgh since coming every week since May. Great place, good atmosphere and awesome sandwiches

EFDl-vtWEAJgbPDfpixuPg.text: Loooove this place. Always been a fan. Shaggy is THEE BEST SERVER EVER  He is so nice and chill and patient. Food is ALWAYS perfect! Best place in the 'Burgh.

2spQfpkEMbB_k_HaAK8Q5w.text: My last review was 5 stars so why am I updating it you ask...well because I had the worlds best sandwich there on Monday and holy shiitake mushroom it was good. Pirogies? On a sandwich? Yes laws, yes yes lawd.

9IK3ghR-q4q1Acl54NMpdQ.text: This place was impressive from the start. Our 20-minute wait was actually more like two minutes. Our service was fast, attentive (not too much) and friendly. The beer menu was excellent with a good mix of their beer and guest taps. The beer flights were $2 ea. The food was great with huge burgers and  a plate of fresh cut fries. Highly recommended pub food.

OxyjlzhzlOW6NJnnzNxHuw.text: Really enjoyed this place.  The frys are huge fyi..  had some good chocolate beer, which I usually don't like.

psSKj0Yu5hi0r5dgIOSu9g.text: I don't know if it was the company or the food, but I really enjoyed Fat Heads.   I had been wanting to go for so long but no one would go with me! Maybe the name was a little off putting...Either way, I was enticed.   They weren't kidding with the serving sizes, the fries were in a glorious deep bowl. I never got to the bottom. I'll get there one day.

FJMIeiT6vap5V0JAsg1oRQ.text: Ah, "Old Reliable," as I like to call it. Whenever my husband and I have been to a string of new places that just don't meet a high standard, there's always Fat Heads.  Consistently keeping their tap selection updated and rotated, and supplying their customer with ample choices for eats, Fat Heads has one of the best atmospheres for the foodie. We've been regulars at this location for 15 years.  I've never been served by a waiter or waitress who didn't know the full menu or draft list. Service is ALWAYS timely, and the staff is hilarious - real people.  I call this the best burger in town, cooked to preference, and daunting in size. If you do get a burger, it will come with a side of fries. Order the honey mustard on the side! It's got a kick!  I am sad that they don't do the Wall of Fame anymore, but it's only because the customer base got too big! Way to go, Fat Heads!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3rPKCPuiOq2TfJTASSnaOg.text: Fat Heads is a great place to hang out with a large group of people. The food comes in ridiculously large portions (hence the name, Fat Heads) so you can definitely share a sandwich with a friend. They have a great beer selection and a nice outside area.

FHjbRr9vKtcXB9fdrx_egQ.text: It's not cheating on my diet if I  eat a quarter of my boyfriend's burger because I didn't order it for myself....right??  I was in the mood for a good meal before starting our springtime Sunday Funday.  As many times as I've been here to just drink, I've never tried their food.  At first I thought I wanted a burger, but I saw they had a salmon Caesar salad on the menu and decided to go for that instead.  While it was good....big mistake.  Bobby ordered the something blue (?) burger and let me try a bite which turned into finishing the rest of what he wasn't going to eat...and some fries and cheese.  This is not somewhere you go to try to stick to your diet!!!!  I could do without the bread because the toppings alone added so much to it.  My salmon salad was large with a generous amount of dressing and the fish cooked well, although the salmon was smoked I believe and if I had the option, would've just ordered it grilled or baked.  It wasn't super busy, lots of families with kids were seated around us.  We ordered their miller lite draft and bumble berry beers.  Good - to be expected.  Service was quick and friendly, not invasive. I like this place.

Fzd7Coc7JWRdiE9kBqCn1g.text: Great Pittsburgh bar and restaurant. So many options!! The beer is amazing, Spooky Tooth and Bumbleberry are my absolute favorites. It is always very busy during happy hour, but that is because you can get their Fat Head's beer for 1\2 off!!   Few vegan options, but more than most sandwich joints in Southside. Everything comes in an overwhelming portion, it's great. :)

1PYEV_cSnX4PzT3yfnc-uA.text: you are wasting your time here!!!!   why are you reading reviews!? just go!  fat heads is amazing. amazing!   why are you still here!?!  go now! now!

5gKzBonvuOJuusmFyHni4w.text: Always wonderful, as usual. The food was good and the Shrooms were what I dream about.  Our server, Sarah, was diligent, sweet and so very nice.

5_wdoLi4w6hrdN4s7eukrw.text: It was a good place to go with a large group. The beer there is always good, they have a great selection to choose from. The food boasts being huge portions, but I don't necessarily think it tastes that good. I had the Garvey's jalapeno cheese steak and it was okay, it didn't have a ton of flavor. I did surprisingly enjoy the homemade chips, they were well seasoned and crunchy. I would go back for the bar, but I was underwhelmed by the food and wouldn't choose it for a meal again.

_U5zQDry7vUH_-HZsJCQJg.text: Bumble Berry Honey Blueberry beer is AWESOME! It has fresh blueberries in it too. All friends love it.   Wings are great too. Whatever amount and flavor - up to you!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Good wings on Monday wings night

I8xNZinTL4qxZwpRJPpnNg.text: My sandwich adventure continued in Pittsburgh when a couple of colleagues based out here suggested Fat Heads Saloon. Upon entering you're welcomed to their little souvenir shop where they sell shirts, shot and cognac glasses (I purchased a cognac and shot glass to bring back to NY). You probably will also notice that the restaurant is a lot larger than you would think.   For my appetizer I had the arrogant onion rings. Wow, they battered extremely well. So much so, that I have never had a batch of onion rings where the batter did not stray away from the onion. Plus, they were spicy which I enjoyed immensely.   For my entree, I decided on getting Nicole's original cheese steak which came with homemade chips. The sandwich was very filling, the bread was just the right consistency and I enjoyed every single bite. The chips were decent. My only issue with them was that they seasoned only the top chips with salt, so once you cleared the top chips you basically only had potato flavored chips.   Outside of that, I would definitely visit again if I am in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arrogant Onion Rings in the background with Nicole&#39;s Original Cheesesteak Sandwich at the forefront.
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Back/burger side of menu
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Headwiches and sandwiches side of the menu

Zkj2GEB6jxog-lCrtDziuA.text: Good place to come when you want a steady meal. It's nothing fantastic that will blow you out of the water but it's not bad. Average food...except the garlic fries those are amazing. My sandwiches have always been good but nothing I couldn't make myself for cheaper. Apps are great here. The homemade chips that come with the meal are always too greasy or burnt. Not great. The veggie burger is down right gross and somewhat insulting to vegetarians (not sure if vegan). It can be hard to find options when not eating meat and the veggie option isn't good. Beer selection is great and obviously fat heads is quite good.  My main issue with this place is the service/staff. Multiple times staff has been rude to us or ignored us. Slow service I can't understand during busy times but when it's hardly crowded-- It doesn't make sense. I'll probably end back up here someone but not my first choice for food when Southside has soooo many great options .

FCC4F7M0jVzfiib5eaMmOg.text: Grew up in Pittsburgh but moved South a few years ago. Anytime we come to Pittsburgh we have to stop at Fat Heads. Back in the 90s, it was the first time I tasted jalepeno poppers. Never stopped coming in after that.  Beefed up is our fav. Brisket, roast beef, tomato and lettuce, headhunter mustard, pickled pepper rings on a crusty bun, a side of chips and we have to have Beasty BBQ sauce for dipping. Oh my goodness. Heaven in the Southside. Seriously, everything on the menu rocks but still. Smoked wings are decent, the potato chip nachos are yum.  Other reviews rave about the burgers. I guess you see this place is great.  The updated bar is so open that it's a pleasure to comfortably enjoy the brews. We like the 'friends' (other breweries) but their own brews are diverse, fresh and thirst quenching.  Tori, bartender, is very knowledgeable, friendly, interesting and fun to know. A True asset.   We left with full tummies, a six-pack and a jar of the mustard.  That's a good afternoon.   The new interior and exterior update is awesome and a real asset. Breezy, not cramped, and customer friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Interior view
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Headhunter Beefed Up with a Headhunter and a Benjamin Danklin IPA

AzhIrFWkUi6FwVyi0NLJoQ.text: KILLER KILLER KILLER!!!!!!!!. We don't go here enough. The often long wait times can be discouraging , but once you experience it you will understand why. We tell people to go here more than we actually make it here ourselves. The decor is fun. The staff is awesome.  The menu is HUGE. The portions are tremendous. You will NOT leave hungry.  There's something for everyone...even two picky eater teenagers. The wings are among the best in the city.  They may have my favorite steak salad ever. Hands down. I'm convinced I could order something I'd never eat and it would still be amazing.  Our kids ate every. Single.morsel. That's unheard of with them. We will definitely be back. We just won't wait so long next time. Thank you FATHEADS.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best buffalo wings.
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak salad perfection.
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Onion and mushroom burger.

KHETPqYx6NB8_hCsXkgqAA.text: Had a nice experience at this restaurant, the waitress was lovely, and of course the company the best. The chicken spinach dip was very tasty, served on toasted pita bread. The burgers were large and juicy, highly recommend "the triple bypass" burger which comes packed with spice from hop pickles, a sunny side egg, tender brisket, and a delicious sauce! (recommend ordering medium well to avoid the rare spots scattered throughout).The fries were large and plentiful. You will not leave here hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9URbvxw-ro57BbkY8IMbrw.text: As an avid lover of the beer, Bumbleberry, I've been wanting to go to Fat Heads for quite some time. We went around dinner time on a Saturday so the place was packed and we had to leave our name. But they texted us when our table was ready so we were able to go to a bar next door and grab a drink. We didn't wait too long either despite having a pretty big group of us.   Once seated we were waited on quickly and able to put beers in. I got the Bumbleberry of course and it came with fresh blueberries. It was delicious and refreshing as always. We decided to order nachos with chicken to start. The chicken on the nachos was underwhelming. It was like, strips rather than shredded and all just thrown in the middle. There wasn't a lot of it either, otherwise though, they were decent nachos. For my main entree I ordered the Chipotle Chicken Cheesesteak. It was very flavorful and delicious. It definitely made up for the nachos, I would get it again.   Overall, I would visit Fat Heads again and it's worth the visit if you're in Southside and looking to grab some dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chipotle Chicken Cheesesteak
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos

EMv8cnCWZsuxcWBexPcWTA.text: Absolutely loved this place! The food was amazing, the waitress was super nice and attentive, and the price wasn't bad at all!!! The burgers had amazing flavor and they gave soooo many fries with the meal. The fries were definitely very yummy, also. Their wings were fall off the bone yummy! Would definitely go again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Me5kxDkDOxkPFC6AGUnmyA.text: I've only been here once but I was pleasantly surprised with how nice the interior is compared to other bars on E Carson.  Great prices and great food. I had 5 whole wings for $11 and a pint sized vodka cran for $8.  The wings were a bit over cooked but they were meaty and filling. Service was a bit slow but it's a busy place and I imagine the bar is even busier.  Definitely one of the better places in Southside!

QjELJY5XUFQyKkqvYmDFWQ.text: MAJOR YUM! While visiting Pittsburgh for a quick weekend, we came across this bar strip on a random Sunday night. We craved wings and this place was luckily open. The bartender was super nice and helped tell us some cool places to visit and the food was delicious! We got pierogies and both kinds of wings. No regrets that night. Not one bit. This place is a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogi and Wings

TxGilsRN3-aTCWqc2fWGPw.text: This visit.. I tried the "house burger" which was: Pimento cheese, house-made bacon, Sweet & Spicy Hop Pickles, Sriracha Thousand Island.    I loved the burger but didn't like the sweet pickles. I am more of a dill pickle girl.  Fries were plentiful with my burgers.     Of course I couldn't visit without getting my favorite wings now my boyfriend is a huge fan now.  The SPICY PARM wings are still out of this world!!

Aka_lVRH-P3AF_q99XwELA.text: Fat Heads Saloon is one of the best stops in the Southside. They offer a wide variety of drinks for an excellent bar scene. They even brew their own signature beers in-house (the ones I've tried being very delicious!). Their food, too, is incredible. Fat Heads is called Fat Heads for a reason. Their portion sizes are extremely generous with a category of their menu even being called "Headwiches" due to the sandwich being the size of one's head. It's a great atmosphere with a lively waitstaff! I always have a good time, and I'd recommend Fat Heads to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Black Bean Burger, Fresh-Cut Fries

q1oj5Me1YysHBDhlU9gKrA.text: Love coming here for weekday lunches when I get the chance. I usually sit at the bar and the staff are always great.  Love their burgers and salads, including their homemade blue cheese dressing. I usually ask for a second helping of the dressing.

ApAo01nHQhEynKOZwp7-OA.text: In a city not my own I always ask what the waiters favorite dish is. I ordered the pickles for app and then this giant sandwich. Coworkers had burger and wings. Get a sandwich, you're in Pittsburgh

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wPpKEwF7jgiYmTNVEHQVsg.text: Excellent service from start to finish. Ginormous portions. Brisket was excellent and sported a great Smokey Flavor. Pickle chip app was huge (enough for 4-6 easily) and priced reasonably for sure. We will definitely return and recommend for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Codfather Headwich
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mo Betta Beef and Chedda Headwich
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frickles -fried pickle chips - enormous portion!

WHd-Uab_MMK16JMhRT8l0A.text: Great food and beer!  One of my favorites places to go in Pittsburgh.  Awesome burgers and you will always leave full.

e9UhNvBE6mUkd2-e-Gbkvg.text: Fat Heads does not disappoint!! Their beer is delicious, but their sandwiches are even better. I ordered the Big Beefy Headwich (called that because the sandwich is as big as your head). It was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Their homemade ranch is amazing as well. Make sure to order some as a side for their homemade chips!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Big Beefy Barbecue Headwich
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Big Beefy Barbecue Headwich

5jnJXmsMz8X4NT10WzgUYQ.text: Really delicious "bar food". I would say it's a step above bar food with their gigantic menu and the variety of burgers, sandwiches and salads. There weas so much variety.  I ordered the black bean burger and I really enjoyed it.  The burgers come with fries, the sandwiches come with chips. The rest of my party were initially a little disappointed that theirs did not come with fries, but after tasting the chips,  they were over it!  Everyone loved their sandwich or burger.  The fries were also good.  (If you love ranch dressing, order some in the side, theirs is really good)  Of course you have to mention their beer when reviewing .  A huge selection to satisfy anyones  beer preference .  Tip:  I believe they are on the no wait app. We went at 3 pm on a Saturday and it was packed.

FhnBbkjaYIED1k0AHhScog.text: They remodeled again - Place looks great. It's definitely not the hole in the wall we used to go to back in the day.  Got jalapeno cheddar and mild buffalo wings - soooooo good.  Then had our all time favorite headwich - the South Shore steak and egg.  Delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Upgraded inside.  Gorgeous.  Been there since 1992 - Happy 25th Anniversary!!!
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. South Shore Steak and Egg Headwich
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 5 Fried Wings - jalapeño cheddar, smoky BBQ, garlic parmesan

BMG3lE0TB0UM1QCfuyTixw.text: Fat heads is our go to spot when my family when we're all meeting up for an easy dinner out.  My last time here I went with my family for my brothers birthday. There were eight of us in our party and we had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated, which wasn't bad at all considering the amount of people in our group. However there isn't really a great waiting area so we just kinda stood near the hostess desk feeling like we were in the way.   Once we were seated we had a chance to look at the drink menu. I love fat heads beer! They have a pretty great list of their own beer and some other brands and ciders as well. My go to beers form this brewery is definitely the bumble berry-a blueberry beer- and the IPA head hunter. They also have great seasonal beers.  I ordered the Pittsburgh salad. It was huge-like most of fat heads dishes. It was packed with ingredients and topped off with French fries. It was delicious but probably one of the most unhealthy salads I've ever had.   Everyone was satisfied with their meals however our service was a little slow. While our server was really friendly it was hard to find her and our drink and water sat empty for long periods of time of multiple occasions but it seemed like it was busy and maybe understaffed so it wasn't a big deal.  I definitely recommend coming here! Just be warned the portions are ginormous!

NOQN2eDlXnhkI-kjzCNj1Q.text: We drove 8 hours from Ottawa ON to come to Pittsburgh for the weekend and wanted a fun dinner out.... Unfortunately fat heads hasn't kept up with the state laws and wouldn't except our Canadian drivers license as valid ID. After waiting 40 mins for a seat we were told they couldn't serve us because they couldn't accept our ID's. After googling and proving to the front door man wrong that the law had actually changed in 2014 he still wouldn't let us dine. What an embarrassment of an establishment, we happily went to many other places that evening that had no problem accepting our licenses.

ixCTfoKgJ5vRiMUsQ-tedg.text: Amazing! The Southside Slopes is incredible

JIbq-ZGJT_LCjqEO8_Katg.text: My only problem with this place is that it has about 800 sandwiches to choose from. How can you decide?? They are the size of your head, and for the average price you'd pay elsewhere. And they are delicious! Lots of beer on tap too. If you go in the evening, i'd say around 5-7pm, expect to wait around for a table. This place is kind of small and gets very crowded.

kR5dEzE7rBtw6uLO7BMRzQ.text: I absolutely love this place, and from the 45 minute wait you can tell alot of people do. I got the perogies from this place one time and they were to die for. they have huge sandwhich portions and you can order and take out. love this place! I just hate how there is sometimes a long wait!

UNv8rli7sQJMNLTmbHtMLg.text: Some of the best sandwiches around. Huge menu and draft selection. Fatheads own beer is fantastic. Always crowded.

E-4CrsGUyhQIZogeQU-HZQ.text: Awesome sandwiches here!! and a ton of beers on tap!  I had some AWESOME cider here and tried a friend's disgusting Belgian white beer.  Anyway back to the food, cause who cares about the rest right?  I ordered the sliced steak sammy with egg which was good but heart stopping and had a taste of the cuban which was even more delicious.  The cuban which stood out to me was quite spicey for all you spice lovers out there.  Quantity wise the sandwiches were more than enough for a big eater like myself, so no worries there.  Oh and who can forget one of my favorite parts of the meal...the home made potato chips!  They were the perfect mix of soggy and crispy.  And yah, i did say soggy!  For some reason even the texture of the soggy chips still complimented the meal.  All in all Fatheads is a great place for food drinks and fun, enjoy!

LU28d46jOBfqSfgbjV_C2g.text: I would come more often if I was able to subtitute chips for fries instead of being forced to pay the extra $6 for plain fries.

G2hc52YbFKNR28YWoNR7BQ.text: Heard good things about this place from the locals we asked and it didn't disappoint. We were seated within minutes, unusual for 5:30 on a Saturday.  Appetizer arrived quickly and there were many beer choices, including a great fruit beer that tasted nothing like beer. Just what I like!  The menu  was huge and so was the food when it arrived. Do not eat here if you are on a diet. There is literally nothing on the menu that could be classified as healthy. It was one of the best sandwiches I've eaten in awhile.  Had the "Original Chicken Sub".  My boyfriend had the "Beauty and the Beast" and I swear he talked about it for 2 days. I think he is going to dump me for the sandwich.  Good waiter, not obtrusive or annoying at all, very reasonably priced. Between 8-14 for a sandwich/sub with homemade chips. Definitely will be back.

YBuSpBWIm3ybzenQJZ5E4A.text: Alright although they had a fabulous selection of beer, the food was not to my liking....  I was very intimidated by the portions which are comparable to the size of a human head, so I decided to play it safe with a salad...BIG mistake. The salad was served in the exact same bowl my family and I use to serve salad at Thanksgiving dinner NO JOKE! It was filled to the brim with salad covered in tons of cheese, too much dressing, and less than extraordinary chicken.   So basically I had 3-5 bites and was done just because I was so grossed out. I wish the server would have mentioned the salad was big enough to feed the whole table and the one next to us. But he just completely ignored the fact I didn't eat any of it. But everyone else at my table seemed to enjoy their gargantuan meals. I will not be going back to eat there.

4X4uKLQPJx17kHYLDDOpvw.text: Loved the pulled pork headwhiche! Sometimes the wait can take a while if you go during meal times on weekends. I would recommend honey barbecue sauce for the chips that comes with the headwhices.

HcyIM3hurlWBVQSL8fUJvA.text: Fantastic beer selection, paired up with large, bountiful meals. What's really great is that they're so helpful when it comes to matching your culinary taste with the correct type of ale. Their large menu even suggests different combinations in order to satisfy your palette. I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone who has family coming in or visiting Pittsburgh. Located deep in the heart of South Side, it's a great way to start a day of adventuring and checking out the Pittsburgh scene. It gets VERY busy on Saturday and Sundays, so waiting is going to be inevitable no matter what time you decide to go. However, you can have a seat at the bar while you wait, and it's usually not longer than 30 to 45 minutes. In the meantime, the atmosphere is a very sports themed, and the time will fly while you wait.

obDq6Cj3JxSJw7SarV2Qig.text: Flat out the worst service I have ever seen in any restaurant....they got my friend's order wrong 3 times (not subtle pickiness, utterly and completely wrong....wrong bread once, no cheese once....completely absurd)  by the time hers was finally on the table and close to correct, mine was ice cold.  NO apology, NO drop by from a manager to try and ameliorate the situation.  I would not suggest this shithole to anyone under any circumstances.  Complete amateur hour operation.

4euIHFaHZ8VOUi8YSyubTw.text: There are no bad options here, a very good selection of food and an impressive beer list as well as their own brews.  The biggest damn sammiches and salads this side of the Mon River can be found here....though I love love love their wings (Killer sauce) and garlic fries most of all.  I cannot pick a favorite beer, there's too many to choose from!   If you're from da Burgh and have never been there, what are you waiting for?? If you're visiting the city, you should definitely include a stop here on your itinerary.

rBR4fpDLNxJmFRRi00vb_Q.text: Wide variety of excellent beers. The food is very good, you won't leave hungry. Many different meal choices makes me want to keep coming back.

eXRQXjA3Gj-UJgqBl3TWWA.text: This was a horrible meal.  I went with my brother and we both were sick afterwards.  The food is quantity not quality.  I don't want to ever go back.

q4abPNThM-cRhNi0LPq82A.text: Who says "Local" in Pittsburgh means: toothless, smoke-y, dive-y, tattered blue collar? Fat Head's sure doesn't. Fat Head's says Local is: cleanliness, heartiness, potent ale & fine food, HDTV (with volume for games) & the finest tap list and cleanest, best looking tap build in the city.   (Really...I hadn't seen something this nice since Father's Office in Santa Monica, CA.)  They have Bear Republic on tap. I hadn't seen Bear Republic anywhere East of the Rockies. To me...that's a sign that this place is a beacon for delites. I didn't get a chance to try any of their own brews...I'll be sure to venture there when I return.   I gave them the classic bar test: wings & the burger. They passed with flying colors of buffalo sauce and red-red meat.

TZz-JN5BcfSKJlSjFpjsdA.text: Awesome place to get a beer (or several...) and watch the game (or several...)  This place has a huge beer selection from all over.  No matter what style you want, they have it here -- even ciders!  They've got a ton of TVs and are very amenable to requests.  If it's playing somewhere, they can probably get it on DirecTV.  The food selection is pretty good.  Burgers and stuff if that's your thing, or salads the size of your head.  One of their salads has chicken, potato wedges, and melted cheese on top.... mmm... heart attack *in a salad*.  Awesome.  Bartenders are really entertaining, too.

Am2keRv2QV6E8w_zUnVDMA.text: Fatheads was recommended to us as a family / Penguins fan friendly place to go before the game.  We were not disappointed! The wait staff was friendly and helpful. The menu is huge! Although the menu does not provide a childrens menu, it still is family friendly.  The food was very good and flavorful. The beer was awesome! The helpings are huge.  Great place!

FsnrTcuqdKraT8ZiXz9Zng.text: One of my favorites in Pitts.  The sandwiches are overwhelming. They are for sharing unless you have a huge appetite.  I have just one suggestion.  Expert pastrami.  I also like the buffalo sauce here and usually get a cup of it to dip the homemade chips into. Good stuff.

624S5KPXN_CW0G6Og5q9lg.text: Our first stop in Pitt and definitely worth the 45min wait.   We ordered lots and lots of food cuz most of us were starving by the time we were seated. We had 4 different orders of 10 wings, and tried their Honey Chipotle, Spicy Parmesan, the Fat Head Original and Jalapeno Chedder. It was a unanimous vote that we all LOVED their Spicy Parmesan wings; so different and SOOO good!!! The rest of the sauces, however, were very average.   Then, my fiance and I ordered the famous Southside Slope Headwich, which is supposedly voted the #5 Best Sandwich in the US. When we got our sandwich, we were so glad that it was ordered to share cuz the portion was HUGE. And honestly, one of the BEST sandwiches we've had and that's probably because we liked everything in there: fried pierogies, kielbasa, American cheese, grilled onion, and horsey sauce.  YUM YUM YUM!  Note that the sandwich also came with fried chips, which were okay but you'll have to have a pretty big appetite to still eat them after that Headwich! lol  PS: We also ordered their signature wheat draft and that was very good as well. This place is a must try when visiting Pitt and we hope to be back again in the future!

aAVdTTvzV8bxNSxg4rsOiA.text: Headwhiches.  That's all you have to say really.  Absolutely great beer selection and the food is MORE than ample.  I can't help but make it to this place at least once every two months for a binge eating sandwich session.

ugFD0TPTqwzvgQCeme0ajA.text: Yelp is great. The reviews were right on. Great food, lots of beers to choose from. The staff was excellent. College crowd.

iGhzjeV_hRbnU128sszhPA.text: Great burgers and an awesome beer selection!  Definitely make a trip if you are going to the southside!

FkQrFQOrdaYdgcSVqoB_eQ.text: This place was great! The beer was fantastic and we got a few small plates to share and everything was really good. The perogies were amazing!

BLCPimiBn9DIzMFoZL35xw.text: If you want an interesting and huge sandwich stop at Fat Head's.  I have been here over 20 times and only gotten the same things a few times.  My husband gets the same sandwich every time we come a PCI.  They have great appetizers such as wings, nachos, bread mushrooms, and pepperoni rolls.  I have gotten several of the sandwiches and they have all been great.  Some of the sandwiches are only things you could think of in a dream of putting together.  When you see them on the menu you may actually want to do a happy dance because you have found your perfect sandwich you have been dreaming about your entire life.  They are huge and I have come to learn that I can really only eat half and should take the rest home.  It is great though the next day too for lunch.  Their salads are huge and very tasty such as the steak salad.    The only con I have had is getting some items with BBQ sauce and the sauce was too spicy for me.  Some of my friends enjoy the Sauce but I am not a fan of spicy items.

lIIZ8fBPk8_Ug1V51_wNvQ.text: Sandwiches as big as your head!!!  Anyways, there are a ton of beers on tap and its always changing.  They try and bring very unique and little known microbrews to tap.    Fat Heads was always busy whenever I try to go (had to settle for other places sometimes...wait was too long).  For the food I would try some wings as an appetizer and then grab one of there countless huge sandwiches!  My only peeve is the chips...I have never been a fan of potato chips with sandwiches.  I would much rather have a side of sweet potato fries, mais c'est la vie!

XG1QmGEnPu_gO1zAHBX9mg.text: We went to this place as it was 1 of the recommend bars to visit in Pittsburgh. The atmosphere was good. The beer selection was good but the food was ok.

_ktSRj26c45XyonAXbbqJw.text: Ok this was my first time here and I wanted to try the South Side Slope. I love pierogies and kalbasa so why not.  The kalbasa skin was so hard I could not bite through it. I had to scrape the skin off in order to eat it. I did not really taste the pierogies because of the bun, but they were ok by themselves.  I did like the shrooms and you get a large order enough for four people. I would go back to try something else next time.

Z4p8tcLYLcHDfeuUdDp19w.text: Food and atmosphere great... Will however, never return...!!! Thanks to the 2 parking ticket ladies who wrote me at ticket while at the kiosk trying to pay for parking... Their only comment was... Your can fight it online if you want!!!!

v7jqSLJPQjAyXxJ0a6VZDw.text: This was my go to spot when I lived in Pittsburgh and I find myself coming back here every time I visit the burgh. The food is awesome and they give you tons of it. The wings are definitely my favorite especially with the jalapeno cheddar sauce. They are ALWAYS busy though so be prepared to wait. Good thing they have a great beer selection!

CYJcdgcFCuolqt8RU3QCQw.text: This place is the bomb.  The bumbleberry beer (5.0 alcohol) was delicious, very refreshing and I so wanted an Imperial Stout (10.5 alcohol) like everyone else around me seemed to be enjoying, but was too full after splitting the Southside Slope sandwich  with my sister.  I can see why Maxim Magazine rated it the 5th best sandwich in the USA. It was amazing.  The only mistake that we made was ordering fried mushrooms. The basket was HUGE.  We had to pass them around the bar because we couldn't even make a dent.  Great place and attentive service at a very crowded bar on Friday at lunch.  This is a must-stop kind of place.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome sandwich!
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Very refreshing bumbleberry beer
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great beer

-nUzpA5TxI_qL3MKohcC6Q.text: Delish!!!! Fantastic beer selection :) Ordered 2 sandwiches and split em. Can't remember one and dream about the other....  GARVEY'S BACON JALAPENO CHEESE STEAKTM Shaved ribeye grilled together with jalapeno peppers, bacon, onions & cheddar cheese sauce.  If you like spice get it, lots of peppers so remove some if needed but you won't be disappointed. I get back to the Burgh about 6 times a year and stop at Primanti Bros. on my way in and out of the city along with a few other favs. Fat heads just earned a must eats position in the line up :) nom nom nom

8yobc_7S4bKGTwY-dHDgFw.text: Worth the wait! Fat Heads is going to be at least a half-hour wait at just about any time of the day (peak time is closer to 2 hours), but don't skip off to somewhere with a shorter line or else you'll regret it! Located in the Southside of Pittsburgh, Fat Heads is a staple to any tourists must-try restaurants of Pittsburgh. Parking can sometimes be a bear; it's street or a small pay lot across the street.  Fat Heads has a great selection of food. From salads to burgers to wings to nachos, Fat Heads has something for everyone. Their menu probably lists close to 70 items (not an exaggeration); it always takes me forever to choose. I personally am a fan of their Quadruple Bypass Burger. Imagine a massive hamburger topped with cheddar cheese, beef brisket, bacon, and a fried egg...Delicious! (Please have a healthy heart before indulging) For a healthier choice, the Fiery Chicken sandwich is excellent, as well as any of their humongous salad bowls. If you cannot find something you like on Fat Heads' menu, you must be in the mood for Chinese or Thai because that's just about the only things they don't have. The portion size is honestly double any other restaurant. They call their sandwiches "Headwiches" because, no lie, they are the size of your head. My favorite appetizer is Pedro's Nachos, but beware, the dish is massive. Do not order for just two people because you won't get close to finishing and you'll be full before your giant dinners even hit the table. I've seen tables of 4 split nachos as their meal, that's how piled high these nachos are! For a more modest sized appetizer, try their wings. Select one of their delicious sauces, like Chipotle Honey.  Fat Heads' beer selection is all prestigious. I wanna say they have close to 40 beers on tap all of the time. Once again, any type of beer you can think of, they have it. My personal favorite is the blueberry beer.  You must go to Fat Heads hungry!  So, overall, I give Fat Heads' all five stars (I would've given 6, but the wait time is always long). My fiance and I usually get out of there for ~$30 with an appetizer and two burgers. Try the burgers, the wings, or, if you're feeling extra hungry, the nachos, and you won't be disappointed.

dGi3tAG042F-Eubw0CMF-w.text: Great food, fun place, but the service at the bar is horrible.  Can not get a drink or food unless you are camped out on bar like a lot of regulars who won't leave or order another drink.   Luckily some compitition is comming like urban bar. Same craft beers' good food, much better bar service and bartenders are at least attractive.

5n8-SRzVLnj1rjFkJFKsJA.text: Pittsburgh is known for food that can give you cardiac arrest in a matter of seconds and Fat Heads Saloon is the one leading the cholesterol train.  A bar with beer options from all over is my kind of place.  I got Bell's Oberon, one of my favorite beers and with one sample sip, the rest of my crew got the same.  I love to spread my love for Bell's around.  Anyways, we were seated and began to read their extensive menu.  Dear lord there were so many ways to die.  We ordered the nachos to start.  The potato should be the official vegetable of Pittsburgh (and yes, I know potatoes are not really a vegetable).  Since Fat Heads makes their own chips, they build their nachos on potato chips instead of tortilla.  Why are more people not doing this?  These were the best nachos I ever ate.    My lady friend and I decided to split the Southside Slopes sandwich.  The gents ordered the steak sandwich and the Quadruple Bypass burger.  From what I can tell, both were super happy with their choice since they both polished off their meals (and won my heart by doing so).  The Southside Slopes won a place on Maxim's best sandwiches list and I know why.  I have had many a food coma, but I have never been drunk from food and this is what that sandwich did to me.  I literally was buzzing from my half of sandwich, which is a bun with kielbasa, pierogies, grilled onions, and cheese with horseradish sauce.  I am either sad or glad this place is 5 hours away from me.  I can't decide.  I do know if I have to die from a meal, I will pick Fat Heads as my way out.  I am so happy to have ended my trip here.  This is a definite must for any visitor or local alike.

mN2qL0yQMGmOJxX8svIEeQ.text: Place is awesome, always great beer selection to pick from and their food is excelent. Always tons of people in there so sometimes you may have to wait but just head to the bar and grab a drink you will not regret it!

r593KLGZLnBT-29qQp4pAg.text: This place is great, and one of my favorite places to go. I always get the same thing - the pastrami that has smoked sausage on it. Enough food for lunch the next day and a good price. The chips are good too.

erpFvV8utgk9SpNCKSxJRg.text: Fat Heads got a new menu a few months ago.  Just as good as ever, and some of the Headwiches are new...they were due for a refresh. Lots of goat cheese on the new menu...doesn't seem to match the overall feel of the place, but hey, I like goat cheese, so it works out.  I still haven't had anything bad here.   They're doing a great job on their in-house brew(by in-house, I mean Cleveland.)  They're apparently going to start bottling as well; looking forward to that day when I can get a 6er of FatHeads brews.  I hope this restaurant continues to thrive, and if they ever decide to franchise...I'll open one in a second.

H59z3M0IX-Y01ekAtBXh-g.text: Absolutely loved it! When a friend came to town that used to live in the area, they insisted we go to Fat Heads. I couldnt believe how great it was even with people packed in everywhere!   With an allergy to beer, I thought I would have a hard time liking the place given the place is known for their microbrews and huge selection of beers from everywhere. I was pleasantly surprised with a selection of draft cider that was amazing! We hung out at the bar having drinks until the table was ready and the bartender kept us entertained leaving us feeling like it was the shortest hour wait ever.  The food was fantastic! Enough for a couple meals and cheap! It was a delicious combo and everyone around us seemed to be enjoying their food as much as we enjoyed ours.   I can't wait to go back and have decided to make sure to take any other friends that visit to Fat Heads!

SkE373vZd2v3bsv0QNW6eQ.text: This is one of my favorite establishments to visit when in Pittsburgh. It is a perfect venue for people that want to sample micro brewed beers from around the country.  The tap beer selection is extensive. However, if you don't appreciate beers and trying new ones, this is not the place for you.  Fat Heads also has the offers a club for those who try their beers, an incentive to get out of your comfort zone and try some new brews.

w3qj4t7OdKiNx5kVF7Dhpw.text: This place is EXTREME!  They have a HUGE variety of sandwiches, and they all looked mega delcious.  I kinda wish that I could come back here enough times to try all of them, but I'm concerned that I would suffer heart failure before I could finish.  For example, my sandwich was a kielbasa sausage, topped with fried pierogies, along with cheese, horseradish sauce, among other toppings.  Delicoius? Absolutely.  Healthy?  Far from it!    I will say that I was a bit disappointed in the fries, and I was also a bit disappointed that they were sold out of their house-brewed beer.    If you are in Pittsburgh for a few days, I feel like you are obligated to give Fat Heads a try--although I'd recommend going for dinner (or a liquid lunch) so you can try their award winning beer!

ixUtMuC_csXD6tWkDNlsSQ.text: My fiance and I come here...probably too often. They give you enough food to last a couple of days. I always take half of my sandwich home. The food is delicious, the wings are among the best I've had (the jalapeno cheddar ones taste like the love child of a jalapeno popper and a buffalo wing) and the sandwiches and burgers have never disappointed. Consistently great! My parents from eastern PA basically force me to bring home a spread from Fat Heads whenever I come home to visit. Yeah, it's that good.

YGGUHaNEw8xxPhj_0BY8AA.text: When you arrive at Fatheads, do not be dissuaded by the long lines. Around happy hour and dinner time, the wait can be up to 45 minutes. You are not allowed to call ahead of time and then show up, you must actually put your name in at the door. Certainly, the wait sucks, but South Side is a very neat place to stroll through and the food makes up for the line.  Every time I go here I eat almost to the point of discomfort. The food is too delicious to leave unfinished on your plate. I am fairly certain that I've never ordered the same sandwich twice and they have all been very good. Personally, I would recommend anything on the menu.  The appetizers are also very tasty. I like the beer mussels, which are mussels cooked in beer and topped with salsa.  When I come out of this place, I feel like I am 8 months pregnant with food twins. Thank goodness for the nearby bus stop, where I can just sit down and wait to be taken back to Oakland. The only bad part is that after eating it is a race between the bus and nature's call.

UQW1qDdv3TuTqk95lRdfXw.text: The food is good, the portions are big, the drink selection is nice. It's really noisy, often packed, the waitstaff isn't that friendly, seating it tough on a weekend afternoon/night

hayPgM8YmcO-JqnDmpBZ4w.text: I heard a lot about this place from coworkers while I was in Pittsburgh and I had high expectations, unfortunately I left unimpressed. To me it felt like the restaurant used the gimmick of "giant" sandwiches to lure people in. It does not matter how big the sandwich is if the taste is below average. The service was much better than the food.  For starters my party had the fried mushrooms and parm wings. The wings were excellent which is what saved this restaurant from a 1 star review. The fried mushrooms were huge but lacked flavor. The breading had no taste what so ever. For the meal I had their version of a Cuban. The sandwich was served on a giant hamburger bun and had ham, cheese, pickles, pulled pork, and a spicy sauce. First of all a cuban cannot be served on a hamburger bun, just something wrong with that. Much of the flavor of a cuban comes from using the right bread. Secondly, the pulled pork was awful. Extremely dry and tasteless. I ended up pulling most of it off. It was served with fries which were unsalted, and you guessed it, completely flavorless. This was by far the worst "cuban" I have ever had. I ate half and threw the rest away.   I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. You can get much better sandwiches at other places in Pittsburgh.

x1acNQ_iFopSeksT6CVkVA.text: Fatheads is hands down one of my favorite places in Pittsburgh. Amazing draft selection. A beer lover's kind of place for sure. The menu is basically atypical bar food... I say atypical because it is bar food (sandwiches, burgers, wings, etc..) with a twist. I'v never ordered anything here that I didn't love.  One major downfall is there is often a wait for a table... no matter what time of the day you go.

XUVdIvurBm_1kNmeiFbA1Q.text: All the burgers & sandwiches I've had here have been really good.  My favorite sandwich (Headwich) is the Bay of Pigs.  It's a ginormous spicy cuban and really delicious.  The fries & chips are great.  I also really like the batter fried shrooms and the soft pretzels.  Great beer selection.   BUT... the wings... they are consistently AWFUL.  They always come out squishy!!  YUCK!!!  I've tried them several times... tried ordering them well-done... they're always squishy.  I have no idea how they get good reviews on their wings... YUCK!   It's always really crowded and really loud.  I'd totally get burgers & sandwiches to go... but I'll probably never eat in the restaurant again.

j0P0UldX-hII1AuLyJ7l2g.text: Best bar in the South Side.  The beer selection is amazingly good for a bar in Pittsburgh.
