Prices for beers are higher than the typical $1.50 Iron City's around the city, but you're getting craft beer.   I would recommend giving the Fat Heads Brewery beers a shot.  The IPA is particularly good.    The service is good, the food is great, the beers are awesome.  Winner!

Bx4eeXpjeYk-uTQp56wLLA.text: Their food is absolutely amazing. Sandwiches as big as your head, wings that are super crispy and cooked well. Their service is hit or miss though. I recommend for lunch over dinner, as it gets pretty packed in the evenings. Their beer selection is also fantastic, especially some of their in house brews. They also carry a local cider made by arsenal cider house. A must get if you're a cider fan.

trvhruPfvkIbcv_vsroitw.text: Everything was great - wings, beer, grilled cheese, chicken sandwich and homemade chips!

MS4_6to26KLMDkFg_vJ9cQ.text: Tough to get a table, and slow service, but the beer selection can't be beat.

ZRmiZzErwqxsBdR0-zA68w.text: Sandwiches that are bigger than your head is True. I can never finish a meal here in just one sitting. I've never had a bad meal and love the selection of beer here, especially Fat Head's Bumble Berry Honey Blueberry Ale!

primPVua7fq57jkndn5Vhg.text: Was in pitt this weekend, and this honestly was one of the only good things about pitt.    Great beer, great food, great service, great time... if you go to pitt and like to eat and drink without a care in the world about your waist.  Go here.

9Q1PqcflfdcbiI05ThsbOg.text: This place is always packed with people.  And almost all of them will be dead by the time I finish writing this.  This place is about as good for your health as a Cambodian prison.  But what it lacks in keeping your heart functioning properly, it makes up for in raw, animal deliciousness.    By the time you're done eating, you will be covered in so much red, dripping effluence, that you will look like a zombie from 28 Days Later.  It's a damn viking feast every time we're in there.    The food is sloppy, but good, and if you've committed to coming here, I would avoid the salads.  That's like going to hell to get a tan.  This place is famous for it's unbelievably large burgers and sandwiches.  They are in no way haute cuisine, but instead rely on the basest of delicious ingredients to make them stand out.  The amount of sodium you ingest is around the salt level of one of the smaller oceans, and that's just for the wings.  They have their own beer, and an impressive beer list on top of that.  You will leave here feeling like that guy from the Monty Python sketch, so don't accept any mints, because you will fucking explode.  Waitstaff has always been very efficient considering the amount of people in the place.  Even though this place could very well be responsible for 30% of the heart attacks in Pittsburgh, it's a great place to take new to town peeps, and people that you want to die.

acXplPsbOKUzj8L8modjpw.text: A wonderful bar on Carson!  The food was out of this world! Served hot and fresh. One of the best steak salads in the city! And their Italian potato wedges are excellent! Nice selection of craft brews on tap.

7kTlLzhWbWb3KVXgaEDZvw.text: Hell yeah I'm a fan!  I had seen Fat Heads on the Food Network and was wondering it would live up to the hype.. well, for me it did. The place was absolutely PACKED for lunch, so we were told there would have been a 15 minute wait.. which we spent upstairs checking out the memorabilia store. The tables are pretty small (see pictures), and with the amount of food, it gets tight, but never uncomfortable. Service after we got seated was really efficient.  DRINKS: HUGE selection.. you name it.. They have a rotating list and if you get a frequent drinker card, you get different perks depending on the amount of different beers you try.  FOOD: VERY noms. Portions are generous, tasted absolutely great, wide selection, and it all even looks good! There are a dozen different level of spiciness for the wings, but if you order the killer sauce make sure you can handle it first. It hurts.   The atmosphere was great, and I don't think there was anything too "touristy" about it. A lot are regs, and the prices were reasonable. Can't wait to go back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. it would take a long time to get my name up there..
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. take your pick!
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UOtKFKDWJNyr0c44Fnt-Qw.text: Great sandwiches!!  Huge! Wings are amazing.  Beer selection may be best in the city.

-nvNLSXs7r4mUYHkdqIhwQ.text: I've never had a bad meal here. The food is always delicious, the portion sizes are generous to say the least, and the servers are knowledgable/attentive. Great selection of beer and ciders. Be aware that unless there's 4+ people at the table you're really not going to need that appetizer before your sandwich. My only small complaint is whatever time of year it is, it's always cold inside.

EklKvIbk7q2CW9cCFp-hoQ.text: They really are good. I don't particularly like sitting there, but it's just worth it sometimes. The wing sauces are probably the best in Pgh. I'm personally a fan of the Beasty BBQ and I get the Killer Chicken sandwich (no ham). I love spice and heat and this place has it in spades.  The menu is so huge that I can't imagine somebody not being able to find something they want.

TdOUW3BthnggMUezvsZH1g.text: Great food, but in many ways it ain't what it used to be w/r/t the size and quality of the food. I lived in Pittsburgh and ate here at least once a week. Still great, but you can't go home again. Usually a wait, and you can't reserve a table, so either put your name in and go next door to Casey's (if you love second-hand smoke), or call in a takeout order.  This is the real deal in PGH, not Primanit's.

abYnvPdaY0dVtX8Z3AryFA.text: Whenever I have guests from out of town come in, Fatheads is one of the top 2 places I like to take my guests to- #1 being Primanti's in the Strip. Fatheads always has a great beer selection and the food is great with enormous portions. My favorite item on the menu.... Chips! Can't go wrong with Fatheads!  Great outdoor space too.

AeP-kmuyqt7PDOTLm2B8zA.text: When we got there to eat the host went to seat us at a table next to people at another table that was practically at our table and they were even using one of the chairs and the host told them they will have to scoot their table down instead of just sitting us at the million other places that were available. We asked to be moved and she got a bad attitude with us. We walked to a dirty table and asked if they could just clean it and we went to sit and she yelled at us and said we can't sit until the table was cleaned which was rude and frustrating. When we finally got sat the waitress was nice and took care of us. After awhile we kept feeling the cold air come in from the front door from opening and closing so we asked if we could be moved anywhere else that wasn't near the door. She was nice and helped us but then passed us over to another waiter which was really good and friendly! Food was ok not the best and service gradually got better!  The host needs to work on customer service and being friendly!

SzwH9k2RHKaiDANq8DwM2w.text: a lot of food! Food was quasi.  Waitress was very attentive and helpful. I can't eat that much! That's why it's called "FAT HEADS!"

828BdHA5Muk0H18ZuNaIRA.text: Went there for lunch on a Sunday with a couple of friends on the recommendation of a worker at a beer distributor.  It is definitely a popular spot for locals, as we had to wait 15 minutes for a table.  However, that was not a big deal.  I had a pint of the Headhunter IPA, which is one of their own micro-brews.  It was above average in quality.  For a meal, I had the Southside Slopes headwich, which is served with 'fancy' potato chips.  The chips were mediocre (so I would've preferred the fries, which looked really good), but the headwich was decent.  It filled me up, for sure, which sometimes doesn't happen for me.  Service was adequately attentive even despite how busy it was.    Pricing is a little on the low side considering it's a city and the portion sizes.    As a note, in order to fill a growler with beer here, the growler must bear the standard Surgeon General's warning.  I suspect that this policy is due to some Pennsylvania Liquor Control Board regulation; it stinks of the PLCB.  Fills cost $25-30, which is on the high side.

koFb0H2Jr6I-bO1w457Sow.text: The Parmesan wings are amazing. They have great flavor and they're big. They have a great selection of beers, including their own. I've gone a few times and they have been out of seasonal beers on tap, but they always recommended other beers in their place. The sandwiches are as big (of bigger) as your face. I recommend the pastrami out of the ones that I've tried, but I don't think you could go wrong.

MFTirHFsL3lfcKfOzi8RAg.text: This place is a glutton's paradise.  Their beer selection is excellent.  The also make their own beer and the IPA I drank was very good.  Ordered some fried mushrooms and holy crap.  I haven't seen so many fried mushrooms in my life.  They were also amongst the best I have had.  The pastrami sandwich was on point.  I had this for lunch.  I barely ate dinner that night.  Highly recommended.

Z4dfNU2WhXSEW1QzGE0RMw.text: So we are from pgh and when we come back to visit we always return to Fat Heads. We had the first bad experience of 10 years a couple weeks ago attributed to snotty service (he had mike ness hair and was  very chubby on a Friday night), inconsistent food and a lackadaisical manger but today It was all righted. Food was back to its normal awesomeness and our Server, Todd, was way above par! Great experience on a lazy afternoon!

QQqMtGY_7F3orIzn199UfQ.text: This is one of the best places to get a sandwich in Pittsburgh.  Their menu is enourmous.  They have to have over 4 dozen sandwiches alone.  They also have wings and other delicious foods.  Also they brew their own beer here.  Fat Heads is a great place to go for a sports night in Pittsburgh or for just any regular night when you want to get some good food.

vGu0zJIumWSwwFH2EL7eLA.text: Fathead's is like the Cheesecake Factory of delicious pub food.  I mean that in a good way: an unassuming place with a deceptively large menu and tons of choices.  They also have 42 beers on tap, but we were taking it easy for lunch.  Any place that incorporated pierogies into their sandwiches gets full marks for creativity.  My friend Lili got the Kelsey burger with sharp cheddar, bacon, a potato-filled pierogi and onions with a side of horseradish.  The cheddar had a nice bite, the burger was cooked perfectly, the buns are fresh-baked and delivered by a local bakery daily.  I opted for the Killer Chicken.  A chicken sandwich with swiss cheese, roasted sweet red pepper and a spicy, peppery caribbean sauce, served with ranch on the side.  It was spicy at first, but lost its heat as the meal went on.  Shining start of the meal: the Chicken Parm soup.  It was a tomato-puree based soup with generous amounts of grilled chicken, diced onion, pepper and spices and a good amount of mozzarella cheese on top, baked on like they do a french onion soup.  it was amazingly flavorful and hearty and easily the scene-stealer of the day.  Great food, good price.  I have something to write about  to the boys back home!!

BqHd71kcgOj0Sj2Kfw6sbA.text: ~Happy Hour with the bro on friday~  So you know when you are really hungry but feel the need to order a salad to be healthy but secretly hope its in a barrel-sized bowl with a lot of extras- well this is how Fat Heads does salads! Roasted Potatoes in a salad, I don't hate it!   I got the grilled shrimp salad that was served in a the family-sized bowl which was delish! I also got a bloody mary which was one of the better ones I have had( all the works celery, olives, lemons, limes).  Bro got a grilled chicken salad which was a perfect 'man's salad' covered in cheese, french fries, and roasted potatoes.  Man Healthy accompanied with a bud lite...classy bro. He dug it tho.   Scene: Mixed crowd (kids, yinzers, yuppies) decent array of males (typical button down crowd), nice outdoor seating area with a lot of fans to beat the Pittsburgh humidity.   Overall: Will check out the bar again with some girlfriends (bro was a bit of a cock block, sry bro)! Check it out!

9bB9R8-eu22j5APeJy1X6w.text: If you are a fan of Fathead's beers then you may enjoy this place more. Basically standard bar food but larger portions.  Food is nothing amazing. There have been a number of new bar restaurants opening in the same area that far exceed this place (wing Hart's and urban tap). Service is fair. Be prepared to wait exceeding long times Fridays and Saturdays as basically all 40+ suburbanites in Pittsburgh converge on the place.

JYA7LC0fEf7IFR5EIuY6EA.text: This may have been the worse meal I have ever eaten, this meal was disgustingly bad, I'm a vegan and its very hard to find a restaurant thats good for me, the first time my meal came out it was drenched in cheese, then the next time my meal came out it was drowned in hot sauce, I complained to the manager and the manager didn't care he said " thats how its made." I would never come back, and i recommend vegans to stay away!

AqQZzeLyCPqY4_4sUgSFSw.text: Loved Fat Heads. The wings here are really good. Not as good as the kitchen sink at William Penn but still very good. I like the spicy parmesan and the honey bbq. For the munchies, you need to get the loaded potato skins. They are awesome. My friend used to work there as a host so he'd always bring home a ton of potato skins when he got off work and not gonna lie. Even though they were cold, you throw those in the microwave and heat them up, they are still unbelievable. The pastrami ruben is very good. But my main course is usually a burger. And my ... do they have burgers. I'm a big blue cheese fan so of course I like the bacon blues burger. The mushroom swiss is also very good. I once tried the fiery voodoo killer burger but that was way too hot for me and had to get a different burger instead.   But the best part about fatheads is the BEER!! they have way too many beers here which is awesome. The beer list also changes so you may miss one if you don't swing in frequently. They also have a beer frequent flyer thing that if you drink enough beers consistently at Fat Heads, you get your name put on their wall. One of my friends came here almost nightly to try and get his name on the wall for about 8 months and still couldn't get on it. It's very exclusive and it is awesome if you do get your name up there.

58DdKzF7IcWJfOMoBaeUKw.text: Surprisingly, we only spent 10 minutes searching for a parking space on a weeknight! We had coconut shrimp for appetizers. Very crispy. Not greasy, but a tad too spicy.  Initially I wasn't impressed with their drink selection. I wanted a sam Adams imperial stoudt which they did not carry. However I was impressed at with our waitress's knowledge of the menu. She suggested a different imperial stoudt, and I really like it. My alternate beer was defiantly comparable in texture dark, thick, syrupy but slightly sweet. I had a double d sans provolone and Parmesan. It came stacked with sausage , steak, and salami topped off with tomato based sauce.  Pricing is reasonable for the area.

pvge64LA05NGIqGLhzvzqA.text: This place is the only reason I regret moving to LA, and the first place I visit when I'm back in the 'Burgh. The most unhealthy, over-portioned, delicious food I have ever eaten. Everyone raves about Primanti's being the place to visit when you are in Pittsburgh, but they have it wrong. Everyone I bring here is an instant fan.  McMinn's Chicken Dance is mouth-watering (chicken breast, fried egg, cheddar cheese, etc. Need I say more?). Wing Night is the place to be. Their beer selection is phenomenal, and they have 30+ on tap.  It's always busy and has a great location in the South Side.  I really wish someone would open a franchise on the West Coast.

HuAqLMmYC-3uEB_JK4CbYA.text: Fat Head's is awesome.  Great craft beer selection.  Their Head Hunter is one of my favorite IPAs.  The food is good.  Huge, huge portions.  My son loves the pepperoni rolls, and this kid is pretty much indifferent to food.  He is very picky and only eats when hungry.  Fun atmosphere. Be prepared to wait a long time for a table, though.

ffI8wDNcw5QpaQzT1K3Q4w.text: The beer here is pretty good, they've got a few interesting ones worth trying. I've ordered the Bumbleberry on a few occasions - it's my 'safe' option at this point, it's always decent! Fat Heads would be better if it didn't feel so crowded all the time, there's been more than one night where the group I was with left because the wait for a table was too long or the bar was too busy to get a drink.

eTN0q84HEKtibeZ2iYp26w.text: I finally got to eat here after a 2 year hiatus. Well worth it I had the Kim Jung Moo the kimchi was authentic and the burger was big enough to feed a small village. The service was quick and attentive! I just hope they expand to Massholevania! That or deliver.

N8cViXz2dSf5mNfeLOrWqg.text: The absolute best Wings and Cheese Steak in Pittsburgh! When I have a stressful day of work, there is nothing better than going all out at Fat Heads. People complain about the wait and I totally understand but they will call your cell phone when ready and there are plenty of other places around to grab a beer if the Fatheads bar is packed. My only criticism the transition from independent Micro brews to the the Fat Heads brand not that the beer is bad but there are some good ones no longer on the menu.

hkxzDlf55Lgusw7qkkK2Vw.text: Had a big 'ole dinner here with friends who live in the South Side. The sandwiches are no joke and are definitely close to the size of my head. I ordered ONE to split between the hubby and me. I also ordered an appetizer of garlic Parmesan wings for all 4 of us to enjoy. Yes, I was full by the end of it and would come back again.   Everyone but me tried their beer selection and reported good things. I'm generally a lemon water gal so the beer selection did not affect me. This joint reminded me a lot of the Old Fashioned from Madison but without the fried cheese curds ;).   There was a 45-min wait on a Saturday evening but the atmosphere was cool since we were waiting with friends. If I were actually starving and just wanted a meal, I would avoid this place like the plague because I'm allergic to crowds and people in general.  Prices were reasonable and service was fine when you finally get seated.

5aPoDfIGbV9Jkpm3pg4wdQ.text: Always a fun experience! Fat Heads has a great selection of beer and food for everyone. My favorite are the burgers, but anytime I've eaten there I've always been happy with my food. The service is usually pretty good too.

oMtA0mPyQxDLcPjHo-MYMw.text: Great beer selection, food to die for. Never disappoints. It's a Pittsburgh classic. Must try if your in south side. Beware of the menu size! So many good things, and not enough time to try!

Pndnus4K6f5RnCD2Ngvxbw.text: They told us the wait would be 30 minutes. It ended up being 2 hours. No lie. NO joke. They didn't seem to care or be apologetic whatsoever. Also on their menu, it says they do not try to substitute fries for chips with a sub or sandwich because it's "too hard" for their kitchen. The food tasted fine but it's not customer friendly. We are highly disappointed.

dj2i728xmCTOW1JJsIQXtA.text: Are u SERIOUS????  They have been warning us on Facebook that the menu was going to change and boy did it ever...!  Gone are ALL the sandwiches that had stuffed banana peppers on them, gone are the soft pita's that used to come with the spinach artichoke dip, gone is the side salad that was mixed greens with croutons on it.  We sent it ALL back and cancelled our orders of the Chicken Little and Triple Bypass.  I'm not about to waste a night with all disappointing food.  Go there at your own risk, DO NOT EXPECT THE SAME FOOD AS LAST TIME YOU WRE THERE....!  You've been warned...!!!

vrynL_rBWWTTCbd25Z0RDA.text: One of the best selections of beers anywhere in Pittsburgh!  Expect long waits on the weekend. It's worth it though, the food is always delicious. Don't forget your beers to go!

g-b8V2onw0TnXVveXRlDuw.text: Good service. But the black bean burger was too mushy.  And the Chardonnay wine was very pricey and just average tasting.  I was seated in the back beyond the bar and the lighting was poor.

mFC3t_bTCyt3wemlQEzvQA.text: I usually love fat heads, and our recent experience was a bit of a mixed bag!   Started at the bar for about two hours, but we had a large party so we expected a bit of a wait. Everyone seemed to enjoy the beers which was good as they have a great lineup.   We got a bunch of appetizers, fried mushrooms, fried pickles, onion rings, and a soft pretzel (notice the fried theme here!?) the batter had a little spice to it, which was really delicious, and all of the accompanying sauces like honey mustard and a spicy sauce were awesome. Overall the apps did not disappoint.   Then we got to our table. Everyone ordered a variety of different things. Sister had the voodoo burger which she said was delicious. I ordered the brisket at the recommendation of our server. It was OK. Honestly the brisket lacked much flavor so I was a little disappointed in that. The sandwich came with French onion soup for dipping, and was smothered on onions and an aioli. It just didn't do it for me something was off about the taste and it may have been the aioli or the lack of taste of the brisket. My other sister got the pulled pork and said it also did not have a lot of flavor to it. A few others that were with us loved theirs, others not so much, so overall it was hit or miss. Still a south side staple so I'll be back, would likely just try something else!

sot-XIqFPX035FkR1FdqIw.text: We've been going to Fatheads since it was the original bar with the beach mural on the rear wall - probably early/mid 90s.  The place has really changed over the years with several expansions.  While it's still a good place to grab a bite, a lot of the old favorites are long gone - no beach burger, no club, and most missed, the giant salad with iceburg lettuce.  We still come down from time to time but it's not quite the same.

J3Cufc2nas77P8J21QeISw.text: Top five foodie places of all time.    We returned as vegetarians.  They made me a specialty burger with a black bean patty instead of meat.    This is a meat lovers paradise though.  The sandwiches are off the charts.  The fries perfect and cooked till they are dark in color.  The chips weren't our favorite so substitute.  The beer is top notch.  Make sure to order one of their labeled specialty brews.  I love Belgian beer too so try a tripel.    Food quality has stayed consistent for the dozen years we've been going as tourists from out of town.    Top five of all time in our book.

iGYvB2mHMtQKe3ufI-0zPw.text: I really wish I had known how good this place was. How have I lived in Pittsburgh for two years without trying this place? Anyway...  I came here to meet a couple of my former nursing school now nursing friends who I haven't seen in much too long because of our different schedules at work. I came a bit early for dinner but I saw one of my friends already waiting outside. He apparently had an smartphone app that showed him how many people were ahead of our group, which I found pretty cool. In a few minutes, we were seated and more of our friends started arriving. The interior is fairly spacious, but was packed because of dinner and the hockey game on TV. Speaking of TVs, you will have little chance missing anything happening because they were placed all over the place!  Our hostess seated us in the small outdoor area that had two circular tables with umbrellas. It was a nice cool day outside, so we were pretty happy. Apparently we just missed happy hour, so we had to order drinks full price. No problem. I took a look at the drink menu, and wow, I couldn't decide. After several minutes, I finally ordered Fat Head's Trail Head pale ale. It tasted hoppy with citrus overtones, a refreshing choice for the night.  I then look at our menus. Considering it was the first time for a few of us, one of my friends persistently recommended the Chik'n Little headwich ("chicken Fingers dunked in our Original Wing Sauce topped with provolone, 2 fried eggs, American cheese, ham, bacon, lettuce, tomato, onion and hot pepper mayo"). I thought to myself, "Wow, as a nurse, I'd be crazy to order that!" Nevertheless, two of my nursing friends ordered it... -_- .  Well, considering I am vegetarian, I chose the Portly Fellow headwich ("Portobello, roasted red peppers, and fresh spinach topped with tomato sauce, basil pesto, Arrogant Onion Rings and mozzarella, goat cheese and Parmesan"). My other friends ordered garlic fries, which was amazing! When my headwich came out, I almost fell out of my seat because of how huge it was. Mushrooms, cheese, onions rings, and sauce were oozing out between a large burger bun with a huge steak knife impaling it right down the middle.  I thought to myself, "I shouldn't have gobbled down this fries..."  Several minutes later...  "That was delicious! Wow, did I just each all of it?"  Yes, it was that good.  After we paid our checks, we even decided to have some ice cream from a place right down the street. Well, why not?  Overall, food was excellent, drinks were excellent, and customer service was great. I will definitely come back the next time I am in Southside.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Portly Fellow burger with chips (and beer). No wonder they call these headwiches: I could barely fit it in my mouth!

UxnMt_SA-fPaYSLm9nP2gQ.text: Fatheads is goddamn delicious and, frankly, anyone who thinks otherwise should get their taste buds checked (unless they're vegan which, no offense, I disregard your reviews anyways).  Huge portions, amazing food, good beer (and I don't even really like beer).  The blueberry honey beer is my favorite, and the "Divine Swine" is my go-to sammich.  And, yes, I can eat the whole thing.  Service is a bit slow sometimes, and expect to wait for a seat over peak periods (lunch and dinner).  Totally worth the wait.

pQ9_ZepYfuDyRz0u_1XzHA.text: This may be the best food i've ever had. I had the sandwich with the pierogies and cheese with onions and it was so good! one of my favorite places to go in pittsburgh!

vrxwEyofnn2nadg7XbnXOg.text: Without doubt, the worst sandwiches my two brothers and I have ever had.  The bread was dry.  And there was way too much of it. The toppings didn't make sense with the sandwich, either. Putting broccoli rabe in a cheesesteak just makes it bitter.   Really, this was a bad, bad, bad food experience.

SkJIR6EExuux9L1z8gNJfA.text: Large space with upstairs, downstairs has a bar area and many tables and chairs for seating.  The menu has many American offerings, especially of headwiches.

y6FHm568CfE9V8szYDjbdA.text: If you love craft beer, Fat Heads is a must in the South Side. A huge selection of Fat Head's own products is matched with good food. The atmosphere can feel cramped, but the bar itself is appealing. The food is good. Nothing stands out, but no bad meals have been had by myself there. It's hard to get in, but if you can it is worth it.

tas_Or1Sxc9PW0WZp-xMyQ.text: Tried this place while in town on business and was very pleased.   I had the pulled chicken sandwich (sorry as I forgot the actual menu item name) but it was "hands down" delicious.  Good for a low key meeting or casual get together with friends.  I'll go back.

lVGwn47OTVXBP7iCioKWnQ.text: This place is AWESOME!! To me this place was the perfect bar. They have pierogis as an appetizer on their menu and even put pierogis on a sandwich with kielbasa. What?! Why didn't I think of that?   They have a great craft beer selection including several house brews. The Sunshine Daydream was a good beer if you're a fruit beer person like me. They also have a full bar and cool bartenders ready to mix up whatever you want including totally off the wall never before seen concoctions. Just tell them what you like.  In case you were wondering the pierogis were amazing. Can't wait to get back here and try more menu options and house craft beers from here.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Craft beer selection at Fat Heads.
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Deep fried pierogis with sour cream. Possibly the best appetizer ever.

i9hH2agh9BmfxA1WKKCK5A.text: My co-worker and I stopped in the other night. When we're on the road together we pretty much have to try wings no matter where we go. We split an order of the smoked wings and an order of the fried wings. The smoked wings were solid. Not the best I've ever had, but still really good. The fried wings were solid as well. The Killer sauce punched a mean habanero kick. If you inhale through your mouth while eating them (like I did), it can end up in an embarrassing coughing fit. Not unbearably hot, but not weak either.   We also split an order of the ribs with the Beasty BBQ sauce. Loved the sauce. The ribs weren't exactly fall-off-the-bone, but they were good.   Service was great.   I'm sure they don't want people lingering here, but their choices of television programming left a lot to be desired. They came up on a search of bars in Pitt with MLB Extra Innings...but I don't believe this is actually the case. In the heat of the MLB Wild Card race they were showing the pregame for the hockey World Cup and some Tough Mudder style reality show. I get it. You're Pittsburgh. The Pirates suck and the Penguins have Sidney Crosby. Hockey trumps. BUT...it was like an hour before the game was even starting and there was no sound on. That's my main gripe about this place. If you're going to have TVs in there, have someone in charge of making sure that worthwhile television is being displayed.

RXD5urpbuKFOIE3i3ajrIw.text: First piece of advice, download the No Wait app because there will always be a long wait! Even when busy the bartenders have always been helpful with advice or tastes of beers. They have so many beers!  So many good beers always rotating.  The food is decent; not great but not bad. The sandwiches are big but a lot of that is bread. The buns are just really thick so you'll be eating lots of carbs. I got the Pull Monty and it's delicious if you take off the top part of the bun. Otherwise it's just too much.  Easily one of the best spots on Carson.

4AqY2EnMJyuTQFnOpXWKHg.text: Great place to watch the Steeler game (and only the Steeler game when they are playing), have a few beers and a great sandwich. Bloody mary's are good, too. I can't remember the name of the sandwich I had, but it's basically a cuban, and a damn good Cuban at that. Service was good, considering how busy the place was. I would definitely go back.

qevtV7AJTeR2-blJbb99Zw.text: This place gets two stars from me because the food was terrible.  I don't know about other people but I don't like my nachos using potato chips....  I sent them back... and what replaced them wasn't so hot either.  Sure there's a large selection of beers here.  I like that.  I wasn't terrible impressed with the beer I did order but I am willing to give them the benefit of the doubt that they do have other beers that are good.

DUDRtdPDgzzYzzarQud7vg.text: After reading several reviews, we decided that Fat Heads was definitely a place we wanted to check out while in Pittsburgh! We headed there for lunch on a Sunday afternoon and were surprised that they were already quite busy.  We were seated promptly in the outside dining area with no fuss made when we requested to sit at a table that did not line the wall (we have never been a fan of the long benches that line the wall with tables spaced several feet apart, no privacy).  Anyway, it took us several minutes to look over the menu as there are ALOT of options! We agreed upon the pepperoni rolls for an appetizer, I had an order of mild wings, my husband the Chicken Little and my daughter, a cheeseburger (there is no children's menu). The pepperoni rolls were fantastic and I could've eaten more! Great crunchy crust with flavorful cheese, pepperoni and sauce on the side! Yummy!  The sandwiches were huge! The Chicken Little was served with homemade chips while the cheeseburger was served with fries (note: they do not allow substitutions on potatoes) both were very tasty.  My husband reports that the sandwich was very good and my daughter had to bring much of her lunch home, it was just too much! The wings were average size and were good but a little dry for my taste.  We will be visiting again, just so we can try something else from the extensive menu!

i9-4UUPACiWOSvQ727p0dQ.text: note: reviewer is not a beer person, this is for the food  environment: knowing fatheads was a landmark of southside, my jaw dropped at the Chili's-like atmosphere inside. The place was squeaky clean with colorful, laminated menus on every occupied table. I want my sticky menus and cigarette butted floors and a tattoed bartendar who loves his mother goddammit! waitress was nice, but pepsi over coke?!  food: the burgers do live up to their hype, craziest burgers I've ever seen. for some reason, they taste 5 times better when reheated at home. all the flavors really meld together after a day in the fridge.  the fries with skin were really good but you can get the same fries at five guys with less greasiness and more malt vinegar.   i did see a sandwich at another table composed of  the biggest slice of toasted bread holding a melting pot of cheese and other gunk, with a side of home made potato chips that made me drool. i'll go back for that.

-9fYLnTMH2UiXxKwlg-1vw.text: Legendary huge sandwiches and extensive bar. Get there by 11:30a for a lunch table. (Note, nearly every review of Pittsburgh restaurants seems to include the line "huge sandwiches")

BUIazGGEYLBoWi95L-GXlA.text: Large beer selection (most on draft), bartenders that seemed to know what they were talking about, and an overall good vibe in the bar.  We only stayed for a couple of rounds, but had a great time and I'd love to go back if I'm ever in town.

vHKIdea4mKy_g8aC3jKSoQ.text: Make sure you're ready to eat if you come here. The proportions are ginormous and will definitely leave you with a food coma. The fries that come with the sandwiches are also great.

rp2EwWwLD4FLV16aarMGdw.text: I went here before going to see Kina Grannis perform, that night... A friend of mine had suggested it, so we all met here.. About a half hour wait, and we sat outside (it was hot as HELL that day, too) but it was soooooo worth it. The food here is INSANE!!! Their fries? Amazing. Their home-made chips? Amazing! The sandwiches? To die for... and you probably would, considering how large they are! Seriously, it was sooo much food, and it was so delicious. I'm thinking about flying out to the Pitt just for a day to come back here!! SO good!

GlCfh4hR3kfp75yeE6RY5A.text: I think I was expecting a tad more when I entered these doors.  We were seated promptly and ordered the following items:  Pepsi Tea Five killer wings (5/5 fat heads in heat) Ten original wings (4/5 fat heads heat) Chicken soup Smokey burger with fries Side of Homemade chips  I was really jonesing to try the Killer wings...I really enjoy food that is piquant with good flavor.  The waitress just looked at me and asked if I was certain and I said yes.  After waiting for a few minutes we recieved the wings and the chicken soup.  The chicken soup was really nothing special.  It was obvious that it was made from fresh ingredients, but the flavors were not in balance -- certain herbs were masking the flavor of the chicken partially while completely smothering the taste of the vegetables.  I put my nose close to the wings and took a good whiff.  I was suprised to find that my nose did not retaliate.  I knew right off the bat that they were not as hot as billed.  I dug into the killer wings and ate two of them before I switched to the original wings.  I was not impressed.  The heat is NOT commensurate with the flavor in either the killer nor the original.  In fact, the flavor of the killer wings was subpar compared to the original wings.  Do not get these wings unless you hang out with a bunch of people that have no affinity for piquant foods and you are trying to show off.  The flavor is just not worth it.  The original wings, while not as bad as the killer, had a bit of a sweet base to them rather than the acidic base that I am so fond of...if you like sweeter things, you may like these.  I will be going for one of the 3/5 fat heads in piquancy next time to see if there is a better equilibrium between heat and flavor.  As I was finishing the last of the wings, our sandwich arrived.  The flavor was somewhat lackluster; there was just too much bread.  As I was eating the hamburger, I started to speak to our server and she asked how the sandwich was.  She stated that for some reason the company they purchase bread from gave them rolls that were larger than normal and she was wondering what we thought.  Being myself, I told her about the overabundance of bread.  While the food itself wasn't that great, I must say that the service was exemplary.  At no point did I feel smothered nor did I feel neglected.  Our servers chipper and up-front attitude definitely earned points in my book.  I will return, if nothing else to have a beer or two; but I do want to retry the burger to see how it is with the proper ratio of bread to burger.

9iV5jIopw2ZNFaiJemEIqQ.text: I don't feel the need to write an incredibly elaborate review for this place, but I will say this... their burgers rival the best i've ever had. I miss this place so hard. Fat Heads, I love u.

GzUFG8lBSzJM3UZDqSwqfA.text: If you're in the mood for some food with a kick and a cold beer, go to Fat Heads.  Also, they have a *huge* amount of beers on tap and each one was as cold and tasty as the next one.  The Pastrami I had on my sandwich was excellent and my friends Chicken salad was the "best she has ever had."  I addition we order the Cheesy Jalepeno Wings which were ok, however, the sauce that was used for them was the best part.  It was *so* much better as a dip for the chips that came with the meal.  Restrooms were clean for a saloon, yet, that is not saying much.  I"ll be sure to return if I'm ever back in Pittsburgh again.

9rvYAJqQUlWGrfSpY1kAlg.text: Best. Bloody. Mary. EVER. Great food... grown up grilled cheese...

K0ZBFbCpb-gcl1LVgied3Q.text: Good Food and Beer, but normally a long wait is in order when come to this happening spot.

cHG6VD0aQfS5gFX6fgEKEA.text: Best sandwich place I have ever been to.  My sandwich consisted on pastrami, sausage and a fried egg.  It was huge.  I also tried the steaks with pepperoni and sausage-stuffed hot peppers and the pierogy sandwich.  All were delicious.  I was on the only person at the table able to finish theirs.  We all needed a nap after we ate.  They also have their own beer which comes in a variety of styles and flavors.  This is the place to go in Pittsburgh.  Do not let anyone else tell you any different.  5 stars!

T5kHOWCcUr6kyjIi8oHHQg.text: My family and I met up with some friends here for dinner (09/30/10). It wasn't too crowded since we got there early, about 5:30. We had appetizers - fried perogies (OMG Yum!), mozzarella sticks and cheese fries. Everything was so delicious. I ordered a chicken salad, the name escapes me... One they are famous for. I ordered it with chicken tenders instead of chicken breast. I wasn't expecting the sauce on the chicken to be so hot, I didn't like it. Everyone else in our party really enjoyed their food though. I had 1 drink, I thought it was a little weak. Overall, I'm glad to have met up with my friends, enjoyed their company and that everyone else in my party enjoyed the food.

DLSrkhtCPr8IQPsLejbkSw.text: Awesome.  Come hungry because the portions are ginormous.   The food is great and there is an excellent beer selection with something for everyone. .

arZQjMfSyw4uCOVRtRJ5MQ.text: was really good, excellent beer selection, friendly service, my friend and we exhausted, got up to bar, order beers and wings(really good)... woman next to me suggested I order the voodoo burger, good choice if you like hot n spicey ... it was a flavorful and hot ... great hang out

vM4cPcEAJ7H5yN56ukMIIw.text: I want to go back to Pittsburgh solely to eat here.  Homemade thick cut potato chips with homemade honey mustard dressing.  Insanely good. The salads with french fries, steak, cheese, and homemade croutons.  WOW. My favorite sandwich, steak with red vinegar sauce and anchovies.  Insanely good. Quite a hefty beer selection too.

j0NH7K_r5tA1LrkPCuK09Q.text: My kind of place!  HUGE menu with tons of sandwiches, "headwhiches" and burgers!  I really like places that mix it up... I got a Kelsey burger which was topped with a pierogie and onions!  Portions were big but not ridiculous (I ate everything).  The only problem I had was it was a bit of a wait and I felt a little cramped at our small table.

4YjH_RjjwywGTbvAQpiZrQ.text: We had a really nice time here-the beer menu is epic, including some good onsite brews. The food was mid- to upper-quality bar fare, but honestly, I was looking for something kind on the arteries, and there was only one choice on the menu (an unappealing vegetable sandwich) that fit that category. I ended up getting the opposite, a bacon cheesesteak, and the best part of that were the homemade potato chips they served with it.

mtEPpV6_1NG_zgyFeA8stg.text: Went here as part of a friend's Batchelor Party....I don't remember much except the Parmesan wings here were unbelievable. I had at least 3 other types of wings but I don't know the names but they were all good. When I come to Pittsburgh again will make it a point to come here no matter what. Also, had my first Rolling Rock beer here...that counts for something!

_E7JrZ6KY5rGMvZBmcs_uQ.text: ENORMOUS portions and a good selection of beers.  Food is okay.  Pretty good atmosphere.  Worth stopping in when you're in South Side.

UE7524imBaiMzKpuLn5GtA.text: My mouth is watering. For their gigantic burgers! For their homemade potato chips! For their Parmesan wings! For the many many many beer selections on draft! They literally have a burger that's called the heart attack. Be warned!   This is just a great place on so many eating and drinking levels! I also enjoy the outdoor seating area during the summer so you can people watch on Carson St! There's usually a wait most nights and on weekends but it never takes too long to get in. Plus it's TOTALLY worth it!

Xv27yANmSUuUDiaY1e5jwQ.text: Waited 90 minutes to get seated because we heard good things.  Here's a hint,  don't make the same mistake.  It's not worth the wait.

jsQBCIEddJA7MrlJTO5DWg.text: Fat Heads is a nice spot to come with a bunch of friends for some beers and a few bites. There are about thirty beers on tap of which around a dozen are brewed by Fat Heads Brewery. A bonus is that they have a hand pump for cask conditioned beer!

P3NaKIu1K1Z-R5x_uVtDOA.text: good beer, good sandwiches! That is, if you are willing to wait....  Been here a few times and it's pretty much always been a long wait. Last time we showed up at 6pm on a Friday and didn't get seated until 9pm. They have this cool program where it texts you and lets you know how many people are in line ahead of you but it was still frustrating.  Favorite sandwiches to date: Southside Slopes and Sweet MB Favorite beer to date: Up in Smoke Smoked Porter  I'm definitely going back for more headwiches, just not when there is gonna be another long wait.

tT6s3m0cvcHSFsJTYGOHdw.text: My husband loves Fat heads.   We went for a late lunch this past Monday.  I am not a picky person but it was terrible.  First off I asked the waitress if it would be possible to have a glass of Sangria.  Her response was a curt we don't have that.  With that being said its not hard to throw together a sangria but..ok.  I then ask for white wine.  My wine arrives in a lipstick stained glass...yummy.  After my husband drinks his beer we notice his glass was also dirty.  The table was also dirty and the chicken in my salad was terribly dry!!!!  My husband liked his wings.  The service was really bad also.  I will never eat there again.

znVhj60jpjEZfpxrqBBL2g.text: They have a big menu .. Lots of yummy diff burgers

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon cheese burger
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum bacon jalapeño white cheddar Burger
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummmmmm..

NjJMtE_nBcLsVl_9RRw_2A.text: Notable beer selection, excellent sandwich menu. Among the "safe" places to go in the South Side, where you are able to enjoy time with friends and family over a great meal and excellent beer. Real laid back vibe, qualified staff and good prices. Critically great beer collection.

oFPAujzN4XXLoVPHSW_cjA.text: Another Saloon.  Looks to have a lot of regulars.  Several TVs to watch game.  They have a kitchen but it wasn't open.  At dinner time?  Any saloon with darts gets an additional star from me.  Not a lot to distinguish the decor.

QQPTKAi75MoUOOewzHt51w.text: In town for the Red Sox game at PNC Park. Fat Heads came highly recommend & we left feeling we had made a good choice. Excellent hand cut fries & burger was delish. My husband enjoyed his craft beer & was impressed that when he asked if he could sample one - they inquired as to which two he was debating between & brought him a sample of each. Excellent service.   He ended up buying a Fat Heads t-shirt, so I KNOW he was impressed. As a chef, it's not always easy to find a meal he enjoys 100%.    Well played, Fat Heads (certainly better than our beloved Sox that night!)

vjON4BSVRAi3R6Ksm0305g.text: Awesome food and HUGE selection of beers from all over! We had a party of at least 10 people there and we were well taken care of by our patient waitress. The food came out with hefty portions for all of us and we were all impressed with the our meals!  My fiance and I are from California and we were pretty stoked to see some of our local breweries up on the board! Even fat heads micro brews were delicious! Our bartender took great care of all of us while we were waiting on our table even when the bar was packed! Probably some of the coolest and most attentive bartenders I've ran into on the entire East coast! So hats off to this place for making my trip to the Burgh even more enjoyable!

GL4nesVqOEJuD5ECfis1pA.text: Expert pastrami & salmon BLT wrap were EXCELLENT. Chips fantastic & service was exceptional.

I9FBgANJUDoIfmVwdDsj0w.text: Fat Heads has almost become a Pittsburgh staple. Before I moved here I remember people telling me I must check it out.  The place is always crowded, so make sure you are prepared to have a beer from their awesome huge selection of beers while you wait to be seated. If you don't want to wait try them out at lunch or early evening.   The portions of food are huge. I normally go into this meal either really hungry or prepared to share. Service was pretty decent too.

naxztIfsBpCLOWjUMhPO3w.text: My friend recommended that I came here for lunch today, and I was very pleased at the quality of the meal.   I ordered the Smoked Burger, and I can compare it to BRGR or Burgatory. The onion straws were perfect, and the barbecue sauce gave it a delicious flavor. I can't wait to come back again sometime.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoky Burger

U4_OlMDItnggS4PS4Ql5WA.text: OH MY GOD this place  is good !  What a Menu,,,,, How many way's can you want a Pittsburgh Hamburger ? What ever you are thinkin , They HAVE IT ! Great Beer Selection too.  Man , I could live here.  Kinda loud , but Hey , Its SOUTH SIDE right ?  Gotta LOVE Fat Heads . Bring your buddies and an empty stomach . but you better leave the chevy home. theres NOplace to park.

GVKeEKz0yl6VyxmtDOkoLA.text: Ordered a giant pretzel on a Sunday night. They must expect everybody to be drunk and not care, because when I received my order it's black, burnt to crisp. I turn back the un-edible order, Bar tender tried to argue with me that it's not a soft pretzel, just a giant one. Are you kidding me?! I would of chipped a tooth! New giant pretzel comes out, has mold on it. Moral of the story, stay away on Sunday's, food staff doesn't care what it sends out....

TV7lRwb5FgroShJaorPbgA.text: This is a great place for a beer and awesome sandwiches. It's in the heart of the bar scene in Pitt which reminds me of Hoboken NJ.  I got the famous pirogi and kilbas sandwich. It was just ok to me. Eastern Euro food is not really my go to cuisine.   I was also sick that weekend. So, everything didn't have any taste to me.  Thank God there isn't a fat heads in NJ. It would be having the heart attack grill in your backyard. But, I'd die a jolly man.

WXQZ-S8xjTqxATSwLcyt-g.text: Pretty sure our experience at wasn't the average: Quiet time and dainty nibbling.  We were in town on a Tuesday night at 10:30, after all, so the place had that, "We're just about to close feel." Ghost town, tumbleweeds...   Beer-based review, here. We were only there for a few beers anyway, and beers they surely gots: Dozens and dozens of craft beers- good ones, a great draft beer selection, plus Fat Heads' own brews which were mighty good too. A vast array there for you. Our bartender was friendly, our order of ten of their hottest, spiciest char-grilled wings were good. Yeah, they come in 5's and 10's. Shrug, I dunno. We were not starvin, just a mite peckish, so the plate of wings hit the spot. I understand that this place is known for their headwiches, so I'll be keeping that in mind, during future Pitts times... Sandwiches as big as your head, you say? I've heard tell.

bqwIjr0C_gCWBxhP-NYPNA.text: Well, I really enjoyed my meal at Fat Heads. We showed up about 630 on a Friday and we were seated immediately.   I saw the table next to ours and noticed what I thought was a lot left on the table. So I worried but there was no reason to - it was because they give you large portions.  I had the arugula salad with a hamburger petty, one daughter had the divine swine and the other a burger.  All foods were cooked to our specifications. Our waiter was really good - as good as he could be and was very pleasant, although he was really really busy.  Another table near ours ordered the nachos - made with the housemade chips; they looked really good and a meal in itself.  My girls only ate half their sandwiches as they were very good sized - but also I thought the food was very good, and very reasonable. I felt like the people who worked their appreciated our business.  We went for a bit of a walk afterwards and on the way back ran into some travelers on foot from California; we ended up giving them our leftovers. I hope they enjoyed them as much as we did.    Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

y7baH6elzj8TjMglo7XUig.text: Pretty good traditional American food. The menu is huge and so are the portions. The venue is large, clean, and has many TVs. The menu not only has a lot of options but also many unique names with funny descriptions. Many craft beer selections at about 6 dollars a drink, I purchased the HEFEWEIZEN, which was very delectable. The food was pretty par, not breathtaking but nothing was wrong with it, I had no complaints. The waiter could have been more attentive, as I had to get her attention... But she was very nice and good at taking specific order directions.   I got the steak and egg minus pepperoni and mayo. My friend got the veggie burger. My friends burger looked delicious.  Fatheads seemed very clean and food pumped out pretty fast.

8IWqmqPFxkcQ-5XlH4xlcQ.text: Absolutely loved the food here.  Had the voodoo killer burger and it was top notch.  If you like spicy food give it a try.  All the beers I had from here have also been very high quality.  Definitely will be back!

7MTQd-fhf9tcvomxj3LJcw.text: Huge beer selection that constantly changes. Great selection of sandwiches, wraps, burgers and wings. Very popular place that usually has a wait. Great food that is worth the wait.

e21FVcKQRSTMwk4Y3H6H9w.text: Sandwich was ok, not worth $12. For 4 people to eat sandwiches, it was over $55. Waitress shook her head when she received her tip. You're really expecting more than a $5 tip when you had an attitude?

gh56jn8bYKH3PI2KP3Ytow.text: I like Fat Heads. I used to love it, but I just don't love the Southside anymore.   What's good...pretty much any sandwich. Love the Bay of Pigs, any burger and Wanzco chicken sandwich. Salads are decent. Hand cut fries and chips.   What I feel like is a real surprise are the pepperoni rolls. Really good! Soft pretzel is eh...fresh out of the freezer.  Great beer selection and their brews are always pretty good. I usually try to drink one of the seasonal ones they are brewing.  ALWAYS busy. ALWAYS. It's crowded and loud, but I expect that in there. Usually have good service as well.  I like to go to the Southside in the afternoon...no one spilling out of the bars at that time. I just wish it didn't seem so Skid Row at night.

Yz68TK8pjA9jS86BtBQNFg.text: If Maxim Mag voted Southside Slopes Headwich #5 Best Sandwich in USA... Who am I to argue with the almighty Maxim Mag?  Let Maxim order for me. Eat eat eat.  Chomp chomp chomp.  Chug-a-lug(beer).  Slide my ass down the chair. It's my pleasure to report the Southside Slopes Headwich($10.95) satisfied my hunger. At last check, my Head is still larger than this Sandwich.  Relatively.  :P  Kielbasa, Fried Pierogies, American Cheese, Grilled Onions & Horseradish Sauce This Sandwich taste exactly like how it is described.  The Kielbasa is the kicker. Kielbasa's savouriness offsets the other more mellow somewhat sweet flavours. All ingredients are as they should be, nothing more, nothing less. Homemade Chips were an unexpected surprise, rare item indeed. This place has their own brand-o-beer. Bonus territory (+0.5 star)  Interesting to see so many pack leftovers home. Must be Tourist!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. South Side Slopes Headwich
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sunday Morning Breakfast(Citra Pale Ale)

_5IiCx_crVa11i3mKR-4uw.text: We went here for parents weekend while visiting our daughter at Pitt. The food was really great, we all liked our dinners. The fried pickles are unbelievably good, very light and delicious. My daughter and I both had burgers, and they were very good. My only drawback was the Killer Chicken sandwich  my husband ordered. It was way way way too spicy to eat, and we love spicy food. I think the waitress should've warned us how insane it was. I would definitely go back again however. Perfect place to take your college son or daughter too!

4XkMHgKc0u3P3p7WOLjiLA.text: I just don't get what the fuss is about. Yes, the sandwiches are good, and large. But not really better or larger than any good sandwich place. It also bothers me that you can't upgrade chips to fries. I don't like chips at all, but don't want to order a whole basket of fries. I wouldn't mind paying a buck or 2 up charge, but the little note the menu explains that this can't be done. The wings were only ok. The beer is good, but very overpriced for often small pours. It's a shame when I can get a bigger, cheaper Fat Head's draft at pretty much any bar other than Fat Head's itself. For reasons I can't explain, it's always packed. Always. Be prepared to wait, and never even get a seat at the bar. Service has ranged from fine to god awful and slow. Again, the food and beer aren't bad, but not good enough to justify the crowds, prices, and hype.

sks1mDjVDfx-GAHkaQUDOA.text: One of my favorite places in Pittsburgh. You might be tempted to get something else, but trust me, get the wings! Some of the best I've ever had. I don't live nearby, so I'm sure to stop here whenever I'm in town. The beer selection is great and always changing.

9kveIsO_6XnWePvo_rroVQ.text: I have to preface that I used to constantly say that I "hated Fatheads"  greasy food, heavy beer, meat, more meat, gross. Well, thanks for changing my opinion Fatheads! After years of complaining of how disgusting their food was, I am pleasantly surprised to find that I thoroughly enjoyed my last meal. I have a blueberry chicken salad that was Really good. I felt great eating it. Felt great afterwards.  Delicious. I highly suggest it. And I can't wait to try some of the new menu items. Finally some items so the entire family can find something comfortable to eat! I did modify but the greens were abundant & fresh. Crisp. Grilled chicken was moist and flavorful. The blueberries were plump & fresh. And the dressing. The blueberry ale dressing is the star of the show. FatHeads has a real winner with this menu addition!

vzlvoga6Mmkc1x_pfhEpoA.text: We decided to try Fat Head's during a recent trip to Pittsburgh. They were busy, but we got a seat right away. Definitely take the previous reviews seriously when they say the portions are huge! I got the Divine Swine. If you are a wimp when it comes to spicy food, be warned. The Smoky BBQ sauce set my mouth on fire, bad enough that I had to force myself to finish half of my sandwich.  I also wasn't impressed by the chips, they were pretty flavorless. They have a great beer selection.  I tried the Jack Straw and the Trail Head, and both were very good. Overall I liked Fat Head's, but I don't know if it's a Pittsburgh must visit place, like Primanti Brothers is.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Divine Swine Headwich

QcWs5TLI0qvDhbSdli_eog.text: I always order the Fiery Voodoo burger with killer sauce, and some Fat Head's Headhunter to wash it down with.  It is amazing.  The pulled pork on top along with the killer sauce is just bliss.  It's the only place I go on East Carson (other than NaKaMa) and it's definitely my top recommendation for Pittsburgh.  Fat Heads'a atmosphere and great staff make for a great time every time!

JlSvDMJ4r7YQizPwXkbUCA.text: Fat Head's is good, but I think they suffer from their popularity.  The sandwiches are all huge and great. I'm never disappointed. I don't care for their chips nor their fries. They are mediocre. That really isn't a problem though since the sandwiches always fill me up.  Their beer selection is my problem. It is a huge, but the prices are high and they don't use full pint glasses. They need to drop the prices or use real pint glasses.  My other issue is the service. It is always slow. I don't know how they can solve the issue though. I don't think they can fit any more bar staff in.  I'd strongly recommend Fat Head's off hours. I'd advise against it on Friday and Saturday nights.

pl3F9R30VZaIcgtCBU5JtQ.text: Who doesn't love a brewery with a restaurant in it, right? We stopped here as a "must do" while in Pittsburgh. Bottom line, it was okay. Alcohol selections are the bomb - As far as the food I think it's more hype than substance. Review gets 3 stars - one for concept, two for beer selection, three for some bright spots in the food experience.  ATMOSPHERE: Very "Fat Heads" centric, obviously. There are tons and tons of Fat Head beer marketing campaigns, past and present - very fun to look at. That said, the noise level is WAY over the top, the high ceilings only amplifying an already too noisy dining area. Don't go here if you are looking to talk with your date / friend / partners in crime... we could not hear each other at all, and resorted to mostly hand signals.  FOOD: MEH... I was totally ready for blow-your-mind goodness based on other reviews. Maybe it was an off night for the cook, or maybe alcohol dulls tasting capabilities (sorry fellow yelpers), but for our money, what we got was dry, boring, and relatively tasteless. Our entrees, such as they were:  1) Wayne Sandwich  - the kielbasa sausage was truly a nice variation from traditional sandwiches, and the sausage itself was nicely flavored. Outside that, it lacked any other flavor (where's the sauce, folks???), and was something I felt I could have put together at home. PRO - it's a huge sandwich.... so huge that our server recommended we split it (thank you for that!)  2) Fat Heads Fingers - Had to order this app for the kids (NO KIDS MENU PEOPLE - BEWARE if you have children). These were okay, but not anything special - the breading was virtually unseasoned, the ends of the fingers so well done they were almost inedible. I found myself thinking that they SHOULD be a kids menu item, because adults should know better than to pay for this level of blandness. PRO - the sauce which came with the fingers rocked... if the cook put that level of passion into the fingers themselves, it would have been 5 stars instead of 1.  SERVICE: Below Average. Our server had some ideas she was willing to share while we ordered, but then we had a hard time getting her attention after that. Someone else brought our food to us, and we'd have had at least another drink more each but she never returned to take the order (or to ask how our meal was).   VALUE: Meh. The prices are okay, but I expected far better quality for my money based on other reviews.  In short, go as a novelty, or if you're looking to drink good beer in a bar that happens to serve food.  If you are looking to go purely on the food alone, you'll likely end up disappointed.

9IhmEHNZdlbdmGme0ZxAYg.text: If the essence of Pittsburgh were a restaurant, it would be Fat Heads.  I grew up in western Pennsylvania, where salads are ALWAYS topped with fries.  It wasn't until I moved southeast that I realized the rest of the world does not grease every pile of lettuce with fried potatoes.  In case you are an out-of-towner like me, or you live under a rock, Fat Heads brews their own beer.  I tried the IPA, it's okay.  Wasn't bursting with hoppiness, but it did the job.  Contrary to what most every review of Fat Heads discusses (wings, burgers, the causes of your impending heart disease), I will rave about the salads.  If you've read maybe half of any one of my reviews you know I love my big salads.  Well, Fat Heads' salads are HUGE.   Everyone (except me) took half of theirs home. Each one comes in a punch bowl, and topped with fries a la western PA.   The fries were meh.  I was disappointed, but not enough to knock a star.  Dense and solid more than crispy and mushy.  That just means I ate fewer fries. A win in my book.  Ambiance is great alfresco.  Refreshing and peaceful, still hosting the cheery indoor Fat Heads' mood.  This is definitely one of my new faves in the burgh.

dnBD07QjetKO3bS7lrdzrg.text: Delicious my bacon cheeseburger was cooked to perfection.Music was a tad loud could hardly hear the people I was with.But other then that no complaints.Our Server Amanda was great

te86m3mJPSpCQTrL6QHC5g.text: During our latest adventures in Pittsburgh, we decided to check out the South Side neighborhood. We made a stop at Fatheads after walking up and down Carson St. The place was packed! It was Saturday night and we waiting about 45 minutes for a table. While waiting we enjoyed a couple pints (I had the smoked bock and it was AMAZING) and did some people watching.  When we ordered dinner we both went for the burgers. They were pretty good (HUGE) and I don't think either one of us was able to polish it off.  If you're looking for a decent beer (they have about 40 on tap) and a good bite, check out Fatheads.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked bock
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huge burgers!

5WhkMHIickcI42hvomhmjw.text: The burgers! Oh the burgers! I've eaten here several times and every time I leave with a smile on my face and a full belly. Not only are the burgers delicious (as in drive an hour to Pittsburgh for them delicious) their beers are delicious as well! My favorite is the Bumbleberry, YUM!   If you're in Pittsburgh, this is a guarenteed food win!

w4lk9V7MyvYEPWpI7Nv_jQ.text: I didn't imagine my first full evening in Da Burgh starting out at such a great place. But, thanks to numerous positive Yelp reviews, I directed the cab driver to Fat Heads. I (luckily) grabbed an unoccupied stool at the bar, not knowing the entire place would be completely packed later in the evening. I'm glad I arrived before 7 pm and never moved.  Beer: over 40 great draft selections, all listed above the bar with corresponding ABV. There were four original Fat Heads brews and I decided to try the Goggle Fogger, a refreshing Hefe-Weizen. It was so good, I felt obligated to have a second 20 oz sampling during dinner.  Food: Unbeknownst to me, Monday night is Wing Night starting at 7 pm. Sounded good, especially at 40 cents apiece and unlimited mix-and-match choices. I ordered three triplets of: Cajun Ranch (dry), Spicy Parmesan and Jalapeno Cheddar. All three were good, crispy and flavorful, but I favored SP the best.  After enjoying the food, drink and the beginning of the MLB Home Run Derby, I decided to head out. Apparently my intent did not go unnoticed as a guy sidled up to me when I was paying my bill, eyeing up my barstool with great interest. No wonder...this place is awesome!

h2AG7brZyczfncmnrCdRXw.text: Great food, great beer... Definitely a must if you're new to/visiting Pittsburgh. I constantly recommend Fat Heads to friends that are in town visiting looking for recommendations. I think Fat Heads is what Pittsburgh's about! Great food (and lots of it), great beer, and a great atmosphere.  I usually get their veggie burger with fries, which is delicious. I would come for just their fries, in all honesty. SO GOOD.  Their beer is indisputably good. You can find it at a lot of other restaurants in the city as well. They all have fun names, which adds some nice personality.  They have a small outdoor seating area, which is nice in the summer.  If you do plan on going here - get there early. They often have a long wait - but it's always worth it.

hzLzdCjhpkiIK-zIGGMyvQ.text: Menu looked great and the food was great.  The issue is the the people working there.  The staff at the front desk and the bartenders (all female) never put a smile on their face and definitely didn't seem to realize they are in the customer service business.  All were very rude, seemed put off when asking a question or ordering a drink.  Thank God for our waitress and the Manager that made the experience better.... management needs to take a hard look at who is greeting and seating people and taking orders from behind the bar.  There are too many people needing jobs these days that would make the experience so much better! Too bad!

tLw-x_gjCnRkQ77E_MWDmA.text: We came to Fat Heads salon this past Friday night after being rained out at PNC Park.  We stayed for most of the rain delay, lasting over 2 hours, and I was starving by the time we left.  We headed back to the car and noticed that nothing was still open and serving food anymore, so we opted to go to the South Side and hit up Fat Heads.    We have eaten here a few times before, just never this late.  They were serving food until midnight so we snuck our orders in quickly and had some great brews to enjoy while waiting.  We ordered 10 wings with the fat head's original sauce; they came with celery, carrots, and your choice of ranch or blue cheese.  We also ordered some fresh cut fries.  Everything was really good.  There was only one server/bartender so things at times moved slowly but all was good.  The last time we came here they had this pierogie and sausage dish on the menu.  It was excellent and I was hoping to see it again but alas it was not present.   I enjoy coming here for the drinks, and staying for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wings fries and beer...
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wings and fries

28z_M1NrONKH8TgTSQkJPg.text: Fat Head's sandwiches are gigantic and delicious! The Divine Bovine was absolutely amazing! and their pirogies were outstanding! The atmosphere is great for a loud sports bar. I was in there during a Penguins playoff game and the energy and the atmosphere were pitch perfect. I will absolutely go back to Fat Head's the next time in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. one of the best sandwiches I&#39;ve ever had.

5F0Klw-6HcAYbc1GbHMRrw.text: Fat heads: the home of sandwiches the size of your head! Literally.  This is a place that I typically visit when my sister is in town, there's a big game on, or I'm looking for an amazing sandwich!   You know walking in that you're going to get a great meal that will be super filling and you will most definitely be taking home some left overs. A lot of the chicken sandwiches are typically too spicy for me (I don't like the heat!), so I've branched out and tried other sandwiches/burgers/salads -- all of which have been great!  The bar typically has a great beer variety and of course they serve their own Fat Head's brand.  This place is definitely popular for every meal, so be sure to stop in early and put your name in!

lilu95s_cDcFW0M5RGoauw.text: I used to live in the South Side so I would end up at Fat Heads way too much.  If the food wasn't so fantastic and the beer selection wasn't so amazing, the crowd would probably drive me away.    Which is the main reason I only give 4 stars.  From time to time the service can be sub-par.  And most nights and definitely on weekends?  Forget it, there's going to be a wait.  So anymore I go for lunch at off-times or get take out when I'm really craving those sandwiches.  Again, if the food wasn't such a draw, there would be fewer stars in my review.  But they've got some of the best wings.  Great appetizers.  And I'm a sucker for homemade chips.  (Hint: go for Pedro's Nachos if you like homemade chips.)  The sandwiches and burgers will definitely not leave you hungry and they have some rather creative combinations.  They even have big salads, though I can't say I've ever tried one.    Is it worth the wait?  Yeah, it is.  And if you can get a bartender's attention you can kill a few drafts while you wait.  But for me, I'm too old to wait.

rtktKJEmTTgfcqep_FGavA.text: Great selection of Fat Heads and other beer options. The food was delicious and plentiful. Friendly staff.

6GSiqlDdjObA3qsXl-MMAQ.text: Customer Service: 4 Value: 4 Food Quality: 5  If you are going here then you MUST order one of the Headwhiches. These are by far the best sandwich that I found in Pittsburgh. VERY good tasting sandwiches that will fit anyones stomach!   Homemade Chips that you have to taste to believe!   They have a great selection of craft beer on tap that all beer drinkers can enjoy. I'd recommend sitting at the bar for fastest service and people who have first hand experience with the beers on tap!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burgers
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sandwhiches
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Headwhiches

49eNVDNHg5rDMEzpp2-A1g.text: Well I have to say the options are endless I never know what to get once I enter the "extreme food haven".. so I chose the chicken artichoke dip and Pittsburgh salad two outstanding dishes that were packed with great flavor and a touch of Pittsburgh we can't wait to return#TerriBerriez

wac3yS8wodm2xNUiS56fWQ.text: Super fun place in the Southside area of Pittsburgh. It is a brewery and restaurant. When we arrived, there was about a 30 minute wait for two people so we grabbed a drink at the bar. I got the Coco Loco Leprechaun and it was amazing. On the heavier side for beer because it's a stout and the hint of Jameson made it so good. We ended up getting seated in 15 minutes which was nice. The chicken artichoke dip is super yummy. The sandwiches are giant so my aunt and I decided to share. All the combinations sounded amazing so it was hard to choose. We ended up going with one that had prosper and pulled pork and donated to charity. It was very very delicious. This place is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

79i7tPdNnT0Iwv4ofMpjHw.text: Good beer. Great bar food. Highly recommend the Garlic Parm wings and Double D sandwich. Load those homemade chips in some ranch dressing. Wish more of the outdoor seating was actually outdoors instead of through an open bay.

KlKvrZAVVw8RanXjR9mSQA.text: Always a favorite!!! The chips are a must.  The sandwich decision might be a little tougher but my favorite is the mo better bed and chedda.  And pick your sauce for the chips

z2IQERU1tE5OlmH7Qs5k6Q.text: 1st visit was a success! I can't believe I have lived in Pittsburgh my whole life and never came here to eat until now. We had really good service and just walked in and got a table immediately (5:00 on a Monday ) . Ordered the Bumbleberry beer and Frickles (which could serve 4 people easily) as an app. Also had the Pittsburgh salad and wondered when the waiter asked if we were sharing it?! And then it came and was HUGE!! We were offered a sample of the Holly JOLLY beer and it was good too. This place is a must go!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Fa-KxAUWd5IiiUSc3n8nyA.text: Nice Place. Cramped, crowded and quite a wait, but what you get is a nice, restaurant with lots to offer. The sandwiches are huge, the beer and drinks are a plenty. i kept it plain and enjoyed the "Classic Bacon Cheese Burger" and it was a good choice for me. Not impressed with the Fries though. Overall, we had a nice time.

P75V2NIu7oPhpUoVQYoZHg.text: Really enjoyed my evening here. They have a covered outside area that keeps you dry (especially on raining nights like today) but gives you an outdoor feel.  Our waitress Tori was excellent. She was a beer rep for the company, so she was very knowledgeable about the company's expansion and drink selection. She took the time to sit down and explain menu items. You could tell that she was passionate about the company.   We had the pretzel appetizer, which was cooked perfectly. I recommend getting it with light salt. The beer cheese was okay, along with the mustard, but the pretzel is so good that it doesn't really need anything extra.  I ordered the smoked wings with a side of smoky bbq, the big beefy barbecue handwich, and a side of fries. The portion sizes are huge, as everyone else has mentioned. The wings were okay. The rub was nice but the meal in general seemed to be missing some flavor. The wings were good once you used the ranch and smoky bbq side to doctor them up a bit. The fries were okay, but again, needed a little flavor. The "handwich" was great, but a better bun would've taken it over the top.  Overall, what really impressed me was out waitress. She really made my night in terms of a great dining experience. I was looking for a little more flavor, but I would frequent again for the customer service alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. big beefy handwich, smoky wings with side of smoky barbecue, and a side of fries!

fWQPgOiBoqT3aO3v56EqCA.text: My husband and I came here years ago... to drink. This time we brought our kids and decided to have dinner here. There's parking across the street and on street parking as well. The woman told us it would be about a 20-25 minute wait. We decided to walk around while waiting. However, after about 4-5 minutes we got a message saying our table was ready. When we got back, they said they in fact didn't have a table for us because they didn't realize we needed a highchair (we specified this prior). Therefore, we had to wait another 10-15 minutes. It was actually sort of frustrating. When we finally got sat it took our server quite a few minutes before coming over and then a few more minutes to get our drinks. The food was actually really good. The beer was excellent and cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TKomHDQfMGuQrl7OxvMPXA.text: The smoked wings are simply the best I have ever had.  Very tender. Also you get the entire wing in one piece. As far as wings go a 10 out of 10. Fat Head's branded beer offerings continue to expand and impress. Head Hunter is my go to IPA and the Hop Marauder was excellent as well. I liked the latter better than Nimble Giant which is saying something. They upgraded their game in the food department in the last year or two as well. Very nice and knowledgable staff.

aqjHWndNMoFkjEob77197w.text: I've been here on a few occasions when I come to visit the Burgh! I've been here when it's a busy Friday night and on a quiet Monday for lunch. Great beer selection of not only Fathead's selection but of other great breweries as well. Was able to try out the food this time and had the pulled chicken sandwich with a mustard BBQ sauce served with fresh potato chips. The lady we had was very nice and attentive but the guy who stepped in wasn't the happiest and didn't provide the nicest service. Other than that it's a great big space with lots of seating! Also the bathrooms are brand new. I'll be back to visit when I come back! Great food and beer! The service could just be a little more cheery that's all.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fat heads on Southside
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beer list and taps

cyKZGcsomSE6WkPJwZOjEg.text: I came here for lunch and ordered the twisted brisket sandwich. The sandwich was good. It was full of meat. It could have used a lot more fried onion straws. The chips were good if you choose the right ones. A lot of the chips were hard like a rock. The thinner chips were crisp bit you had to dig through the pile to find them.

1d0142WJ94G5Uh69EbDZgQ.text: Had delivery from this place and the food was delicious. The fried pickles and smoked wings are amazing. They are generous with their portion sizes too. Can't wait to try  other items on their menu.

IvO3e9X7XqIHL_gchc0TkQ.text: Sub par review because based on what you order your experience will vary tremendously.  Ordered the chicken little sandwich and was amazing....friend ordered the famous "slopes headwich" and was awful along with the "wanzco chicken" sandwich.  Other Observations: the slopes and wanzco chicken sandwiches seemed to have way more bread than meat making the sandwich very dry.   For sandwiches you can not substitute fries for the chips (big disappointment) not a huge chips fan, but love fries.  Tip: Headwiches are bigger than the sandwiches but not by much if trying to decide between the two.  Overall: Good service, Good environment, Hit or miss on food sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken little
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken little

yzKzZ6EZ4e0z2F2SU9KQ3Q.text: Our waitress was fantastic, and the food ultimately was delicious.
