I'm giving this a four star review because my Pittsburgh salad came out with no french fries and that's a pretty big faux pas. To be fair they did bring me out a side of super fresh really delicious french fries that I've been ate with ranch dressing, so not all was lost. The wings here are super good, as is the brisket salad-they smoke their meeting house and they certainly do a good job. The sandwiches are just incredibly huge, totally splittable, actually everything on the menu is totally splittable unless you're in the mood for a serious eating experience quantity wise.  Are usually go for lunch just because going to the southside any evening during the week is a circus. Especially Thursday Friday Saturday even Sunday, it's undergrad central and everybody's out on the prowl an extra hammered.

5sGouFAmvdyq90_RF2xRTg.text: One of the better craft beer places I have ever been to. Their IPA "HeadHunter"is fantastic Their limited availability IPA "Hop JuJu" is outstanding. One of the best but only available in February. The menu is decent & includes the usual burgers, sandwiches, etc. Decent tunes fill the air. The crowd includes locals and hop heads.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hop Heads
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beer Menu

97UGUPcBl5tcatGF6zZk8g.text: A group met here for lunch as it was suggested by others. I was able to park on the street at a meter not far away. There may have been other options but I was in a hurry so took what was first available.  As it turns out, I was the first one there so I sat at the bar and had a beer. Loving craft beer, this was a great place for me with plenty of options. I've been to the main brewery in Cleveland before so I knew what I was getting into.  Many taps were available.  Once everyone arrived, we were sat in in the back by the hostess and our drink ordered were taken quickly.  Since I had never eaten here before, the Headwiches were suggested. I settles on The Pull Monty. Pulled chicken with Carolina sauce, slaw and jalapenos.  It did not disappoint and was huge!  Not just a clever name. This thing is as big as your head!  I'm a sucker for Carolina sauce and while this wasn't the best I've ever had, it went well on the Headwich.  The fries were just average fries but they give you a lot!  It was a nice atmosphere for a lunch but I'd like to come back in the evening to see how things are and try more beers. The service was excellent and we had no complaints.  Give them a try next time you are in Southside!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lots of taps!

H3GtxQPJr5TFweHWS7hXuQ.text: I mean, eh... The beer selection is their only saving grace. I just feel like this is a suburbanite bro bar. Which let's face it is what happens to a lot of places. There are just so many choices for food and drinks in the city why do the same old same old when other places are more vibrant, fun and have better offerings. Last time I was here the food was over cooked and frankly gross. Service was equally as gross...don't are complain about burnt food.

KOxbAUdFA7W0OQPFbz9JfA.text: AWESOME BAR FOOD! The service was superb as well, from the hostess noticing that there was an open 2 top table, right after they thought it'd be a 20 minute wait. The server was amiable and chatty - and very helpful as this was our first time there.  The smoked wings were some of the best wings I've had (very juicy and the sauce on them didn't need the added ranch/ bleu cheese sauce to help it out).  The garlic fries were yummy and garlicky (always a winner).  The burger had the beef patty and brisket. Flavorful, tender and scrumptious.  Their craft beer list was extensive and I can't wait to try it, because I will definitely be back here!  Prime location too on Carson street, with a fair amount of parking surrounding it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fries! Appetizer
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked wings
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlic fries

mtrl20SR0p9cpWJb2-ShHg.text: First off, the atmosphere is awesome. The service is first class. If you like IPA's, grab a Headhunter. It's a Fat Heads original. We always start with their original wings and ranch and blue cheese. All sauces and dressings are made in house. Definitely grab a Headwich (Sandwiches the size of your head). I have been here over 100 times and I've never been disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6W-q6e_nkMymXlJd5BzPhQ.text: We stopped in here based on the recommendation of a bartender at another restaurant. We used yelp to get on the waitlist, which was almost an hour long. When we arrived at our assigned time, we were seated within a few minutes. It is a fun, casual, and loud atmosphere for everyone seemed to be having a great time. They have quite a few craft beers to suit any palate. We both ordered sandwiches which were huge! The chips that are served with it weren't so great and were under seasoned, but we didn't need the extra food anyway. I couldn't even eat half of my sandwich but my husband made it through his. If you are looking for a place with good food, a casual atmosphere, and a great beer selection, this is your place.

Fo7PsBzs8ImS6Qg-mw_GNg.text: My #1, favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh!  Great food, service and beer. I am writing this review from Philadelphia, it's that good :)  Eats Highlights:  The Southslide slopes, the Jack-o, and their grilled medium wings   Beer Highlights: The Sorcerer (when it's available); goggle fogger (hefe); holly jolly (Christmas) and do I even have to mention the Headhunter IPA and the Bumbleberry ? (my go to summer beer- it's more refreshing than water on a hot summer's day)   Thanks for the memories and pick-me-ups, Fat Heads! I'm still buying your beer every chance I get at the distributor's

OpcTHGmBUMqFlOeLmk0r8g.text: Favorite place ever.  Food is definitely quality and worth the price.  You never leave hungry.

AiUl-oDRnKK4Vh23Q7rEoQ.text: The decor was exemplary. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. I had a burger that was perfectly cooked and delicious chicken tenders. The ranch was A1. The sandwich options all sound very incising. Would most likely come back but probably won't.

3G8aFpAq2vGAhF-D3qN2tQ.text: Terrible. Absolutely terrible. The host staff has no idea what idea what they're doing. We called a take out order at 2pm. It's now ten til 5 and we just got our food. They didn't have chicken and didn't tell us that when we ordered. They did call us back after a half hour to let us know and had us reorder and told us it would be ready in 25 minutes. We arrive after a half hour and they have no idea where our order is. After another 30 minutes of waiting they tell us the kitchen said they made it but the host staff said they didn't so they made it again and then we waited another 30 minutes for them to remake it. Not once did anyone apologize or even offer to adjust our bill. When we finally got our food one of our meals had been sitting at the host stand since the time we walked in door meaning it's not even safe to go serve. They could have offered us a beer but no. Not even that. Worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. I will never go back nor will I buy any of their beer.

LKSpXIpt8FPgK8_peDbbIQ.text: I love Fat Heads and really just enjoy the atmosphere.  They have plenty of very good beer options from their brewery,  and the food is always solid.  You can never go wrong with their giant sandwiches, and it's the only place where I'll get something different each time I go. I've yet to be disappointed.  Only complaint- parking.  Best to uber or take Lyft especially on a weekend night.

fEwcBxOxw-GqoyWpzxWDYw.text: Ate here a few weeks back and I found the sandwiches to be really good... and really GINORMOUS.  I didn't even get a sandwich they joked about being as big as your head... still TOO much.  Beers are the primary reason to come here though.  They have such a tasty variety of beer you can't go wrong.  The sandwiches were decent but I still enjoyed it because it was a novelty and something I don't get everyday in taste and size.  The wings we ordered... those were huge too... or wait, did we get the regular chicken legs?  Either way those were better than the sandwiches in my opinion.     I'd definitely go back but definitely not in the winter.  It was FRIGGIN COLD in that place.  Every time the door opened from a customer coming and going the place dropped in temperature another 5 degrees!!  I'd go in the summer or fall though so maybe next time we're in town for a Steelers' game.  For a Penguins' game we'll have to try someplace better insulated!

ZBhk3cjogIq0eH-_5bDOLQ.text: Bad Attitude.....obviously dont want the service....but thats on them.  Dont recommend if you want a good experience that is hassle free

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

k0rg2xoPvyaPOd6EypVPdA.text: I have no complaints about Fat Heads. Honestly, I can't think of one negative from my dinner there last night. There was a bit of a wait for a table so my husband and I got a drink at the bar. Huge beer menu, including many house brews! If you like ales, this is the place for you.. They told us 30 min for our wait, but it was only 15. Perfect.  The service was very prompt. We had drinks within 5 minutes, ordered our appetizers, and those were out within 10 min. We were never without a beverage and the waitress checked on us just enough times.    Most of their menu, including sauces, dressings, chili and soups is home made. You can tell by the flavors. The pulled pork chili was so good that I almost ordered another bowl. I wanted to stick my face into the bowl and get every last drop. My husband had the spinach and artichoke dip and felt the same way. Appetizer plates were licked clean!  We both opted for wings. He got the classic fried in Extra medium (like a wet cajun) and garlic parmesan. They were HUGE. He had no problem putting away 14 of them, though. I got the slow smoked, chargrilled whole wings because they are gluten free (and soy free!). Holy moly. They fell off the bone but still had super crispy skin. I got the Carolina sauce which is an amazing tangy (well, Carolina style) BBQ sauce with hints of honey mustard, vinegar and cumin. I asked for more sauce because they lightly brush them. I wanted my wings doused in this stuff because it was so good.   Overall, I cannot wait to come back! Their gluten free menu is gigantic and also includes GF buns, baguettes, and a wide selection of their menu, including apps, can be made gluten free. Just ask for a menu at the front!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pulled pork chili... amazing. Gluten free, soy free, homemade!
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome and extensive gluten free menu!
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome gluten free menu!

8Vftuhsf5J-MDyRV92gVAQ.text: Now a Southside tradition. Brews fantastic Beeler, has a large selection from which to choose and fantastic food selections for when you get munchies.   Strongly recommend a stop here if in Southside!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lots of fab drafts from which to choose.
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My &#34;headwich&#34; a Kielbasa and Pierogi combo  - Top 5 Award winner per Maxim magazine.
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ricks Tuna Melt.

XI6lmTr1sMnqwj-6s4oQWw.text: This place is big, loud, and always crowded. There's both inside and outside seating. The menu is vast, with sandwiches, burgers, salads and wings.  The beer selection is awesome, and the servers know their beers.  The sandwiches impress people because they're big, so big they're dubbed 'headwiches.'  I had a meatloaf headwich; it was very pickly, a strange flavor for meatloaf.  The headwiches come with hard, brittle, burnt house-made potato chips.  You can't substitute fries (it must throw their kitchen off or something).  The salads are just as big, but they have their own problems, like big, starchy, fried wedges of potatoes ostensibly called fries.  They're not fries.  They're not crispy, not soggy, and not creamy.  They come off like boiled potatoes and just don't work in the salad.  The best accompaniment to the beers are the wings, but be sure to stick with the fried wings and not that awful variation called the 'smoked wing.'  Pick your size, pick your sauce.  These are some of the biggest wings in Pittsburgh.

Bi0xgMLrw57-ph4uiakX2g.text: One of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh. Great beer selection - I always go with one of Fat Heads own brews (Head Hunter is one of my most favorite IPAs around). Big menu of casual food - the burgers in particular are very tasty. Fresh-cut fries are served in a massive portion. One downside is that there can sometimes be a big wait, but since they're on the No Wait app you can get in line before arriving which helps a lot.  Recently found out that they have a dedicated gluten free menu and are very careful about cross-contamination. That is awesome for people out there who have Celiac and/or other food allergies.

mX2y02QVrZy5gCjQp4bnZQ.text: This place is a southside staple! Forget Primantis brothers for a minute and focus on this sandwich loving, craft beer promoting establishment.   My current check ins don't accurately reflect how many times I've been here and introduced people to this fine restaurant. Let's begin why this a rare 5-star hotspot on my opinon:  The Food: Fat Heads boasts a large menu that is centered around what I like to call Up-Scale bar items such as: Wings, Sandwiches (I mean Headwiches), Salads, assortment of fried things, Nachos (#Love), and of course in house craft beer as well as a wide selection of other noteworthy craft brews. Side Note: They also have a few Cider selections from the best Cider producer in the area: Arsenal!!!   Beer: I just mentioned this in the above, however it deserves another mention. Fat Heads has  their own line of craft beer that any beer drinker can enjoy. In addition, they have a seasonal rotating wide selection of other breweries for one to choose from. Also as mentioned above, they have some Arsenal cider always on tap. Usually 2 - 3 types. Lastly, Liquor, I honestly don't know if they have liquor as the thought never crossed my mind to ask or request one and I don't feel like checking the online menu.   Atmosphere: The venue is open with ground floor seating that usually encompanies the view of a nearby flat screen TV. This place usually has ESPN or live sports on which is fine by me. Side Note: This place has outdoor like seating that is further covered and heated when the temp drops below 50.   TL;DR: Fat Heads is a Pittsburgh staple less known than another sandwich shop across town. This place has prime sandwiches, wings, salads, and everything in between. Sports bar for sure that has a wide rotating craft beer selection on tap and in bottle. Have an allergy, they offer Gluten Free rolls for all their sandwiches and believe, check me on this, a separate fryer as well.

yzupSDjrlxi4gL61QbOonQ.text: My first time at Fat Heads. The food was great. The wait well that is why it was a 4 star review. we were told 45 Min it was an hour and 15 mins. OK you have a great place to eat but be honest on the wait. The best part of the night was our waitress she was the best. My wife wanted a sangria to drink. You don't have sangria. So she suggested a honey crisp apple cider. That was the just right for my wife. As I said the food was fantastic. I'll be back!

P_kgV8dOtX-0yxHoEg-c8w.text: Busy atmosphere. The beer options are fantastic and the food is not bad either. You could easily share a burger with someone as the comes with a heaping helping of fries. Good place to meet friends after work or for a casual dinner. Will definitely be back.

obYekQRGes39vle-jw28pQ.text: This was our last stop during a mini crawl with some old college friends. This was a nice, low-key spot to end the night (we were proud we made it until midnight! Hahaha). We each had one drink and were able to sit at the bar. It wasn't too loud, wasn't crazy. The age of the crowd was perfect for us now (late 20s). I'd definitely come back.

T92v8isxeev28HsDdLtpIg.text: Sandwiches are as big as your head. Salads that can easily feed two. Make sure you are hungry when you go here. And oh the beer? Yes! They carry good micro brews and specialty beers on tap.  The place is always busy so be sure you call ahead, or be prepared to wait.   The only thing I don't like so that how you can't substitute chips for fries. But the chips are nice crispy home made kettle-style chips.  A Pittsburgh favorite and a must go.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

89phF1-Ac8hsapCyoGHn8Q.text: Fantastic food and tons of gluten free options for celiacs!!  Their gluten free bread is awesome and so are their ciders!! Definitely worth trying

vjTcGLblODCZY1wn-MnRHQ.text: This place had great food but extremely rude servers. I loved the burger I got and my friend really loved his cheesesteak, but the staff was extremely unpleasant. I called back about a missing item that I had left there and the hostess acted as if there were no managers or owners anywhere in the store. I was treated like a major inconvenience although I had been a paying patron of the restaurant. I most definitely will not be going back here again.

Tj7cyOfAXlDgSq_6XN4OIA.text: It has been awhile since I have been to Fat Heads but one thing is for sure.... I will be remembering to bring my appetite when I come here.    Excellent beer selection (they often have some Blueberry one that I who am not a beer lover loves).  Great service (every time I have been here I always felt well taken care of).  Good food... I will say I wanted to like everything more but I was so overwhelmed by the portion size that I got so full so fast that I did not get to sample any of my friends items and truly enjoy everything.  Bring your appetite... seriously.  I am not joking!    I am looking forward to going sometime when I have a little less in my belly so that I can truly experience everything (well, not everything) that Fat Heads has.

WhFLfdgRduTYeEyuofvFvQ.text: 2 adults, 2 children. Asked hostess if kids could finish their milkshakes there, we were going to eat and drink. They said no...so we left. Went 2 blocks down to Smokin Joes. We were welcomed with open arms. Fatheads loss. Will never go back

jkdHjDJWV5zg_GxjFwKfWQ.text: OMG!!!!  This place is fantastic!  If you're ever in the area, get here and order some delicious food. The atmosphere is perfect and the nachos were the best I've ever had.  Go on a Sunday and you don't have to pay for parking on the street.

aGvqbmVqmxmyGSH7CBSHeA.text: This is my first time eating at Fat Heads and overall it was an okay experience. The staff was very nice and the food was good as well. The only downside to my trip here was the 45 minute wait to get a table. However, we were able to get drinks from the bar while the wait ensued.  I had to get McMinns Chicken Dance sandwich because it sounded delicious on the menu. It wasn't a bad sandwich, it had a little bit of flavor but nothing that really wowed me. The fresh chips that came with the sandwich were good.   For a 45 minute wait, Fat Heads would not be my first choice with the hundreds of places that are on the south side strip to eat and hang out. Dont get me wrong this place is definitely something to try, however if you have to wait a while, it's not that special.

GA59ipn3CJSsIzVP-AH_Ew.text: Loved the fathead brewery beer selections had other local brewery beer as well. If I were rating just the beer I would give it 5 stars however I did eat there as well. The food we ordered was good and noticed the claim to fame there must be the burgers and sandwiches they were huge and looked delicious. I had the smoked wings which were big and nice flavor. The garlic fries were very good. I will come back again.

JW17WPXyq4W9womG12LcDw.text: Great food, great beer, great staff!  What more could you ask for?  Oh yeah, great value during their 4-6 Happy Hour when all the Fathead's brewed beers are half price.

BOQoq4EnLcNhQ88W_baJqQ.text: Are you in the mood for a super-filling, American meal--or just some great munchies--and an excellent draft list?  Then head on over to Fat Heads, because they've got you covered--from head to toe!  I came here with a friend for dinner on Thurs. evening at around 7pm, and we were seated immediately, despite that the Steelers were playing at 8pm.  Having perused the reviews and the extensive menu ahead of time, I knew what I wanted, and was able to make recommendations for my friend.  We started out with some Arsenal cider drafts (red raspberry for me, amber for him), which were great (I feel confident saying this for him, too, since he drank his in about 5 min. flat).  Per my recommendation, we ordered a pretzel with honey mustard sauce, and when it came out, we devoured it in 5 min. flat, as well.  (The pretzels and sauce here are much better and less salty than those at Hofbrauhaus, so be sure to try one!)  For entrees, I went with the grown-up grilled cheese on rye and the chicken parmesan soup, and my friend ordered the Beauty and the Beastie headwich, which is filled with pulled pork and hot sauce.  The grilled cheese, which consists of herbed goat cheese, fontina, chopped basil, and sun-dried tomatoes, was excellent, and I'd highly recommend it as a headwich alternative.  The homemade potato chips that came with it are the best I've had to date--much better than the ones at Burgatory.  On the other hand, despite its interesting concept and description, I found the chicken parm soup lackluster in flavor. I had pictured a cream or broth-based soup, but it was actually tomato based, and its saltiness and tomato flavor overwhelmed the chicken, which there wasn't as much of as I expected.  I ended up using the potato chips to scoop up and eat most of the soup, which (believe it or not) helped cut its salty, bland flavor.  My friend devoured his headwich, leaving very little of the pulled pork, so again, I feel confident in saying he enjoyed it.  While I managed to clean my plates (impressing the waiter), he ended up taking home most of his chips.  Service was prompt and friendly, and the ambience was casual and relaxed at the time we visited.  We sat inside because it was cool and I hadn't brought a jacket, but still managed to find some interesting people watching at the table diagonal from us (one chick with faux dreds was doing some interesting jamming to the music).  Since we arrived prior to the Steelers game, the Pens game was on TV for most of the time we were there, but at one point, one of the waitstaff inexplicably changed the channel on one TV to Home Shopping Network (per customer request, I'm assuming--but who watches HSN at Fat Heads?).  Many times, in judging the quality of food that a restaurant serves, I feel that my rating hinges on what I order.  In general, I tend to stick to dishes a place is known for or that other reviewers recommend, in order to ensure that my experience is representative.  Occasionally, however, I will deviate if a restaurant has a very good reputation, which sometimes turns out well and other times, not so much. Based on the food and my experience, my rating for Fatheads would have merited 5 stars if I'd stuck to the recommended pretzel and grilled cheese. Nevertheless, in keeping with procedure, I feel that I must deduct half a star for the bland and salty chicken parm soup.  4.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken parm soup and red raspberry Arsenal cider
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grown-up grilled cheese
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beauty and the Beastie headwich

CVMwE5BkAV6Uz029sVwohg.text: Chicken wings, ribs, and blueberry beer were out of this world. Best wings I've had in my life. Will come back again.

u04kHes4FdrLtPIt9t8seg.text: The atmosphere at Fatheads was nice. There was a bar area and then a small restaurant area, so if you'd like to eat here, you may have to wait a little while. They have a large selection of draft beers, including there own. I personally don't like beer, but they had 3 ciders available as well. I ordered a salad, which was not great. I felt like I could have made an equivalent one at home. While I didn't have a sandwich, they looked fantastic, so if suggest ordering one of those!

5pcTooHTuclY4EqgDmnJjw.text: Fat Heads is more of a Pittsburgh staple in my repertoire than anything else.  Do they put fries on their sandwiches?... no. Has it been around forever?... no. Do they now produce their beer in the Cleveland area?... yes. Do rivers of IC Light flow from the taps on a daily basis?...  absolutely not.  What does flow from Fat Heads taps is a glorious display of self-brewed staples and other craft treats...  all of which are needed to wash down the absolutely monstrous portion sizes this place has.  Dieters take warning... even the salads are gargantuan.  Often wise size comes sacrificed quality, but this isn't the case.  I've yet to have something at Fat Heads I've disliked except for the incessant wait times.  A tip to those who haven't been there before.  When you put your name in at the hostess (they don't take reservations), they'll ask for your phone number to enter it into their system.  If there aren't seats available at Fat Heads bar, take advantage of the often 45 min - 1 hr wait to walk across the street to Piper's Pub (or any of the other 10+ bars in close vicinity) to grab a drink while you wait.

zfHWTzX3pX-c6rGbBco9Gg.text: This place is a joyful heart attack.  A pal took my wife and I to Fat Heads when we were in town for a quick visit, and it did not disappoint. Gigantic sandwiches/burgers and beers went directly into our bellies.  I failed to take notice of what everyone else ordered (I believe our friend got a Portobello mushroom burger of some build, and my wife got some sort of fried-egg Agro-crag), but I know I had a burger with a beef patty, pastrami and an egg, among other toppings.  I could not even get to eating the chips that came with that monster.  A nice beer selection, as well.  I do come short of doling out a 5-star review as I felt like the table was a little sticky, the chairs were a little beat up and uncomfortable, but I think that's part of the schtick of the place.  Would definitely recommend trying, but you may need 24-48 hours of nap-time before eating/drinking anything else.

pG8HRjwU6hKhXO6WfD0bNQ.text: If you've ever wanted to die by food-induced coronary, I've found you Fat Heads.  Over the course of our al fresco evening here, ten of us sampled the following fat-saturated delights:  ~ Cornmeal crusted, deep fried Buffalo-Style Shrimp. ~ Deep-fried cheese 'n' potato Pierogies with a side of sour cream. ~ A giant plate of Garlic Fries dusted with Parmesan and parsley. ~ The Artery Clogger Headwich: two fried eggs, bacon, ham, American cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and mayo between one big-ass bun. ~ Two of "Maxim" magazine's #5 sandwich in all the land, The Southside Slopes Headwich.  This bad boy has a split kielbasa, fried pierogies, American cheese, grilled onions and horseradish sauce on one of those head-sized buns. ~ A Tuna Steak Sandwich with char-grilled yellowfin, lettuce, tomato, onion and garlic-Parm mayo. ~ The Best BLT served on rye and topped with -- what else? -- American cheese and mayo. ~ Cajun Tuna Taco Press, Cajun-spiced yellowfin, black olives, cilantro tomatoes, cucumber, lettuce, red onion and taco sour cream sauce panini-pressed in a flour tortilla.  All burgers, the Fried Fish Sammie, and the Tuna Steak Sammie come with hand-cut fries; everything else comes with hand-cut homemade potato chips.  The menu literally dictates absolutely no substitutions since it's a "complete hassle" for the kitchen to switch.  Really?  It's all deep-fried potato.  So how were the heart-attacks on a plate?  Stick with what Fat Head's known for, those Headwiches and burgers, because they were the runaway stand-outs (and you could literally feel your arteries hardening with each sloppy, greasy bite), enjoyed tremendously by those what ordered them.  Everything else was just OK; my Cajun Tuna Taco Press, and FIL's Tuna Steak Sandwich -- both requested rare -- came out regrettably cooked within an inch of their beautiful lives.  For me, the greater pleasure here were the beers.  Fat Head's menu of standard draughts is rather uninspired and unadventurous -- Yuengling, Bell's Oberon, Guinness, Sierra Nevada, Newcastle, Smithwick's -- but their own creations are where it's at.  We sampled their Alpenglow Weizenbock, a banana-y, bubble-gum-y dark unfiltered wheat brew with toasted malt overtones.  I loved their Mexicali Smoke, too, a chipotle-spiced rauchbier.  Husband was exceptionally disappointed that they'd run out of their award-winning Head Hunter IPA, however, since he's in love with that bitter style.  Carson Street reminded me of Adams-Morgan-meets-Georgetown in the worst possible way on our post-eleven-pm-Saturday-night visit with gaggles of bachelorette parties shrieking at the tops of their lungs and hosts of popped-collar fratties clogging the streets.  Fat Heads, too, was wall-to-wall with drunken, raucous and phenomenally loud groups of young'uns.  I'm too old for all those shenanigans anymore; if I return to Fat Heads, it'll be for the Portly Fellow Headwich I *should* have ordered, and it'll be at the early-bird hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fat Head&#39;s Alpenglow Weizenbock.

xjs0vkRu0fw-6nCm1wugiw.text: Man oh man.  I spent so many hours (and $$$) here while going to Pitt. Everytime I come back to Pitt I look forward to coming back. But lately it seems that Fat Heads has gone downhill!  1) The beer doesn't rotate as much as it used to.  2) Fat Heads doesn't seem as busy as it used to be. This seems like a result of many bars on Carson carrying similar beer for less $. Sure, it gets crowded before games, but not much activity after 10 pm.  The food is still good - love the Spicy Parm sandwich and the chips. This place just changed a bit since I was in school here.

rK6CCAe6srjUrquMkmFCCw.text: A friend and I went to fat heads Saturday night for the first time, the wait for 2 was an hour and a half. Every restaurant on a weekend night is busy let's be honest but it took almost two hours for us to sit finally, not complaining too much tho because we were killing time. We sat and ordered an appetizer. We got "Pedro's nachos" and my god they were a huge portion and used fresh made potato chips over tortilla and they were amazing! I got a Renees chicken club that was rather good. Even though the wait was long our food came out in a timely fashion. All in all in you're into large portions and great bar food I recommend fat heads, it was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fatheads, Pedro nachos!! So delicious

5kXBbRziQowWkV3kdEEv3w.text: Food and beer are fantastic.  Service can run from 'aloof' to 'attentive' and just about everything in between.  House beers (brewed off site, so technically not a brewpub) are amazing.  Try the house smoked wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half-eaten buffalo cauliflower
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beer sampler/flight.

tMwCRge2xdENfg7-Vt4vtw.text: Yep, it's all they say it is, with big ole fat head telling me to have another Bumbleberry!  Great beers and good service.  Energetic atmosphere.  Had the charbroiled wings.  Original is hot with a nice, but not over the top heat.  I highly recommend for good time, great food and solid waitstaff.

gLOK0GR7p8-tFJGABvYCGw.text: Suicide by killer sauce.  It seems like each time I go to Fat Heads I leave wishing I had tried something else.  Not because what I had was bad, but because the menu is just that good.  Fat Heads also brings it with their expansive and fair priced beer list.  Their house brews are top notch and should not be forgotten.  Before I briefly talk about the food I feel like I should mention that the reason Fat Heads is losing a star is not because of the food or drinks, but because the service often leaves something to be desired.  When Fat Heads is full and you put your name on the wait list be prepared to be misquoted, forgotten in the shuffle, and treated rudely when asking for updates.  Drinks often don't get refilled and you always feel like you are a bother to the majority of the staff.  If the food wasn't so good I'd avoid Fat Heads.  Onto the food!  I'd have to say my 3 favorite dishes at Fat Heads would be the Fiery Voodoo Killer Burger, which is not for the faint of heart.  The Killer sauce is amazing spicy, but is hands down my favorite wing sauce in the city.  Sweet, salty, and spicy. The Southside Slopes, pierogies on a sandwich?!  This sandwich was voted into Maxim's top sandwich list for a reason.  Kielbalsa, pierogies, horseradish, and grilled onions, nothing else needs said.  And finally the char grilled wings with the aforementioned Killer sauce.  Get a cold IPA and dig in.  Fat Heads is worth rolling the dice with poor service.

dC4n7AFq_WOUazzcJFWl-w.text: They were great at explaining all the different types of beers.  Very generous on the samples!!!

ijBG0yQZCTJwG8SlLPr6RQ.text: Fat Heads is a perfectly solid option. I don't spend a lot of time on the South Side, but whenever I do, Fat Heads is always a viable dinner option. Their portions are HUGE, their food is pretty good, and they always have their own Fat Heads brew on tap, which often includes the Bumbleberry, which if you haven't had it, I heartily recommend.  Everything is pretty good, and because everything is consistent, it is normally PACKED inside, and the wait times can get a little long. This isn't really anything I can fault Fat Heads for, but it is something that is normally a factor in whether or not I end up going to Fat Heads.  Solid bar food, pleasant atmosphere, nice beer selection. It's not a bad place to spend a dinner!

UBP47UJyTOWIHv9vUGxpCg.text: Always a great place to come to.  Surprise there was no wait today.  Food is always faNtastic.  Monstrous portions, no matter what you get you cant go wrong.  We love it.  I recommend highly the fried mushrooms

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried mushrooms
Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

URtGDjraQgalWhvI1PLdVQ.text: The only reason Fat Heads does not get a 5 star from me, and I know this is nit-picking, is that it's so darn loud inside.  I have to yell to be heard and have to lean in to hear, but that is the only thing wrong with this place.  Every sandwich I have had was a masterpiece of flavors and textures.  Last night I had the Chicken Little which was another amazing sandwich.  Rarely do I NOT have a favorite dish at a restaurant, but Fat Heads is my exception.  I want to try something new every time I stop in because I know it's going to be delicious.  It's usually a wait to sit down but it's worth every minute when you're taking that first bite of some of the greatest sandwich concoctions thought up.  So you're thinking, "How could there be any more win packed into this place?"  I haven't mentioned that Fat Heads brews their own beer.  Boom.  I had their chocolate stout last night and it was on par with any delicious chocolate stout I've had.  Well done, Fat Heads.  Well done.  Recommended?  Most definitely.

0rjkkBD4GKiqC9DP-R0RAw.text: Great good and beer!  Food portions are very large!  Only downside.......very loud atmosphere.

Wf7CenkhaIzDfJJz4A1RMw.text: I checked this place out because I remembered seeing it on TV and I wanted to try something different on this trip to Pittsburgh, and boy am I glad that I did!  I started out by ordering one of their own brews, Bumbleberry, a honey blueberry ale garnished with what else but fresh, sweet blueberries. It was delicious and a perfect fit for a hot day.   As an appetizer, even though it was hot outside, I had to try the Chicken Parmesan soup. The soup was an awesome tomato and meat base with chunks of chicken, all covered up by a layer of provolone and parmesan and broiled until bubbly and delicious. It was fantastic!  For my entree, I ordered the PCI (Pretty Cool Italian Club) and it was mammoth and did not disappoint! The sandwich starts out with a layer of banana peppers then stacks of salami, ham, cappicola and pepperoni, melted cheese, sliced hard-boiled eggs, lettuce, tomato and onions and held together with a flavorful rosemary mayo! Served along side this beast was a heaping portion of their fresh cut chips which were the perfect complement to the sandwich (or, as they prefer to say, "headwich").  The food and beer was great but the staff are an equal part of why I will definitely return. My bartender, Joe, was the best. A great personality from he and the other bar staff made for an extremely pleasant visit! I will definitely return whenever I am in Pittsburgh!

PLTndAQV1f22nh4TISESeQ.text: Every time I come here I get their grilled wings - you can not go wrong with their grilled wings. First of all you get the ENTIRE wing, it's not those little wing dings you get at other places. And I think this is one of the only, if not THE only place in the city that serves grilled wings. I order the wings plain and ask for a couple different flavored sauces on the side to dip in (because my indecisiveness won't allow me to just choose one flavor - I can't be alone on this amirite???) their grilled wings are always great tasting. That being said about the food, the service inside, not that great. One of the reasons I go out places in the first place is to have a relaxing meal and not have to cook. Another experience is a misunderstanding, I've never ordered the normal fried wings. I placed an order for grilled wings over the phone, but when I arrived to pick up my order I see that they prepared fried wings...mind you I ordered for my boyfriend and I so I ordered 30 wings (my boyfriends appetite is insane lol) so when I get there to see that the wrong wings were given to me I was a little frustrated considering we live 30 minutes away and drove all the way there only to see that the order was wrong. What do you think the right thing to do would be? Probably have the employees apologize for getting the order wrong and say they will prepare what I actually ordered? NOPE. This place tried to charge me to have them remake my order!! Horrible customer service I paid already for the wrong order and now they are saying they're not going to make what I ordered unless I pay for them. Horrible experience. I asked to speak to someone else who eventually said they would remake and I would not have to pay, meanwhile I'm thinking "WELL YA! I should not have to pay for YOUR employees mistake" at the end of the day, we got our right order that we originally ordered, it was 40 minutes later, but we got them. Probably won't be back though for this reason.

CGu7pHvv-uK2p1HSceBk5g.text: Recently visited one of my fav spots and was so disappointed.  They cut the menu down from 4 pages to 2 pages of food. Gone are the onion rings & brisket sandwich I wrote about in my last review.  So many items are gone in place of more " trendy items". When we asked why the change, we were told "just changing with the times". Well I ordered the original steak and 10 mild wings since I couldn't get what I wanted. The wings had hardly any sauce on them.  The steak was the same as usual so that saved my lunch. Don't know if I'll ever go back, just not the same.

aGum7IdrS4OX8kLEIRnmyw.text: I don't understand why this place is so popular. I only go here when one of my friends drags me. The wait is long, the food is always overcooked and bland, the bartenders and servers are rude, and the prices are too high for the quality of food. Last time I tried (again) to eat a burger and fries. And the burger was like a burnt hockey puck (again). They try to be something unique, gourmet, and special, but they always miss the mark.

o51ybz9m_uMEvJ8YE7fcVA.text: Eh. I used to come here back in the day (like a decade ago) and loved it, because Pittsburgh didn't really have anything like it. The draft selection is fantastic, always has been. The service is very nice, always has been. But I remember the food being a lot better... Maybe my palate has changed? Maybe it's just because it's so successful and commercial now that they don't really have to try? Whatever it is, the food is just ok. The wings are good, but not worth the eternal wait there always is to get seated. The "smoked" meats are pretty subpar for what they're going for - that sort of "craft beer, craft food." The bread they use for the sandwiches is a step up from the cheap stuff, but nothing great. The food in general is much better than fast food or crappy restaurants, but for what else is on the Pittsburgh scene nowadays it's nothing special. The chips are made fresh, but they aren't seasoned - it's weird things like that that perplexes me about this menu... There are also no substitutions allowed, because it's always so crowded, and honestly they're so popular they don't have to cater to people anymore. Again, it's a completely fine and acceptable place, good even, but for me it's not really worth the crowds and the wait. Maybe for you it will be; it's worth a shot if you've never been to decide for yourself.

IhgC45U2rWwUfltyKoN7oA.text: Live in south side been going to fatheads since they opened lately I have been so disappointed, their new menu is terrible the choices are now so limited :( I usually order take out the last 3 times they got my order wrong and amount of food has been almost cut in half not to mention the prices went up! So bummed out use to b my favorite.

EN0qahNHh2uJynv9PKLa9A.text: One of my favorite places on Earth. They have a huge beer selection, including several of their own beers. They're food is unique in style and tastes incredible. Always good vibes. I recommending getting in early to avoid the inevitable crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Enjoying a @FatHeadsBeer Sunshine Daydream IPA at @FatHeadsPGH. A perfect lunch time beer.

pXcaKYJ9FOzptcdsLe87Gw.text: Just passing though and found this place on the internet. We are from CA and wanted a local spot to eat. We picked a winner. The sandwiches may be the best we have ever had. Completely different but great. They even had our local San Diego beer Ballast Point on tap.

CJN80xlLDVn3ngaapOumFg.text: This place is always a good time, happy hour, dinner or late night drinks! The food has never failed to satisfy and the drinks are reasonable! The serving staff is overall pleasant, minus the occasional 'bad day' face. I try something different on the menu every time I go simply because it all sounds so good!   And, I'm going to get slapped for this I'm  sure, the only minor thing i would suggest be altered slightly would be the tasty homemade potato chips. A majority of the time I've gotten them - they have been under seasoned and overly greasy in taste. I wouldn't mind a bit of salt and slightly less grease.   Other than that, everything has always been perfect!

FvFwDF7H_c8XJF3gyRkagQ.text: Positives:  Fun atmosphere, fun and creative menu, amazzziiinng bumbleberry beer (seriously, try it.)  Negatives: Slow service (the place was packed), French onion soup that was basically salt water, & cold, bland, and chewy pierogies.  Verdict:  A fun place to hang out and have a beer if you're not in a hurry, but seriously mediocre food.

YFynLqQECPVjoCAPsePdQw.text: Amazing.  I couldn't have asked for anything better!  We did wait, but the nice thing is that they call you instead of holding a pager - so being in a prime location, we decided to go bar hop and just came back when they called me!  It was great.  The food was amazing.  If you're looking for calorie loaded, grease leaking, mouth watering, heart stopping food then look no further!  We LOVED it.  It was my two girlfriends and myself and our eyes were bigger than our stomachs (mind you we had our beer goggles on).  We decided to get two different burgers and appetizer to share - we could barely finish it all which is so unlike us!  We got the nacho appetizer that I would recommend to ANYONE.  It's made on their house made chips and is honestly to die for.  I can't wait to go back and to check out their other location near my house (NE OH).  I'll have to wait until I get another diet cheat day, it'll cost me my month of them!

KdxLCZydC7giI8fMcLF5WA.text: Always decent wings and a good assortment of beer, but I've never found the place all that engaging.  It's all very business like eating, drinking, and TV staring without a whole lot of interaction with the bartenders or staff.  Granted, it is always crazy busy and a good place for a warm day, so I understand the pace of place pretty well.  Would just like to be able to feel more relaxed about clogging my arteries with the types of food and drink that I love so well.

jzSlCICMfWeMRBCQI4lskA.text: Impressive beer selection and extremely friendly bartender. Gave us several beer samples to help us decide. I've been several times, and you can't go wrong with any of them :)

photos.caption: Photo of Fat Heads Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ym10Gw_TQsVo6PaPeHZPbw.text: Emily is Exceptional! We enjoyed spectacular service and fabulous food. The garlic fries were fresh-cut, delicious yummies. Enormous portions were highlighted by a grand selection of beers and hard ciders. Wished I had tried the pierogies for my first-time visit.

eXMkHPgQqlTbKfCcLO03hw.text: Great place to hang out. Lively atmosphere, awesome beer selections and amazing food. It's the perfect combination of food and fun.

1o1i6xGD_ijReeKcxnB5_w.text: I love Fatheads!  I used to frequent this place often for the steak salads and the sandwiches.  The food comes more than you can eat for a great price.  Good quality service and great tasting food.  This is one of those places you tell out of towners to visit so expect a wait at the door.

AnjNxvPJacxAQy02TSuwwQ.text: LOVED IT!  The other reviewers aren't kidding about the menu, it's like a litany to food and it takes some time to figure out what item on it makes you drool the most.  I had the renee burger:  american cheese, bacon, sauteed mushrooms, and cheddar cheese sauce, with fries.  It was a plate of food that I could never even hope finish, every bite delicious.  Bonus, even though it was like 1130AM when I ate there, when I asked our waitress if I could have a shot of absolut citron, she didn't even blink before exclaiming "absolutely!"  I'll definitely go back (when I'm hungrier!)

YTMgEjDC5A-c7Lg5q3B1hA.text: Omigosh! The Fathead's Headhunter IPA was fabulous as were the chicken wings and burger. Everything was five star!

UtFTAGIODbro8Rz4PG872Q.text: Tonight, we were here with my spouse and I can't understand why people gave so many stars to this place. Nothing special at all!!! Portions are huge but quantity and quality issue ??? I got the aggressive onion burger and spouse got the double-d  headwich. The sandwich was full of marinara sauce, I mean come on. The more sauce you put on something the more suspicious we get! The burger was dry, not fun to eat at all. Seriously save your money and go to 5 guys, Burgatory or even any other place. The one star is only for the enormous selection of beers!

_R8brgCYVA63Aw5QgXKCOQ.text: Touristy, pricey, but good. I had a turkey mushroom swiss melt. It had great flavor. Not a fan of the homemade chips, but I don't like chips. The drinks were okay. Two sandwiches, cheeses sticks & 2 drinks ended being $70.00......that is high in my book!

iCdUMSd2HQ4n1S0OZbrDHA.text: Good food. Real good food. Had the Rosemary chicken sandwich and tuna salad. Both very well put together. Huge portions. Lousy service. Started with the bartender who took forever to get to us. Carried over to table service. Had a guy who just didn't give a care what we wanted, when we got it, or how we were doing. Dropped our food off and didn't return for nearly 10 minutes. Not a big deal if you have eating utensiles but we didn't. Had to call out to him to get us some. Had to get our own extra napkins. No refills. Had to ask for to go boxes. Tipped him a more than generous 10%.

gt7fRZRZ2zn0DdYlZS_Q1g.text: Only go to this place if 1. Your stomach is eating itself because you're so hungry and 2. You're not on any sort of diet. The food is delicious, but the sandwiches have so much stuff on them, like, my favorite the beer camp (kielbasa, bbq sauce, cheese, bacon, pepper-kraut, and 1000 island dressing).

WArmuUS1Mm8Cp2nUV1CXpw.text: The sandwiches are like no other and the wings are great and even can be ordered grilled. The beer selection is absurd.

V19BlCXCqpqMR5AGkDkV9g.text: They have a huge selection of drinks, and their menu is absolutely HUGE.  I have eaten here several times and here are some of the things I recommend:   French onion soup, wings (especially the parmesean sause), and the artichoke dip  Do not recommend: loaded nachos (way too greasy), char grilled wings of any kind (very dry and over cooked).  I have never had a burger here but it looks HUUUUUUUGE, and i definetly want to try one, at some point when I come here and i'm starving.   the atmosphere is cool and trendy, and this place is overall very fun.

mwqfciWysgZA0PyfIRJp3w.text: Good service, good beer, food is LARGE! A pleasant Sunday afternoon.

2I13cdDw-tXCIHEX5zNmkg.text: Great bar -- crowded but a really nice crowd.  Great beer selection.  Huge sandwiches and fantastic grilled wings.  Try the Killer sauce.  Every city needs a Fatheads.  Love this place

u7qCF67FIoN4QdeN2Rp95A.text: Food is okay. (Womens) Bathrooms are nasty, my friend had a mouse crawl over his feet (Sunday 6/23/2013) And when staff was informed, they said it had run into the kitchen and someone stepped on it. Oh okay.. Problem solved? Never been particularly impressed with service either, but that doesn't bother me much.

4p37cNjmkIXzFTrpi_-AdQ.text: This place is everything it claims to be! We had yummy sandwiches, tasty beers, and left not only with a fat head, but a fat belly, too!! I tried the Southside Slopes (kielbasa and pierogies on a bun) which won a national Best Sandwich Award. Wow! The homemade beers were exceptional as well. This place definitely made our trip to Pittsburgh one we'll never forget.

X3kQbTKu-kTDAcEjZ2bgZw.text: This place ROCKS!  We thoroughly enjoyed our Headwiches, great flavor combinations and portions are huge!

lHelwDnaXU59uhZbbUm83A.text: Would have loved to eaten here but the wait was ridiculous. The host was rude when we were trying to be seated and stopped talking to us mid conversation to take care of something else. They need to find a faster way to seat their customers if they want my business.

ibLI4uLnYp8Kenkw00HzlQ.text: Got reprimanded by the bartender when I ordered a beer that was out and quickly looked at the taps to order what I thought was a different one and it ended up being the same beer. I didn't know.  Wait staff was very friendly.  Too much food.

_OponJ9dkJ2iuKPMVDOwNw.text: Great beer selection, great food (wings), friendly staff. Want to go back soooo bad.

RZzP_Wf3dsg2frBCA45ycQ.text: If you dare, go for the Voodoo combo.  Voodoo Monkey Stout & chase it down with the Voodoo Killer burger.  The burger was hot as hell but well worth the pain.  The staff was quick & the suggestion of Pedros Nachos was spot on.  It fills up fast but you'll be glad you hung out.  One of the guys got the Beer Camp and was the envy of the rest of the table.
